loans.name: Kenneth

texts.en:
Kenneth is an old client to the institution; he operates an electronic shop in Rukungiri town which he has done for over eight years. He has been taking loans from Ugafode which has enabled him to sustain and expand his business. 

He recently he took a loan of UGX 5,000,000 to add stock like radios, TVs, phones and other electronics to his business to serve more clients. Kenneth decided to join Ugafode for financial assistance since his capital alone couldn’t meet the needs of the customer, so with the financial assistance of Ugafode he has been able to serve more clients and increase his earnings. 

Kenneth praises Ugafode for their financial assistance which has enabled him to sustain his business and meet the financial needs of his family, and enable him to accumulate assets like land.

loans.use: to buy radios, television sets, phones and other electronic items to sell.

loans.name: Ludivina

texts.en:
Ludivina 52 years old, and is married with six children who are still in school. 

She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Ludivina has a tailoring business in the Philippines, and has been in this business for 21 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase more materials like fabric, threads, zippers, etc. for her business.

In the future, Ludivina would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more materials like fabric, threads, zippers, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Yvonne

texts.en:
Yvonne is 31 years old. She is married with four children aged between 3 and 12 years, all of whom go to school. 

She has a shop and has been running a business for six years. With the loan, she would like to buy more sugar, rice, salt, and cooking oil to resell. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, rice, salt, and cooking oil to resell.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
La socia   pertenece SIEMPRE UNIDOS, él banco está ubicado en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Margarita tiene 34 años de edad, casada y tiene 02 hijos, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose a trabajar para una empresa privada en el área de venta de productos  de primera necesidad, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su trabajo el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su trabajo, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando  a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de víveres como arroz,azúcar,leche entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the "Siempre Unidos" (Always United) communal bank.  The communal bank is located in Cusco Province, Cusco Department.
The member is Margarita.  She is 34-years old, married and has two children.  She spends her days keeping up with her domestic chores and working for a private company selling basic necessities.  She has been in her job quite a while, and it is going well for her thanks to the hard work she puts into it each day.  She hopes to keep working so she can keep helping her family. 
Margarita is requesting the loan to purchase supplies, like rice, sugar, milk and other items. 
She feels grateful for the loan she has been granted and promises to comply with her established repayment plan.

loans.use: to purchase supplies such as rice, sugar, milk and other items.

loans.name: Khoeun

texts.en:
Khoeun, who is 40 years old, is living in a community of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has three dependent children who are currently in school. 

To support the family, she is working very hard on her own rice farmland by growing and selling the crop to the local dealers and customers in market. 

The net profit that she can generate is USD 5 a day, on average. Besides being a rice farmer, she has another agricultural business which is raising ducks for sale.

Currently, she is requesting a Kiva loan to buy duck food for her ducklings. With the support from this loan, she hopes that all of her ducklings grow better and faster. She is thankful for the generosity.

loans.use: to buy duck food for her ducklings

loans.name: Noemi Abarca

texts.es:
La socia Noemi Abarca  se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de productos naturales, la socia es una mujer emprendedora que por medio de este pequeño negocio quiere salir adelante,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los productos naturales. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar productos naturales.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Noemi Abarca continues to manage her business of selling natural products. Through this small business, this enterprising woman is able to get ahead. Her dream is to have a shop where she can sell natural products.

Noemi Abarca is requesting a loan in order to buy natural products. She is pleased with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to buy natural products.

loans.name: Valerie

texts.en:
Valerie is 39 years old and married with eight children.

She earns a living by having a pig-fattening business in the Philippines. Valerie is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Valerie has been in pig fattening for eight years and also earns additional income from a lumber yard.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
La socia Norma se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de articulos de loseria,la socia es una mujer emprendedora y por medio de este negocio la socia quiere salir adelante,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los articulos de loseria.La socia solicita el credito para comprar azucareras,platos y ollas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Norma continues to manage her business of selling dishware. Through her business, this enterprising woman is able to get ahead. Her dream is to have a shop where she can sell dishware.

Norma is requesting a loan in order to buy sugar bowls, plates, and pots. She is pleased with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to buy sugar bowls, plates, and pots.

loans.name: Hermenegildo

texts.es:
Hermenegildo tiene 69 años de edad, es casado. Su familia es unida, vive con su esposa e hijos en casa propia en una comunidad grande del distrito de Cayaltí, ubicado en la provincia Chiclayo, de la región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú. La población de este distrito se dedica al comercio, agricultura y ganadería.

El se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales como patos, gallinas y cuyes desde hace más de 15 años, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su propio domicilio. Cuenta con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El presente crédito será utilizado para la compra de una mayor cantidad de animales así como para realizar reparaciones y mantenimiento del lugar donde los cría, con esto Hermenegildo espera brindar un mejor producto a sus clientes satisfaciendo sus gustos y preferencias lo que le generará mayores ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Hermenegildo is 69 years old and married. His family is united, and he lives with his wife and children in their own house in a large community in the district of Cayalti, located in the province of Chiclayo, in the Lambayeque region, on the north coast of Peru. The population of this district makes their living in shops, agriculture, and raising livestock. 

He has worked raising and selling animals such as ducks, hens, and guinea pigs for more than 15 years. His business is located in his own home. He counts on very good personal and work references in his area. This loan will be used to buy a larger quantity of animals, as well as to make repairs and maintain the place where they're raised. With this, Hermenegildo hopes to provide better products to his customers, satisfying their needs and preferences, which will generate better profits and thus improve his and his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of animals as well as to make repairs and maintain the place where they're raised.

loans.name: Rodrigo Salomon

texts.es:
Rodrigo Salomon tiene 54 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive casa propia de material noble en la provincia de Morropón, región Piura, en la costa norte del Perú. Los habitantes de esta zona se dedican a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

La actividad que desarrolla Rodrigo Salomon es la venta de plátanos y cacao los cuales vende a la ciudad de Chiclayo, cuenta con un terreno agrícola propio, además de tener una mototaxi la cual utiliza como medio de transporte del producto así como para brindar servicio de transporte. El destino del crédito será para la compra de abonos y fertilizantes para el mantenimiento de su terreno agrícola así como también para realizar arreglos en su mototaxi, con esto Rodrigo Salomon espera mejorar la calidad de su cultivo lo que le generará mayores niveles de ingreso y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Rodrigo Salomon is 54 years old and in a common-law relationship. He lives in his own house that is made of basic materials. Rodrigo resides in Morropón Province, which is in the region of Piura on the northern coast of Peru. The residents of this area engage in agriculture, livestock breeding, and trade.

Rodrigo Salomon’s business involves selling bananas and cacao in the city of Chiclayo. He has his own farmland. In addition, he also has a motorcycle taxi that he uses to transport his product and to provide transportation services.

This loan will be used to buy compost and fertilizers so that he can maintain his farmland. He will also make repairs to his motorcycle taxi. With this loan, Rodrigo Salomon hopes to improve the quality of his crops so that he can generate a higher level of income and eventually improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to buy compost and fertilizers so that he can maintain his farmland and to pay for repairs to his motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She is 48 years old and has two children who are in school.

She has a lumpia-wrapper-making business in the Philippines. Thelma requested a PHP 15000 loan amount through NWTF to buy equipment for her business.

Thelma has been in this business for eight years. In the future, she  would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy equipment for her spring-roll wrapper-making business

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is 61 years old and widowed.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Leonora is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Leonora has been in pig fattening for 12 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase different kinds of accessories and clothes for resale.

loans.name: Ugul

texts.en: Ugul is a strong woman. She was born in 1964. She lives in a small town. She is married. She has three children. For about 12 years, Ugul and her husband have been doing business. She bakes bread. She bakes tasty and traditional breads. Her husband sells the bread at the market. Ugul has many clients. Her bread is well known and famous for its tastes, smells and beauty. Every time she needs coals and firewood. She is asking for financial support to buy coal and firewood to bake bread.

loans.use: To buy coal and firewood, to bake bread

loans.name: Maria Bertilda

texts.es:
Maria Bertila tiene 39 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos y su cónyuge en una zona rural en el distrito de Oyotún, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte del Perú. Su comunidad se dedica básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral como patos, conejos, pollos, etc. desde hace 06 años, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Cuenta con clientela fija quienes brindan muy buenas referencias personales y laborales de ella. Solicita préstamo para la compra de más animales para aumentar el stock de su negocio así como para la compra de alimento balanceado para estos. Dicha inversión le servirá para tener mayor variedad y productividad en su negocio, lo que tendrá gran influencia en su nivel de ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Maria Bertila is 39 years old and in a common-law relationship. She lives in her own home along with her spouse and their two children. They reside in a rural area in the District of Oyotún in Chiclayo Province, which is in the region of Lambayeque on the northern coast of Peru. Her community is known for agriculture, livestock breeding, and trade.

Maria Bertila has been raising farm animals such as ducks, rabbits, chickens, and other livestock for six years. Her business is located at her house. She has an established clientele who have provided very good personal and work-related references on her behalf. Maria Bertila is requesting a loan in order to buy more animals so that she can increase the inventory of her business. She will also purchase balanced feed for her animals. This investment will result in greater variety and more productivity for her business, which will have a great influence on her income level and eventually her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more animals and balanced feed.

loans.name: Zubayda

texts.en:
Zubayda is a hardworking woman. She was born in 1993. She is single. She lives with family. She is from the eastern part of Tajikistan. 

She is a student. She studies in the city. She is a well-educated and responsive person. She likes to study. She tries not to miss classes. Teachers are reporting her as a good student. She has not enough money to pay tuition this year. She needs support to pay tuition.

loans.use: To pay tuition

loans.name: Yon

texts.en:
Yon, 38, lives in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has four dependent children in total. To make a living and support her family, she manages and operates a farming business on a small rice farmland which is located near her house. She has been in this types of business for more than twenty years. On average, she is able to make an income of USD 5.00 a day.

Yon wants to improve the general living conditions of her entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in her house now. Therefore, she is borrowing a loan from KIVA to build a latrine and buy its facilities. By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. She is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Madafu Group

texts.en:
Asha, who is in her mid-40's, is married with three kids. One child is still in school and the other two are grown-up. She has been a food vendor for eight years now. She works from 8 am to 8 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be one of Asha's many loans from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to increase food stock and to purchase a motorcycle for a transportation business. She has paid back all of her loans successfully. She is happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva for their support. She used the profit to pay school fees, buy a plot of land, build her house, and cover household expenses. She will use this loan to increase her mamalishe stock and serve more customers. She dreams owning a hotel.

Asha will share this loan with her loan group, Madafu, which consist of four members who will hold each other accountable for repaying the loan.

loans.use: to increase mamalishe stock.

loans.name: Phalla

texts.en:
Phalla, 46, is a married woman from Kampong Cham Province. She has two single children who live under her support. To make a living, she manages and operates a farming business, growing rice and selling the crop to the local dealers. So far, she has been involved in this type of business for almost thirty years. She is able to make an income of USD 3.00 per day, on average.  

Recently, some parts of her house have deteriorated and they need to be fixed to provide a suitable living for the household. Due to lack of funds, she has applied for a Kiva loan via HKL to pay for her house renovation. She and her family will be thankful to the lenders for helping them with the loan funded to improve their living standard.

loans.use: to pay for her house renovation

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a tailoring business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 50000 through NWTF to buy more materials for her tailoring business.

Violeta has been in this business for 11 years. Violeta earns more income from her general store. Violeta has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more materials for her tailoring business

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en: Patricia is a hardworking Ugandan woman who earns extra income from farming, aside from a retail shop and restaurant. Patricia desires to educate all of her children.  However, she is challenged by competition and capital insufficiency. She is getting credit to buy juice, soap and sodas to increase her capital.

loans.use: to buy juice, soap and sodas.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is 56 years old and married with twelve children. For the past year she has run a sari sari, or general store in the Philippines. With three children still in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Anita has requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, groceries, etc. She would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy stock for her sari sari

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy goats

loans.name: Enock Byororwa

texts.en:
Enock is a 44-year-old married man with four children, ages 17, 15, 12 and ten years old. They live in Kamwenge, Uganda. Enock used his previous loan to buy more farm supplies, like manure and fertilizer. His main business is still farming produce, for which he earns a living. He purposely started this business to change his standard of living and to educate his children. He still experiences hardships of inadequate capital and weather changes, which affect his business. However, his vision is to have a modern produce farm.

Enock has requested a loan to buy more farm supplies, like manure and fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy more farm supplies, such as manure and fertilizers.

loans.name: Safina

texts.en:
Safina is a 35-year-old hardworking, married woman living in Kamwenge, Uganda. She runs a retail shop and also deals in farming. She started this business to generate income and meet family demands. She hopes to have a sustainable business without borrowed funds; however, her main challenge is the high rate of defaulters.

She is requesting a loan to buy more stock, like salt, sugar, soda, and others to sell.

loans.use: to buy more stock, such as salt, sugar, and soda.

loans.name: Mujeres Para Un Futuro Mejor Group

texts.es: El grupo “Mujeres Para Un Futuro Mejor” está conformado por 05 socias optimistas y responsables. Sandra de 21 años de edad es soltera. Ella se dedica a la venta de comida como el lomo saltado. Así mismo como actividad secundaria Ella labora en un call center de atención al cliente. Gracias a su esfuerzo su negocio continúa creciendo. Es por ello que solicitó el crédito para la compra pollo, pescado, arroz y aceite. El grupo “Mujeres Para Un Futuro Mejor” agradece  a los Inversionistas Kiva por hacer posible este crédito. Sandra se encuentra sentada es la  segunda del lado izquierdo y viste bivirí negro.
texts.en:
The group "Women for a Better Future" is composed of five optimistic and responsible members. Sandra is 21 years old and single. She works in food sales, selling products such as lomo saltado (stir-fried beef). Additionally, as a secondary activity, Sandra works in customer service at a call center. Thanks to her hard work, her business continues growing. For this reason she requested the loan to purchase chicken, fish, rice and oil. 

The Women For a Better Future group thanks the Kiva investors for making this loan possible. Sandra is pictured sitting second from the left and is wearing a black tank top.

loans.use: to purchase chicken, fish, rice and oil

loans.name: Cherry

texts.en:
Cherry is 33 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Cherry is borrowing PHP 14000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Cherry has been in pig fattening for six years and also earns additional income from general store.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She is 35 years old and has two children who are in school.

She has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional abaca fiber for her weaving business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Evelyn has been in this business for four years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional abaca fiber for her weaving business

loans.name: Mefaret

texts.en:
Mefaret is married with three children. She works in the kitchen of a private tutoring school and in order to better support her family, sells Amway. Her customers are her friends and colleagues. With her second loan, she’ll buy wholesale goods. She is pleased to meet her household and children’s needs and not to have any debt. Her dream is to retire.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 
Mefaret Hanım evli,üç çocuk annesi.  Bir dersanenin mutfak bölümünde çalışıyor ve ailesine daha çok katkı sağlamak için de Amvay ürünleri satışı yapıyor.  Müşterileri çevresi ve iş arkadaşları.  Aldığı ikinci kredi ile toplu ürün alacak.  Evini ve çocuklarının ihtiyaçlarını karşılayıp borçsuz yaşadığı için memnun.  Hayali emekli olmak.

loans.use: to buy Amway goods at wholesale

loans.name: Al- Hanan Group

texts.en:
Al- Hanan is a group of four women. They live in Sana'a, Yemen and applied for a loan of 230,000 YER From AMB.

Hanan is the leader of the group. She is an 18-year-old single woman, living with her parents in an old house which needs renovation. Hanan's father is the breadwinner of the family and his income is not enough to renovate the house on the inside. 

Hanan as one member of the family decided to help her father to make the necessary renovation of the house. As a result, she applied for a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase construction materials to make the necessary renovation of the house.

She hopes to complete all the renovation of her house.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials to make the necessary renovation of the house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more movies to sell.

loans.name: Samnang

texts.en:
Samnang, who is 44 years old, resides in Kampong Cham Province of Cambodia. She has six children in total; four are married and live independently while the other two are single and live under her support. To make a living and support her family, she manages and operates a farming business in a small rice farmland which is located in her community. She has been in this type of business for twenty four years.

Currently, she would like to request a KIVA loan via HKL to buy a motorbike. This loan will allow her to have a personal vehicle so that she can experience a convenient way of traveling. She would like to thank all lenders for the financial support. She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike

loans.name: Quế

texts.en:
Quế is 43 years old and is married with three children. She lives in Quang Xuong district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

Quế works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. She has been involved in this business for more than ten years. In 2014, Quế joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Quế has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

The main hardship that Quế faces in her life is not having a hygeinic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet. With her business profits, Quế hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

loans.name: Ivy

texts.en:
Ivy is 40 years old and married with three children. With two of her children in school, Ivy works very hard to provide for them.

Ivy runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, groceries, etc.

Ivy has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items. 

In the future, Ivy would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, and groceries

loans.name: Sulpicia

texts.en:
Sulpicia works hard to support her family. Sulpicia is married and has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines.

Sulpicia requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional raw materials for her weaving business.

Sulpicia has been in this business for 12 years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Sulpicia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional raw materials for her weaving business

loans.name: Barbara

texts.en:
Barbara is 46 years old and is married with three children, two of whom are in school. 

Barbara is a very hard working entrepreneur. She has a tailoring business in the Philippines, and has been in this business for 20 years. Now, Barbara has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy equipment to use in her business.

In the future, Barbara would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy equipment to use in her tailoring business.

loans.name: Adelfa

texts.en:
Adelfa is 56 years old and is married with four children. Adelfa works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, snack foods, candies, sugar, coffee, noodles, etc. 

She has successfully repaid her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. Adelfa has requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like canned goods, snack foods, candies, sugar, coffee, noodles, etc. to sell.

Adelfa would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell, like canned goods, snack foods, candies, sugar, coffee, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Nigar

texts.en:
Nigar is married and the mother of two children. She used to sell candies for weddings and memorial services. She didn’t know much about sewing so she took a community education class. At first she made clothing for herself and her daughters-in-law. Now she works as a tailor, sewing for others. She’ll use the loan to buy a sewing machine.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff

Nigar Hanım evli iki çocuk annesi. Daha önce evde sipariş üzerine nikah ve mevlüt şekeri yapıp satan Nigar Hanım az bildiği dikiş dikme işini halk eğitim kurslarına giderek geliştiriyor. İlk önce kendine ve gelinine kıyafetler diken Nigar Hanım şimdi terzilik işine başlayarak dışarıya dikiş dikmeye başlıyor. Aldığı kredi ile dikiş makinası alacak.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more food for his grocery store, to be able to attract a lot of customers.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert, fifty years old, is a widower with five children, with two of them still in school. He comes from Nyamayenje in the southern division of Rukungiri municipality.

Robert has raised dairy cows for over 26 years. He also owns rental housing. He is a longtime client with UGAFODE and has now taken out a 5,000,000 UGX loan to buy building materials to be used to renovate his rentals. With improvements they can fetch him good money. His dream is to expand his rental business and so increase his income.

Robert thanks UGAFODE for its past financial assistance, which enabled him to build himself a house and a dairy, which also helped him to boost his income.

loans.use: to buy building materials to be used to renovate his rental units.

loans.name: Jihad

texts.en:
Jihad is a 19-year-old single Palestinian man who lives in a Palestinian refugee camp. Due to the low social and financial situations of Palestinians in Lebanon, especially those who live in camps, he left school at an early age and started working as a plumber with his father's friend to help in covering the needs and expenses of his family.

Jihad is an ambitious man and a hard worker who has a limited salary and is trying desperately to provide his family with better living conditions. He benefited from his first Al Majmoua loan through buying a van for his father to transport people in an attempt to increase the family's income. Today, Jihad is acquiring a new loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to proceed in building his own house as a step toward a better independent future.
Jihad hopes to start working as a plumber on his own account in the upcoming future to increase his income and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to proceed in building his own house as a step toward a better independent future

loans.name: Maria Cecilia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “Liderando las Palmeras” ,la socia tiene 52 años de edad tiene 02 hijos y es soltera, la socia se dedica a brindar el servicio  de movilidad escolar, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia lleva años dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar llantas para su carro.
La socia agradece por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir sus cuotas establecidas con mucha responsabilidad
texts.en: This client, Maria Cecilia, belongs to the communal bank "Liderando las Palmeras". She is 52 years old, has two children, and is single. She offers school transportation services. She is responsible and diligent. She has been in this business for years, and it is going well thanks to the hard work she puts into it every day. She hopes to be able to continue working in this way and to continue supporting her family. Maria Cecilia requests this loan to purchase tires for her car. She is grateful for the loan and promises to make the agreed upon repayments very responsibly.

loans.use: to purchase tires for her car.

loans.name: Genara

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Genara works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Genara is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Genara has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Bernabeth

texts.en:
Bernabeth is 26 years old and is married with two children, both of whom are in school. Bernabeth works very hard to provide for them.

Bernabeth runs a general store in the Philippines and has been in this business for four years now. She has requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, condiments, etc..

In the future, Bernabeth would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her store, like canned goods, beverages, condiments, etc.

loans.name: Bernardita

texts.en:
Bernardita is 48 years old and widowed with five children. With two children in school, Bernardita works very hard to provide for them.

Bernardita runs a general store in the Philippines and has been in this business for 20 years now. She has requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like condiments, eggs, canned goods, groceries, etc.

In the future, Bernardita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like condiments, eggs, canned goods, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida is 46 years old and married with one child. Leonida works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for eight years and sells a variety of items, such as coffee, cereals, shampoo, fabric conditioners, sugar, canned goods, etc. 

Leonida successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. She has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

In the future, Leonida would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Melahat

texts.en:
Melahat works for a research company and travels to a lot of villages in the region for work. She buys products from the women there and sells them to her friends. She both makes some money and gives these women the chance to work. Melahat doesn’t like to be idle so she makes decorative flowers from soap in the evenings. She makes additional income doing this. She’ll use the loan to buy soap-making materials, patterns and various products (jewellery, small decorative towels).

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff

Melahat Hanım bir araştırma şirketinde çalışıyor. İşi gereği bulunduğu bölgenin köyler de dahil bir çok yerine gidiyor. Burada ki kadınlara satın aldığı ürünlerden vererek çevrelerine satmalarını sağlıyor. Hem kendisi kazanıyor hem de kadınlara iş yapma imkanı vermiş oluyor. Melahat Hanım boş durmayı sevmediğinden akşamları evde de sabundan süs çiçekleri yapıyor. Bununla da bir ek gelir daha sağlıyor. Aldığı kredi ile sabun yapma malzemeleri ,kalıplar ve çeşitli ürünler (takı,küçük süs havluları)alacak.

loans.use: to buy soap-making materials, patterns and various products.

loans.name: Ayfer

texts.en:
Ayfer lost her husband a month ago. She has one child. She has made and sold handicrafts for 35 years. She has regular customers, and she sells to them and to her friends. She is happy to contribute to her family and not be idle. She’ll use the loan to buy supplies (towels, lace, paste). Her dream is to buy a house.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff

Ayfer Hanım eşini bir ay önce kaybetmiş . Bir çocuk annesi. Otuz beş yıldır dışarıya el işi yapıp satıyor. Belirli müşterileri var. Onlara ve onların çevresine satış yapıyor. Ailesine katkı sağladığı için memnun ,boş durmayı da sevmediğini söyledi. Aldığı kredi ile el işi malzemeleri (havlu ,dantel ipliği,küpür vs.)alacak. Hayali bir ev sahibi olmak.

loans.use: to buy supplies (towels, lace, paste)

loans.name: Tea

texts.en:
Tea is a 40-year-old single woman from Telavi city. She lives with her parents and brother, who is a daily-worker and generates 150 GEL monthly. 

Due to their bad financial conditions, Tea was unable to get a higher education or any profession. This is one of the reason of her unemployment. However, in order to make her bit for the family's welfare, she started a trading business. In particular, she buys spices at wholesale prices, then packs them and sells door-to-door at increased prices. The work is really hard for Tea, but the family doesn't have any significant income and live under poverty. She is eager to make additional income and deal with their financial difficulties. 

So, Tea requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for starting a trading business startup but without any success. Her loan request was rejected each time, because the creditors did not find the existing family income to be sufficient to approve the loan. Tea requested a loan from Credo to start a trading business. Her loan request was approved within the framework of a joint initiative by Kiva and Credo. The start up loan program provides start up credit with soft conditions for the country's poor people, who are regarded as "high risk borrowers" because of their low income, and do not have access to credit products. With the received credit, Tea will purchase stock of clothing and will sell among her costumers, to whom she has already gained loyal attitude. 

She awaits yours support and will be really grateful for the help.

loans.use: to start a clothing trading business.

loans.name: Krowor Ladies Group

texts.en: These three people are part of the group called Krowor Ladies. On average, they are 40 years old, and have two children each. They all live in the Teshie neighborhood, in Accra-Ghana. They are friends or neighbors, and also know one another through their income-generating activities at Teshie. They are involved in small retail, and sell cloth, grocery, wig, hair cream and cosmetics. In order to have enough cash to buy fresh supplies of goods, the members of the group have decided to join ID-Ghana. This is their forth loan cycle with ID-Ghana. Margaret, the featured borrower, is a well-known grocery, wig and hair cream seller. In the photo, she is standing at far right in the photo. She is planning to use her loan to buy groceries, wig and hair cream from the market to sell to customers. Most of her customers are in Teshie. She is expecting to make a good monthly profit, which will be reinvested in her business and also used to take care of her child. They have good repayment records and will hold each other responsible for the repayment of this loan.

loans.use: to buy groceries, wig and hair cream to sell to customers.

loans.name: Vivina

texts.en:
Vivina runs a sari-sari (variety) store business. She sells various commodities ranging from sugar, to cooking oil, noodles, soap, canned good and beverages. She is 47 year old with seven dependents. Out of the seven dependents, three are still attending school. To augment income she also does farming.


She is asking for a loan to buy assorted groceries for the store, and farm supplies like fertilizers and capital for her hog raising start-up. Because of these materials, her store will be full of goods, her farm will start to yield and hopefully to start raise hogs in the coming months.



Vivina is trying her best to handle her business properly to be productive in order for her to continue finance the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy assorted groceries for the store, and farm supplies like fertilizers for her hog raising start-up.

loans.name: Soatoy

texts.en:
Soatoy is a strong woman. She lives in a rural area. She is married. She has two children. For about two years, she has had a business. Soatoy is a responsive and active person. She buys and sells cattle. Additionally, she plants agriculture products. She plants cotton. She sells agriculture products at the domestic market. 

Soatoy is planning to widen her activity. She needs financial support for buying cattle.

loans.use: to buy cattle to sell

loans.name: Purkuvvat

texts.en: Purkuvvat is a strong man. He was born in 1996. He lives in rural area. He is single. He is a student. He studies in part time higher education. He studies to be a lawyer. He dreams to be an honest lawyer and to be helpful for community. He is second year student. Purkuvvat is responsive child in his family. He tries to help parents. In free time he additionally works as in construction. With some of these earnings he helps to family. Now his plan is to graduate university and have a job placement. Purkuvvat is needed for financial support to pay tuition.

loans.use: To pay for tuition

loans.name: Hilola

texts.en: Hilola is a hardworking woman. She was born in 1994. She lives in a village. She is married. For about two years she has had a business with her husband. Hilola works in planting cotton, potato and keeping livestock. She does well in her activity. She wants to buy additional cattle. She is planning to widen her work and make better conditions of living. She is asking for financial support to buy cattle.

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Fifty-four-year old Salvacion is a married woman from Mayorga, Leyte. She has six grown dependents. To have an additional source of income, she engages in the raising and selling of hogs. She has been engaged in these kinds of businesses for more than 20 years. 

She is asking for a loan to buy a variety of goods like rice, canned goods, soft drinks, charcoal and tuba (coconut wine). These are very helpful in augmenting her income. She could now cater to various customer needs. This will result in high improvement on sales, and she could now start to pay her obligations.

In the future, Salvacion is hoping that she could handle her business very well to have better living conditions and be more sustainable as well.

loans.use: to buy a variety of goods like rice, canned goods, soft drinks, charcoal and  tuba (coconut wine )

loans.name: Cresencia

texts.en:
Cresencia works hard to support her family. Cresencia is married and has an abaca-weaving business [using fibers from the abaca, a species of banana] in the Philippines.

Cresencia requested a PHP 16000 loan through NWTF to buy more raw materials for her weaving business.

Cresencia has been in this business for 11 years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Cresencia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more raw materials for her weaving business

loans.name: Joymie

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Joymie works hard to support her family.

She has a manicure and pedicure business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling frozen foods. Joymie is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF to buy additional items for her manicure and pedicure business.

Joymie has been sustaining her business activities through her past loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items for her manicure and pedicure business.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines, which she has been running for 15 years now. 

Thelma requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Thelma would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Libetha

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Libetha works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling ready to wear clothing. Libetha is borrowing 6,000 PHP through NWTF to buy spare parts and other materials needed for her business.

Libetha has been sustaining her business activities through her past one loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and other materials needed for her business

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 41 years old and married with four children.



Emma works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, groceries, etc..



Emma has borrowed and paid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns an income from food vending.



Emma aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.en:
Alejandra works hard to support her family. Alejandra is married and has a direct selling of Avon products business in the Philippines.

Alejandra requested a 17,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional products from Avon to sell to her customers.

Alejandra has been in this business for six years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Alejandra would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional products from Avon to sell to her customers

loans.name: Juditha

texts.en:
Juditha is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Juditha is 52 years old and has two children who are still in school.

Juditha has a fishing business in the Philippines. Juditha requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional materials like fishing net, fish container, gasoline, etc. for her business.

Juditha has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Juditha would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like fishing net, fish container, gasoline, etc. for her business

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Janet is 27 years old now.



Janet has a coconut wine vending business in the Philippines. Janet requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional containers of coconut wine to sell.



Janet has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Janet would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional containers of coconut wine to sell

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en:
Antonia is 50 years old and married with four children. With one child still in school, Antonia works very hard to provide for them.

Antonia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional groceries to sell in her general store.

Antonia has been in this business for eight years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, and other groceries. 

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Antonia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Inga

texts.en:
Inga is a 40-year-old married woman from the village Mejinistskali. She lives with her husband and school-aged daughter. In spite of her high education, Inga had to start work as a waitress at the local restaurant, because she couldn't find any stable job and the family needed any source of income for existence. Inga generates 400 GEL monthly; that is really hardly enough to cover all daily expenses and basic needs. 

For increasing the productivity and generate more income, Inga plans to start her own activity. In the region, there is a high unemployment rate, but self-employment helps inhabitants to make a living. So, she decided to start a clothing trading business with a loan, but the local credit providers usually demand experience and some stable income from the borrowers. Inga’s credit requests were rejected several times, as she was unable to satisfy their requirements. She received the credit in the framework of joint initiative of Kiva and Credo - Startup Program that gives poor people the chance to start or restart businesses. She will purchase stock of used clothing at wholesale prices and will open a shop at a good location. 

She is a very enthusiastic and hardworking person with a great desire to ensure her daughter with good education for progressing in life.  This credit will be a great support for the family. Inga is thankful to Kiva Lenders for giving her a chance to make her own business.

loans.use: to make her own activity and open a clothing shop

loans.name: Sudarno

texts.en: Hello, lenders! Meet Sudarno, one of the Ruma agents who joined Ruma more than one year ago. He is a local entrepreneur who owns and manages a small mobile shop which sells mobile phone, accessories and mobile phone airtime credits, and provides utility bill payment services. Ever since he joined Ruma, he has been able to improve his business in delivering access of mobile financial services to his surrounding community. This time is his third loan from Kiva - the first two loans were fully funded and successfully repaid. As an entrepreneur, Sudarno is known as a professional and hardworking individual. Most of his customers have put their trust in Sudarno and become loyal customers. As the business keeps growing, he hopes to get a working capital loan in order to process more transactions in his shop. Meanwhile, he is also in the process of adding one more product that he wants to serve in his shop: e-commerce for low income communities, a new service from Ruma that enables people to buy products by laying-away their money in a safe account managed by certified Ruma agents like Sudarno. People pick stuff they want to buy from the product catalog, then make an order and payment at the Ruma agent's stall. The product will arrive right in front of the customer's door.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions.

loans.name: Ketra

texts.en: Ketra is an old client to the organization who applied for a loan of UGX 3,000,000. She runs a business of cattle fattening as her major source of income and has been in this business for more than 20 years. The purpose of the loan is to buy more cows so that she can increase her income, make a profit, and raise money to maintain her family and pay school fees for her grandsons and granddaughters. Ketra is an honest and hardworking lady but is always affected by limited capital. Her dream is to become a model farmer in the area. With this loan from UGAFODE, Ketra is hopeful that her business will expand gradually.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Shadi

texts.en:
Shadi is a 30-year-old married man from Khanyounis. He lives with his wife and three children, two sons and one daughter. He works as an employee in the public sector, where he earns a low income, which barely covers all the family needs. Shadi would like to improve his family's living conditions, so he decided to buy a rickshaw to deliver goods.
Shadi took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him buy a new rickshaw for his new business. By taking this loan, Shadi will be able to increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.
Shadi appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw for his new business

loans.name: Mosallam

texts.en:
Mosallam is a 29-year-old married man from Khanyounis. He lives with his wife and small son. He works as an employee in the public sector, where he earns a low income, which barely covers all his family's needs. Mosallam would like to improve his family's living conditions, so he decided to buy a rickshaw to deliver goods.
Mosallam took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him buy a rickshaw for his new business. By taking this loan, Mosallam will be able to increase his income and improve his family's living conditions. 
Mosallam appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw for his new business.

loans.name: Jose  Ramon

texts.es:
José es un señor de 26 años, viven en la ciudad de Santo Domingo de los Colorados junto a su esposa y sus tres hijos. José es un señor muy trabajador, todos los días se dedica a trabajar en una empresa muy reconocida en la ciudad, presta sus servicios de empleado elaborando ventanas y puertas de aluminio. Ha trabajado con la empresa ya cinco años, ahora ha decidido ponerse su propio negocio, para tener ingresos extras los fines de semana.
Por ello acudió a Fundación Alternativa porque en la institucion ayudan a las personas con sueños de microempresarios a darles una mano para cumplirlo. La institución pudo ayudarle con un crédito, con el mismo podrá comprar herramientas basicas para su negocio, asi dedicarse a trabajar los fines de semana para en un futuro ya contar con su propio taller de aluminio y vidrio.
Agradece a la institución y al proyecto Kiva por permitir que los sueños de los microempresarios sean mas posibles de cumplir, está muy feliz por el apoyo ya que con ello podrá salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
José is a 26 year old man who lives in the city of Santo Domingo de los Colorados along with his wife and three children. José is a very hardworking man, every day he works in a very well-recognized business in the city. He lends his services as an employee, making aluminum windows and doors. He has worked for this company for five years, and now has decided to begin his own business in order to have extra income on the weekends. 

For this reason he turned to Fundación Alternativa because the institution helps people who dream of being small business owners by giving them a hand to realize their dream. The institution was able to help José with a loan, and with this loan he will be able to buy basic tools for his business. José will put himself wor work on the weekends so that in the future he will be able to own his own aluminum and glass workshop. He is grateful to the institution and to Kiva for helping the microentrepreneur's dreams become more possible to realize; and he is very happy for the support, because with it he will be able to get ahead with his family.

loans.use: to pursue his aluminum and glass business.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a forty-nine-year-old married woman living in Kamwenge, Uganda. She deals in the selling of second hand clothes as her main source of income alongside agriculture. 

Agnes started this business to earn a living and look after her family. She faces a number of challenges including competition, seasonal customers, and weather changes that stop customers from turning up but has hopes that she will own a wholesale boutique.

She is requesting a loan to pay for school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is a 50-year-old married man. He and his spouse have been blessed with 6 children between 2 and 20 years of age. Francis' spouse is a business person, and provides additional income for the family.

Francis is a jua-kali artisan, a business he has been in for the last 10 years. 

Francis has requested his 2nd loan with VisionFund Kenya of 35,000 KES, which he will use to buy raw materials. 

With the anticipated profits, he will be able to expand his business and invest further. His hopes and dreams for the future are to purchase a piece of land and build a house for his family.

loans.use: to buy raw materials

loans.name: Amparo

texts.en:
Amparo is a widowed woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Amparo is 62 years old, and has one child who is still in school.

Amparo has a rug making business in the Philippines. She requested a 21,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more materials for her business.

Amparo successfully paid back her previous loan, and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Amparo has been in this business for 8 years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more materials for her business

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a thirty-eight-year-old married man with eight children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He buys and sells cocoa, he has been in this business for ten years, and he has made reasonable profits out of it. He has a cocoa garden that is affected by seasonality. He hopes to have a bigger business.

John wants a loan to buy cocoa for resale.

loans.use: to buy cocoa for resale

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a twenty-eight-year-old married woman with four children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. Her business is cocoa buying and selling for a profit. She also has a cocoa garden and is a hardworking woman who has managed to sustain her family.

Rose wants a loan to buy cocoa for resale.

loans.use: to buy cocoa for resale

loans.name: Erasmo Antonio

texts.es: Erasmo, tiene 59 años de edad, es soltero, tiene un hijo con quien reside en el Municipio de Azacualpa, Santa Bárbara. Siempre a trabajado en la agricultura, pero también compra y vende maíz y frijoles. Además vende refrescos, arroz y otros granos básicos. Esta actividad la ha mantenido estable mediante la inversión de varios prestamos, actualmente solicita otro por 25,000 Lempiras para comprar maíz y frijoles por quintal para la venta. Su meta es crecer como microempresario y mantener siempre su fuente de ingresos.
texts.en:
Erasmo, 59, is single.  He lives with his son in the town of Azacualpa, Santa Bárbara.  He has always worked in agriculture, but he also buys and sells corn and beans.  He also sells soft drinks, rice, and other basic grains.  This job has kept him stable during the investment of several loans.

He's currently requesting another loan for 25,000 lempiras [HNL] to buy corn and beans by the quintal to sell.

Erasmo's goal is to grow as a micro-entrepreneur and always keep his source of income.

loans.use: to buy corn and beans to re-sell

loans.name: Juan Diego

texts.es:
Jóvenes como Juan son los que hay que valorar y apoyar hoy en día, este muchacho de tan solo 18 años de edad, desea iniciar su propio negocio que será una barbería, lo hace no solo para apoyar a su familia si no para pagar sus estudios y ser un profesional.
Juan solicita un crédito para comprar todos los elementos ya que Oslo tiene el conocimiento para realizar cortes, comprara sillas, decoración vitrinas, elementos etc.
Con tu apoyo este hombre iniciara lo más pronto posible su negocio y espera hacerlo una de las barberías más solicitas y ocupadas de Medellín
texts.en:
Young people like Juan should be valued and supported today. This young man is only 18 years of age and he wants to start his own barber business. Not only does he support his family, but he also wants to pay for his studies so that he can become a professional.

Juan is requesting a loan in order to buy all the equipment that he needs. He knows how to give haircuts, so he needs to buy chairs, decoration cabinets, supplies, and other items.

With your support, this young man can start his business as soon as possible. He hopes to make his business the most frequented and busiest barber shop in Medellín.

loans.use: to buy chairs, decoration cabinets, supplies, and other items.

loans.name: Nancy Guadalupe

texts.es:
La socia Nancy pertenece al banco comunal LIDERANDO LAS PALMERAS, él banco está ubicado en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de hospedaje, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia desea que su negocio crezca, la socia se siente bien con su negocio ya que mediante su negocio la socia puede continuar apoyando a  su familia.
La socia solcito el crédito para la compra de colchas, sabanas entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Member Nancy belongs to the Liderando las Palmeras communal bank, the bank is located in the province of Cusco, in the region of Cusco.
The member alternates her daily activities with the hospitality business. She is a responsible and diligent person, and she wants her business to grow. She feels good with her business, because through it, she can continue supporting her family. 
She will use the loan to buy blankets, sheets, among others. 
She feels grateful for the given loan and she is committed to meeting the established payments.

loans.use: to purchase blankets, sheets, among others.

loans.name: Yenny Edelmira

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal LIDERANDO LAS PALMERAS, la socia tiene 44 años de edad tiene 02 hijos y es casada, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de  restaurant, la socia vende desayunos, almuerzos y cenas a todos sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día  a su negocio, la socia desea que su negocio crezca cada día ,siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
 La socia solicita el crédito para comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to Liderando Las Palmeras Communal Bank.  She's married and has two children.  She alternates her daily activities with her restaurant business.  She sells breakfast, lunch, and dinner to all her customers who request it.  She has had her business for a long time and it's going well for her thanks to the effort she puts into it every day.  She wants her business to grow every day because it's how she gets her family ahead.

She's requesting the loan to buy rice, sugar, and oil, among other products.

She's grateful for the loan and promises to make her payments punctually.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, and other products

loans.name: Daler

texts.en: Daler is a handsome man. He was born in 1995. He is single. He is a student. He studies at university. He is a well educated and responsive student. He is well known among his coursemates. Teachers are satisfied with his activity and acceptance. He is planning to be useful and socially helpful to his community. He studies in the field of economics. Daler has not enough financial gain to pay university tuition. He is asking for financial support to pay tuition.

loans.use: To pay for tuition.

loans.name: Douaa

texts.en:
Douaa is a 24-year-old married woman who works as a hairdresser from her house for the past two years. She also works as a tutor for the past year to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their family.

Douaa is a talented hairdresser who has a good reputation among her customers for her proficiency. Today, she is acquiring a youth loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to develop her business by buying new beauty tools to facilitate her work and to pay her new furniture's costs in order provide her customers with better service.

Douaa hopes to open her own beauty salon in the future to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to develop her business through buying new beauty tools and to pay her new furniture's costs

loans.name: Virginia Feliza

texts.es:
virginia es una mujer de 37 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 3 hijos de 20, 18 y 16 años, y su negocio es el tejido de mantas.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, luchadora, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la comunidad ‘Batallas’ un área caracterizada porque se encuentra en la parte oeste del lago sagrado Titicaca, a una altitud promedio de 3900 metros sobre el nivel del mar, tiene un pronunciado clima diurno en donde las variaciones de temperatura durante el día son más pronunciados a medida que avanza el año. 
Virginia es de tez morena, cabello negro largo trenzado, baja estatura, su forma de vestir es tradicional (manta, pollera y sombrero) y su lengua materna es el Aymará que se habla en el lugar, y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su pareja que se dedica a la agricultura y con sus 3 hijos  que estudian. 
Su negocio es el tejido de mantas de Alpaca en telar y manualmente, labor que realiza de manera independiente con ayuda de sus hijos, durante todos los días de la semana. “las mantas de Alpaca son muy demandadas por cholitas de buen vestir, mis tejidos los comercio en la ciudad y se terminan rápido…” comenta. Su sueño es tener un taller de tejidos con varios telares. Ella desea invertir en su negocio mediante la compra de lana de Alpaca por mayor para satisfacer la demanda de mantas por temporada alta de ventas. Esta es la 3 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 21 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Virginia solicita un préstamo para la compra de lana de Alpaca por mayor para contar con material de trabajo y satisfacer la demanda de temporada elaborando prendas de Alpaca.
texts.en:
Virginia is a 37-year-old woman, she lives with her partner, she has 3 children who are 20, 18, and 16 years old, and her business is knitting shawls. 
She is a good mother, entrepreneurial, determined, responsible, and hard-working. She does her business in the community of ‘Batallas,’ an area characterized because it is located in the western part of the holy lake Titicaca, at an average height of 3900 meters above sea level. It has a pronounced daytime climate, in which temperature variations throughout the day are more pronounced as the year advances. 
Virginia is brown-skinned, has long black tied hair, short height, has a traditional way of dressing (shawls, pleated skirt, and hat), her mother tongue is Aymará, which is spoken in the region, and she speaks Spanish as general culture and because of her sales. She shares her life with her partner, who works in agriculture, and with her 3 children who go to school.
Her business is knitting Alpaca shawls with a loom and manually, work she does independently with the help of her children, during every day of the week. “Alpaca shawls are in high demand by indigenous rural women of good taste, I sell my textiles in the city, and they go quickly…” she says. 
Her dream is to have a knitting workshop with several looms. She wants to invest in her business through the purchase of Alpaca wool at wholesale to satisfy the shawl demand in the season of high sales. This is her third loan sequence with the institution in 21 years that she has had this occupation. 
It is for these reasons that Virginia asks for a loan, to buy Alpaca wool at wholesale to have enough work material and to satisfy the high seasonal demand, making Alpaca garments.

loans.use: to buy Alpaca wool at wholesale to have enough work material and satisfy the seasonal demand, making Alpaca garments.

loans.name: Adjorman Group

texts.en:
These people are part of the group called Adjorman, and they are five in number. On average, they are 40 years old, and have three children each. They all live in the Teshie neighborhood, in Accra, Ghana. They are friends or neighbors and also know one another through their income-generating activities at Teshie. They are involved in small retail, and sell grocery items, frozen food, cosmetics, soft drinks, underwear, charcoal, vegetables, and eggs. 

In order to have enough cash to buy fresh supplies of goods, the members of the group have decided to join ID-Ghana. This is their seventh loan cycle with ID-Ghana. Eunice F., the featured borrower, is a well-known soft drinks, banku (cook corn and cassava dough), and stew seller. In the photo, she is standing at far right in the photo. 

She is planning to use her loan to buy soft drinks, corn and cassava dough to prepare banku, and stew which she will sell to customers. Most of her customers are in Teshie. She is expecting to make a good monthly profit, which will be reinvested in her business and also used to take care of her children. The group has good repayment records and will hold each other responsible for the repayment of this loan.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks and corn and cassava dough to prepare banku, and stew that she will sell to customers.

loans.name: Martin

texts.es:
Martin es un campesino que ha trabajado en la producción de café desde hace 35 años. Él tiene 59 años y vive con su esposa, su hija y sus nietos. Martin está en el proceso de conversión de café convencional a café orgánico, para fortalecer este proceso necesita comprar insumos con los cuales prepara los abonos orgánicos, también quiere sembrar 3.300 árboles de café para aumentar su producción, para poder empezar el necesita 3.000.000 millones de pesos. Sus metas son certificarse como productor orgánico y obtener mejores ingresos que le permitan ayudar en la crianza de sus pequeños nietos y adecuar una vivienda digna.

La conversión y producción de café orgánico es un proceso integral al largo plazo independiente, saludable, balanceado y amigable con el medio ambiente lo que representa un desafío para los campesinos de Colombia y Martin ha decidido no arriesgar su salud; la de su familia ni la de los consumidores, al seguir usando químicos. La Federación Campesina del Cauca está convencida que vale la pena apoyar y fortalecer estas iniciativas alternas. Un préstamo con Kiva representa un futuro sostenible por su producción, su tierra, y su familia.
texts.en:
Martin is a farmer who has worked in coffee production for 35 years. He's 59 years old and lives with his wife, daughter and grandchildren. Martin is in the process of converting from conventional coffee to organic coffee, and to bolster this process he needs to purchase supplies to prepare organic fertilizer. He also wants to plant 3,300 coffee trees to increase his production, and to start he needs 3,000,000 pesos. His goals are to get certified as an organic producer and obtain more income to help raise his young grandchildren and provide a respectable residence. 

The conversion to organic coffee production is a comprehensive process that in the long-term is independent, healthy, balanced, and environment-friendly. This is a challenge for Colombia's farmers and Martin has decided to not risk his health, his family's health or the consumers' health with continued use of chemicals. The Farmer's Federation of Cauca is convinced that supporting and strengthening these alternatives is worthwhile. A Kiva loan represents a sustainable future for production, the land, and his family.

loans.use: To convert conventional coffee production into organic coffee production.

loans.name: Dios Es Amor Group

texts.es: Anita de 39 años de edad, es casada con 02 hijos dependientes. El grupo “Dios Es Amor” está conformada por 07 mujeres luchadoras y solidarias que han ido mejorando con el transcurso del tiempo. Anita se dedica a la compra y venta de prendas de vestir. Con mucho esfuerzo y perseverancia ha logrado salir adelante e incrementar sus productos y así poder tener una mejor calidad de vida. Su último crédito lo destinará para la compra de polos, camisas, pantalones y shorts. El deseo de Anita es tener su propio local para poder dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. El grupo “Dios Es Amor” agradece a los inversionistas Kiva por el apoyo brindado. Anita es la segunda del lado derecho y viste polo negro.
texts.en: Anita is 39 years old, married and has 2 dependent children. The group "Dios Es Amor" consists of 7 hard-working, supportive women that have been getting better with the passage of time. Anita's job is buying and selling clothes. With hard work and perseverance she has managed to get ahead and expand her products so that she can have better living conditions. She will use her latest loan to purchase polo shirts, shirts, pants, and shorts. Anita's dream is to have a location of her own to provide better service for her customers. The group "Dios Es Amor" is grateful to Kiva lenders for the help provided. Anita is the second from the right and is wearing a black polo shirt.

loans.use: To purchase polo shirts, shirts, pants, and shorts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw iron to recycle in his workshop.

loans.name: Erica Lizett

texts.es:
Erica es una mujer de 42 años de edad, divorciada, tiene 2 hijas de 2 y 17 años de edad, y su negocio es la fabricación de bijouteria.
Ella es emprendedora, independiente, constante, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la zona ‘Sur’ de la ciudad, un área caracterizada por el comercio en todas las áreas; galerías y tiendas de buen gusto. De clima cálido y seco con una temperatura constante de 21 grados centígrados durante todo el año.
Erica es de tez morena, cabello negro largo, baja estatura, su lengua materna es el Aymará que no utiliza y habla español para el comercio. Su vida la comparte con sus hijas; la mayor estudia en la escuela y la menor es una bebé. Viven en una casa alquilada construida de ladrillo que cuenta con agua potable, electricidad y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la fabricación de bijouteria como; cadenas, aretes, collares, pulseras, manillas, etc. Labor que realiza durante la semana en su casa y la venta la realiza en horarios de oficina; “inicie mi negocio hace 6 años con la ayuda de una amistad y participé en cursos de diseño donde me destaque y pude empezar como artesana…” comenta. Su sueño es tener una tienda propia donde poder exponer sus artesanías. Ella desea ampliar su negocio mediante la compra de un mostrador para poder exponer sus joyas artesanales y generar mayores ventas. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 6 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Erica solicita un préstamo para la compra de un mostrador para exponer sus joyas artesanales y generar mayores ventas.
texts.en:
Erica is a 42-year-old woman, divorced, she has two daughters who are 2 and 17 years old, and her business is costume jewelry-making.
She is entrepreneurial, independent, tenacious, responsible, and hard-working. She does her work in the ‘South’ area of the city, an area characterized by retail in all areas, galleries and shops of good taste. It has a warm and dry climate with a constant temperature of 21 degrees centigrade during the whole year. 
Erica is brown skinned, has long black hair, short height, her mother tongue is Aymará, which she does not use, and speaks Spanish for retail. She shares her life with her daughters. The older one goes to school, and the younger one is a baby. They live in a rented home made of brick, which has potable water, electricity, and a sewage system. Her business is costume jewelry-making, such as chains, earrings, necklaces, bracelets, etc. She does the work throughout the week in her home, and sells it during office hours. “I started my business 6 years ago with the help of a friend, and I participated in a design course where I did well, and I was able to start as an artisan…” she says. Her dream is to have her own shop where she can show her crafts. 
She wants to expand her business through the purchase of a display counter to be able to show her artisanal jewelry and generate bigger sales. In the 6 years that she has had this occupation, this is her first loan sequence with the institution. 
It is for these reasons that Erica asks for a loan, to buy a display counter to show her artisanal jewelry and generate bigger sales.

loans.use: to buy a display counter to show her artisanal jewelry and generate bigger sales.

loans.name: Hector Gustavo

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal LIDERANDO LAS PALMERAS, él socio tiene 34 años de edad y es soltero, él socio alterna sus actividades con  su negocio de crianza de animales menores como cuyes, él socio lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, el socio desea que su negocio crezca, siendo de esta manera que el socio saca adelante a su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito para al compra de cuyes.
El socio se siente agradecido por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en: The group member is 34 years old, single, and belongs to the community bank Liderando Las Palmeras. He alternates his activities with his business where he breeds small animals, like guinea pigs. The group member has been at this business for a good while and it's gone well for him thanks to the effort he invests every day into his business. He wants the business to grow, since this is how he gets his family ahead. The group member is requesting a loan to purchase guinea pigs. He feels grateful for the loan granted and is committed to making the agreed upon payments.

loans.use: To purchase guinea pigs.

loans.name: Baltazara

texts.en:
Baltazara is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Baltazara is 57 years old and has two children who are still in school.

Baltazara has a plastic bags making business in the Philippines. Baltazara requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional materials for her business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Baltazara has been in this business for six years. In the future, Baltazara would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her business

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en:
Carolina is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Carolina is 35 years old and has two children who are in school.

Carolina has a fruit vending business in the Philippines. Carolina requested a PHP 27,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more fruit to sell to her customers.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Carolina has been in this business for six years. In the future, Carolina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fruit to sell to her customers

loans.name: Cresie

texts.en:
Cresie is 44 years old and married with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.
