Cresie has a business selling ready to wear clothing in the Philippines. Cresie requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional stocks of ready to wear clpthes to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Cresie has been in this business for 27 years. In the future, Cresie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of ready to wear clothes to sell

loans.name: Freedom 1 Group

texts.en:
Atswei is mother of two children who are still in school. She is in her early fifties and is married. For 15 years now, Atswei has been selling charcoal and tuna fish. She does business from 7am to 5pm every work day and is able to make a fairly good monthly profit. 

This will be her eighth loan request from ID Ghana. She used the previous loans to buy more charcoal and tuna fish to resell. Atswei has paid back the earlier loans successfully. She used her business profits to cover school fees and home food expenses and also saved in accordance with her business plan. With her new loan, she will buy more charcoal and tuna fish for her business. 

Atswei dreams of making her family's life better. Atswei will share this loan with her colleagues, and they will hold each other accountable for repaying the loan.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal and tuna fish for her business.

loans.name: Gerald

texts.en:
Gerald is 36 years old, a married man with four children aged between 5 and 18 years, all of them go to school. He is a farmer and has been farming for 15 years. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy fertilizers for his maize. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for his children.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers

loans.name: Nicasia

texts.es:
La socia  Nicasia pertenece al banco comunal LIDERNADO LAS PALMERAS, la socia continua dedicándose al negocio de venta de productos secos como quinua, trigo entre otros, la socia desea que su negocio crezca ,la socia vende su mercadería a sus clientes que le solicitan, siendo de esta  manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de trigo entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Nicasia is a member of the community bank Liderando Las Palmeras, and she continues to employ herself in the sale of dry goods such as quinoa, and wheat amongst other things. This member wants her business to grow, and she sells her merchandise to customers that order it. This is how she gets her family ahead. The member is applying for this loan to purchase wheat and more. She feels grateful for the loan and is committed to making the payments.

loans.use: To purchase wheat, amongst other things.

loans.name: Yeniba

texts.es:
La socia  Yeniba pertenece al banco comunal LIDERNADO LAS PALMERAS, la socia continua con su  negocio de venta de productos de belleza, la socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota, la socia continua vendiendo pefumes,colonias entre otros, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante  a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de colonias entre otros.
texts.en: Yeniba is a member of the community bank Liderando Las Palmeras, and she is still employing herself in the sale of beauty products. She feels grateful for the loan and is committed to making the payments. The member still sells perfumes, colognes, and other things. She's a responsible and industrious person, and this is how she gets her family ahead. The loan the member is requesting is for purchasing cologne, amongst other things.

loans.use: To purchase cologne, and more.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy-and-sell dry goods business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 20 years now.

Cristina requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more dry goods to sell to her customers.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Cristina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more dry goods to sell to her customers

loans.name: Rosadek Group

texts.en:
Sampson is father of one dependable child who is still in school. He is in his mid-fifties and is married. For eight years now, Sampson has been selling spare parts. He does business from 6am to 5pm every workday and is able to make a fairly good monthly profit. 

This will be his sixth loan request from ID Ghana. He used the previous loans to buy more spare parts to resell. He also provides mechanic services which also fetch him some money. Sampson has paid back the earlier loans successfully. 

He used his business profits to cover school fees and home food expenses and also saved in accordance with his business plan. With his new loan, he will buy more spare parts for his business. Sampson dreams of making his family's life better. Sampson will share this loan with his colleagues and will hold each other accountable for repaying the loan.

loans.use: to buy more spare parts for his business.

loans.name: Catalinas Group

texts.en:
The ladies in the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Las Catalinas” in Santa Catarina Palopo on the shores of Lake Atitlan in Guatemala look forward to their monthly meetings. They have created a real web of support among themselves, generated income for their families and learned alot during the educational trainings. The women secured their very first loan, funded by KIVA investors last June and are pleased to report that the loan has been fully paid back on time. They are requesting an additional loan at this time.

For this new loan cycle, we are pleased to introduce 43-year-old Manuela who married quite young and has ten children. She was unable to attend school and grew up learning to embroider and weave like so many indigenous women. She has recently joined the Trust Bank and is about to take out her very first loan! She intends to use the funds to purchase beads, thread and other supplies for her jewelry and handicraft business. Manuela wants to have plenty of inventory as she sells in three different places around the Lake.

Manuela realizes the importance of education, for herself and her children. Each month during the meeting of her Trust Bank, she gains practical and useful information about the world around her and within her. For example, she has been learning about budgeting, accounting, marketing, pricing and customer service. She has gained confidence as she has learned about self-esteem, women’s rights and women’s health. Manuela has worked hard and at the beginning of the year, registered six of her ten children in school so that they would have more opportunities than she had. She has also had to buy school supplies and school uniforms.

It is impossible for a woman like Manuela to walk into a bank and take out a loan. Non-governmental organizations like KIVA and Friendship Bridge are so important in the lives of these ladies. The months and years ahead are full of possibilities for them and their families. Thank you, KIVA investors, for your kindness and generosity!

loans.use: buy crafts supplies

loans.name: Yusufu

texts.en:
Yusuf is a hardworking married man with three children who are ages 10, 7 and 5 years, living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He operates a hotel (restaurant) alongside his motorcycle transport (boda boda) business to earn extra income. He started this business because it was profitable.  He hopes to expand his business; however, his main challenge is inadequate capital and defaulters. 

He is requesting a loan to complete paying for the motorcycle.

loans.use: to complete paying for the motorcycle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy beans

loans.name: Panchali Group

texts.en:
Panchali (SHG) was formed in December 2015 and consists of eight rural poor women members who belong to the Below Poverty Line category. This group is located in a rural village named Darlo in Balangir district of Odisha, India. 

Niramati, one of the members of this group, is standing second from right in the photo raising her hand. She is a very active and energetic lady of 50 years living with her husband, one son and a daughter.

Niramati’s husband is a house painter and decorator who take contracts for painting buildings. He has a group of five painters who work for him with daily wages. Owing to his quality work and on-time service, people like to order Niramati’s husband for painting. Presently, he earns a monthly income of 5,000 INR, which is not sufficient to invest in his work and maintain the family. Looking into the market demand for painting, he wants to have another group of painters to reach out to and meet the demands. For this, he needs some funds to purchase the required painting materials. Niramati’s husband requested her to arrange some money. So, to help her husband, Niramati, through her SHG, took a loan of 16,000 INR for purchasing white wash, undercoat, paint stripper, primer, paint brushes, distemper (paint), creosote, etc. for the work. Niramati and her husband hope that through this investment, they will be able to increase the income of her family. Niramati has a dream of opening a cloth store in the future. She also wishes to give better schooling to her children. The other seven members of the SHG are also doing small enterprises like animal trading, vegetable cultivation, vegetable vending and a milk business.

loans.use: To purchase white wash, undercoat, paint stripper, primer, paint brushes, distemper(paint), and creosote

loans.name: Nicolas

texts.es:
Nicolas es un hombre casado de 36 años de edad, vive en la comunidad Tzamabaj con sus 5 hijos de las siguientes edades, 15 años, 12 años, 9 años, 6 años y 4 meses, los primeros cuatro hijos estudian en la comunidad donde vive, 

 Nicolas  además de ser piloto automovilista se dedica también a la venta de maxan (envoltorio para conserva de alimentos)  este producto es muy vendible ya que la mayoría de las personas lo utilizan en las diferentes actividades tales como, bodas, cumpleaños y actividades de sus comunidades y mayor mente en la época navideña, él vende el maxan al menudeo y por mayor a otros vendedores, y con el poco capital con que cuenta ya no se da abasto en comprar mas maxan, Don Nicolas desde hace 13 años empezó con esta actividad y es un vendedor muy conocido; él vende en el mercado de Quetzaltenango y mucha gente lo llega a buscar.

 Con las ganancias del maxan, el sueño de don Nicolas en el futuro es tener una tienda de abarrotes en su comunidad para generar mas ingresos y asi darle un mejor futuro a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Nicolas is married, 36 years old, and lives in the community of Tzamababj with his 5 children who are the following ages; 15, 12, 9, 6, and 4 months. The first four children attend school in the community where he lives.

In addition to being a driver he also works selling maxan (a wrapping material used to preserve food). This product is very sellable since the majority of people use it for different events such as weddings, birthdays, and other activities in their communities, especially during Christmas season. He sells maxan retail and wholesale to other vendors, and the small amount of capital he has isn't enough to buy more maxan. 13 years ago Nicolas started this job and he's a well-known vendor. He sells in the Quetzaltenango market and is sought out by many people.

With the profits from maxan, Nicolas' dream is to have a grocery store in his community to generate more income and that way provide his kids with a better future.

loans.use: To purchase maxan.

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es: Guillermo expresa su agradecimiento y vuelve a recurrir a Kiva. Guillermo es profesor de inglés y realiza trabajos de traducción, Guillermo ha conseguido trabajo como profesor en un colegio de Santa Cruz, por lo que ahora vive mejor en otra ciudad e incluso la topografía le es más favorable debido a que Guillermo es discapacitado y tiene problemas para caminar. Los hijos de Guillermo se fueron a vivir a otro país y son independientes Como profesor de colegio Guillermo esta más feliz pues ahora tiene un trabajo mucho mas estable. Para mejorar su situación Guillermo se ha dado cuenta de que necesita un credito para tomar cursos de actualización en inglés e incorporar los idiomas mandarín y aymara (que ultimamente tienen gran demanda en toda Bolivia) para poder ofrecer más servicios en su tiempo libre, este prestamo le sera de gran ayuda a Guillermo quien es una persona con mucha determinación y promete no defraudar la confianza que Kiva le ha dado.
texts.en: Guillermo expresses his gratitude and has once again turned to Kiva. Guillermo is an English teacher and does translation work. He has acquired a job as a teacher at a high school in Santa Cruz. So now he lives better in another city and in fact the topography is easier on him because Guillermo is disabled and has trouble walking. Guillermo's kids went to live in another country and are independent. As a high school teacher Guillermo is happier because now he has a much more stable job. To improve the situation Guillermo has figured out that he needs a loan to take refresher courses in English and incorporate the languages of Mandarin and Aymara (which have recently been in high demand in all of Bolivia) to be able to offer more services in his free time. This loan will be of great help to Guillermo, who is a person with lots of determination who promises not to disappoint the Kiva lenders that have put their trust in him.

loans.use: To take refresher courses on English and incorporate the languages of Mandarin and Aymara (which recently have been in high demand in all of Bolivia)

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is married. She has her own business.  Marina sells women's clothes at the market and owns a trading place. Marina sells nice and good quality clothing. She is always kind and polite with her clients.

Marina is asking for a loan of 20 000 UAH to increase the assortment of women's clothes for the winter season.  This loan will help her to increase her income and take better care of her family.

loans.use: buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida works hard to support her family. Nida is widowed and has a tailoring business in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for 30 years now.  

Nida requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to buy additional materials like fabric, threads, needles, etc. for her business.   She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: buy tailoring supplies

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is a 38-year-old man married with children who lives in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He specifically deals in the buying and selling pharmacy drugs to his clients in his area. His other source of income is ‘boda boda’ transport. He started the pharmacy business in order to generate income for his family and help his patients get to hospital with at least first aid. He is hardworking and hopes to improve on his financial stability in the future and build a home.  With this loan, he intends to buy building materials to build a home.

loans.use: buy building materials

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen a resident of Kyenjojo, Uganda, and a father of 2 children. He deals in cattle trading. He buys cattle and fattens them to mature faster for the rapidly growing cattle market in both urban and rural areas. He earns extra income from farming and from the dairy product he sells like ghee and milk. He is faced with lack of capital to improve on his pasture and control pests. Stephen would like a loan to buy more cattle for fattening and selling.

loans.use: buy more cattle

loans.name: Clovis

texts.en: Clovice is a 52-year-old married man with four children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He is engaged in selling pineapples and growing and selling maize. He started this business because there was a lot of demand from the urban centres around him. He obtains additional income from a salary as a records assistant.  Clovice started his business to get more income for educating his children like any responsible parent. He is faced with lack of capital to improve on his maize plantation. Clovice is requesting a loan to improve on his maize plantation.

loans.use: improve his maize plantation

loans.name: Francisco Manuel

texts.es: el joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 25 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica a la mecánica automotriz desde hace varios años, tiene muchos clientes por su buen trabajo, el joven vive en casa propia con su hija, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de repuestos por mayor y maquinaria para poder continuar con su trabajo.
texts.en: The young man whose face has been obscured in the photo, becaue he is 25 years old and lives in a high risk zone, has been working as an auto mechanic for several years.  He has many customers because of the good work he does.  The young man lives in his own house with his daughter.  He is asking for a loan to buy spare parts in bulk and machinery needed for him to continue working.

loans.use: to buy spare parts wholesale and machinery to be able to fix cars

loans.name: Tereza

texts.en:
Tereza is a 37-year-old married woman with four children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She buys and sells cocoa in addition to the cocoa garden that gives her good yields. She works hard to look after her family, especially paying school fees for her children.

She wants a loan to buy cocoa to sell.

loans.use: to buy cocoa to sell

loans.name: Dolores

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal LIDERANDO LAS PALMERAS ,la socia continua dedicándose al negocio de  restaurante, la socia continua preparando  desayunos, almuerzos y cenas, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día  a su negocio, él sueño de la socia es ampliar y mejorar el negocio de restaurant.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar insumos como arroz, aceite entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the "Liderando Las Palmeras" communal bank. She continues to work at her restaurant. The member is still preparing breakfasts, lunches and dinners. She has had this business for some time now and it is going very well thanks to her determination. The member's dream is to expand and improve her restaurant.

This borrower is applying for a loan in order to buy supplies such as rice, oil and more.

She is very grateful for this loan and promises to make her repayments.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as rice, oil and more.

loans.name: Los Amigos Group

texts.es:
El banco de emprendimiento LOS AMIGOS compuesta por nueve integrantes ocho son mujeres y un varón,  ellas se dedican a distintas actividades como; transportista, venta de jugos batidos, venta de celulares,  venta de refrescos, venta de cosméticos, venta de comida y venta de ropa, por este motivo solicitan un préstamo para ampliar sus negocios.

Silvia es una mujer de 34 años de edad,(en la foto es la señora que esta parada en medio al fondo con blusa rosada) vive con su pareja, tiene 3 hijos de 10, 8 y 16 años, y su negocio es la venta de comida tradicional cruceña.
Ella es buena madre, responsable, trabajadora su actividad la desarrolla en la zona del Plan 3000 lugar de clima cálido tropical muy húmedo; con una temperatura ambiente que varía durante el día entre 21-35 grados centígrados durante todo el año. 
Silvia es de tez morena, cabello negro largo, habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza. Sus hijos estudian en la escuela pública y viven en una casa propia que cuenta con agua potable y electricidad. Su negocio es la venta de comida actividad que empezó desde muy pequeña ya que su Mama fue quien le enseño…” comenta. Su sueño es tener un restaurante y servir variedad de platillos ya que tiene mucha clientela por la buena sazón que le pone a sus comidas. Ella desea realizar una inversión en su negocio mediante la compra de una heladera para almacenar en buen estado sus alimentos. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 5 años que viene realizando esta  actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Silvia solicita un préstamo para la compra de una heladera.
texts.en:
The "Los Amigos" communal bank has nine members - eight women and one man. The members have different businesses, including providing transport, and selling milkshakes, mobile phones, soft drinks, make up, meals, and clothes. The members are applying for a loan in order to expand their businesses.

Silvia is 34 years old. (In the photo, she is in the middle of the back row wearing a pink top.) Silvia lives with her partner. She has three children, ages sixteen, ten, and eight, and has a business selling traditional Santa Cruz food.

Silvia is a good mother. She is responsible and hard-working.Silvia's business is in the Plan 3000 area of the city, an area with a hot, tropical, and very humid climate. The day-time temperature here oscillates between 21 and 35º Celsius throughout the year.

Silivia is dark skinned, has long black hair and speaks Spanish in her everyday life and at work. Her children are studying at the local school and the family lives in a house that they own, which has both running water and electricity.

Silvia started her business selling meals at a very young age; she says that her mother taught her this skill. Silvia's dream is to have a restaurant and serve various dishes. She already has many customers because of how tasty her meals area. 

Silvia wants to invest in her business by buying a fridge to store her food. This is Silvia's first loan with the institution in five years of doing this work.

For these reasons, Silvia is applying for a loan in order to buy a fridge.

loans.use: to buy a fridge.

loans.name: Durga Group

texts.en:
For the development of the household, some extra income is needed. So nine women from Siletkani village located in the Tusra NAC in Balangir district, one of the poorest districts of Odisha, India, stepped out and decided to build a secure future for their families with their contributions. They formed a group named “Durga” to avail credit from Mahashakti Foundation for the development of their existing business. 

Indumati, the leader of the group, is standing fourth from the right with her hand raised in the photo. She is 28 years old and lives with her husband and one son. Indumati hails from a traditional cloth weaving community. For the last 10 years, she has been running a cloth weaving business with her husband. Now she has two hand looms for weaving tawels. Her husband purchases the yarn/thread from a trader in a village that is 20 km away. They prepare 90 to 100 pieces from a bundle of yarn, which costs around 20,000 to 25,000 rupees. Indumati does the initial processing of the yarn to make it ready for weaving and after that, her husband fits it to the hand loom and weaves the tawel. They only weave tawels because of the demand in the market. Her family works around 8-10 hours a day and weaves four to five pieces of tawel from each hand loom per day. Indumati sells her products to the local traders on a weekly basis. She earns a monthly income of Rs 7,000, which is not sufficient to maintain her family. With the loan, she wants to buy thread/yarn in bulk. Purchasing more stock at a time will help her to reduce the purchasing & transportation costs of the raw materials. Indumati wishes to grow her business and save enough to complete the construction of her half-constructed house. The other eight members of the group are doing diary, vegetable cultivation and weaving, respectively.

loans.use: to buy thread/yarn in bulk

loans.name: José Santos

texts.es:
José, de 66 años de edad, estudió sexto grado, está casado y es padre de 3 hijos, dos de ellos ya son independientes. 

José, tiene una pequeña granja de pollos de engorde desde hace cinco años, él se dedico a este trabajo porque sus hermanos tenían ese negocio y vio que generaba buenas ganancias, ahora el es independiente y tiene su propio negocio.

José, con el crédito comprará 50 pollos más, para ampliar su granja y así mejorar sus ganancias y la otra parte del dinero, la invertirá en gastos personales.

El sueño de José, es ampliar su granja, de manera que sea rentable y pueda darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
José is 66 years old and has a sixth grade education. He is married and a father to three children, two of whom are now independent adults.

José has had a small chicken farm for five years. He does this work because his siblings had the same kind of business and he saw that they were earning good profits. José is now independent and has his own business.

José will use this loan to buy 50 chickens to expand his business and increase his profits. He will use the remainder of the loan for personal expanses.

José's dream is to expand his farm so that it is profitable and so that he can offer his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy 50 chickens to fatten up.

loans.name: Jai Jagannath Group

texts.en: Nine women from Siletkani village, located in Tusura NAC in Balangir district of Odisha, India, stepped out and decided to build a secure future for their families with their contributions. They formed a group named “Jai Jagannath” to avail credit from Mahashakti Foundation for development of their existing businesses. Raseswari is one of the group members. She is standing fourth from the right with her hand raised in the photo. She is 28 years old and lives with her husband and one son. Raseswari hails from a traditional cloth-weaving community. She has been running a cloth-weaving business with her husband. Presently, she has three hand looms for weaving tawels. Her husband purchases the yarn/thread from a trader 20 km away from her village. They knit 90 to 100 pieces from a bundle of yarn, which costs around 20,000 - 25,000 rupees. Raseswari has engaged two workers for the initial processing and weaving of tawels. She only produces tawels because of the demand in the market. Raseswari gets four to five pieces of tawels from each Handloom per day. She sells her products to the local traders, who come to take the products from her home on a weekly basis. From this business, she earns a monthly income of 9,500 rupees, which is not sufficient to materialize her future dream. With the present loan, she wants to buy thread/yarn in bulk. Purchasing more stock at a time will help her to reduce the purchasing and transportation costs of the raw materials. Raseswari wishes to grow her business and save enough to complete her half-constructed house. The other eight members of the group also want loan for their cloth weaving businesses.

loans.use: to buy thread/yarn in bulk

loans.name: Archana's Group

texts.en:
Nashamin, about 47 years old, is the group leader of a 10-member group from Anandanagar village in Balangir district of Odisha, India. Her family is comprised of four members: her husband, and one son about 15 years old and one daughter about 12 years old. Both are students. The member standing fourth from right with her hand raised is Nashamin. 

She has been running a tent house specializing in an advanced sound system with the help of her husband for the last 3 years. At present, her family income is about Rs 7,500 per month, which is not sufficient to manage her family and to keep pace with the present society. To improve her living condition and to earn some extra income, she wants to avail a loan.  With the loan, she will purchase sound boxes, audio players, and other equipment necessary for a sound system. She has a dream of expanding her business and providing better education to her children.

The other nine members also want loans for a diary and a goat business.

loans.use: to purchase sound boxes and audio players

loans.name: Sharopat

texts.ru: Шаропат проживает на районе Пяндж. Пяндж находиться в юго-западной стороне республики. Ей 62 года. У нее четверо детей и нет мужа. Несмотря на свой возраст Шаропат уже 16 лет работает на земле. Она выращивает овощи. Сейчас Шаропат сажает новый урожай. Ей надо еще купить семена и минеральные удобрения. У нее закончились деньги и она не может закончить посев и есть опасения, того что она вовсе останется без урожая весной. Шаропат видит выход из положения только в получении кредита. Вы можете помочь Шаропату купить семена и минеральные удобрения.
texts.en: Sharopat lives in the Pyandj district. Pyandj is located in the south-western part of the republic. She is 62 years old. She has four children and no husband. Despite her age, Sharopat has been working on the land for 16 years. She grows vegetables. Now Sharopat is planting a new crop. She still needs to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers. She ran out of money and cannot complete the sowing and is worried that she will be left without a harvest in the spring. Sharopat sees obtaining a loan as the solution for her situation. You can help Sharopat buy seeds and mineral fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is 53 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Irene runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, eggs, canned goods, groceries, etc..

Irene has been in this business for 2 years now. 

In the future, Irene would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy stock to sell in her sari sari (general store).

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Nuestra Señora De la Luz se reúne cada 15 días en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive el señor Juan, tiene 24 años de edad, está soltero y vive en casa de los padres. El lleva dos ciclos en el grupo de crédito y le gusta por la facilidad para conseguir los créditos.
Don Juan es un joven muy trabajador que le gusta a base de esfuerzo salir adelante, el es taxista, tiene su carro propio en el cual realiza sus recorridos brindando un servicio de calidad a los clientes. El necesita este crédito para realizar arreglos en el aire acondicionado del carro el cual le está fallando y necesita brindar un mejor servicio, ya que de esto depende que su clientela lo siga llamando para sus transportes, el lleva 5 años realizando esta labor la cual le permite salir adelante.
Este crédito es para arreglar  el aire acondicionado del taxi. Lleva dos ciclos  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le brinda la institución. Sus sueños son seguir adelante con buena salud.
texts.en:
The "Nuestra Señora de la Luz" loan group meets every fortnight in the city of Manta, known for its beautiful beaches that receive many visitors throughout the year. Manta is city whose beauty is beaten by no other, and it has many tourist attractions.

And it is here that 24-year-old Juan lives. He is single and lives with his parents. He has been with the loan group for two cycles and likes it because it is easy to apply for loans.

Juan is a very hard-working young man who likes to work hard in order to get ahead. Juan is a taxi driver: he owns his own vehicle, which he uses to offer a good-quality service to customers. Juan needs this loan in order to fix the air conditioning in his car. It is not working properly and he needs it in order to offer good service, which his customers need. Juan has been doing this work for five years; it allows him to move forward in life.

This loan will be used to fix the air conditioning in Juan's taxi.

Juan has been with the loan group for two loan cycles and he likes it because the loans help him. Juan's dreams are to move forward and keep his good health.

loans.use: to fix the air conditioning in his taxi.

loans.name: Parviz

texts.en: Parviz is a goal oriented man. He lives in rural area. He is single and is a university student. He has a dream to be a doctor. He feels a sense of responsibility for his community and wants to be helpful for people. He also helps his parents run a business. He is a second year student and his parents are not able to pay tuition for the university. Parviz is asking for financial support to pay university tuition.

loans.use: To pay for tuition.

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
Benson is 32 years. He is married to Dorothy and  blessed with two children aged between six and two years. 

Benson has been running a pharmacy where he sells various types of medicine for the last six years, earning a monthly income of Kshs. 30,000.  He has requested his first loan with VisionFund Kenya of Kshs. 30,000 which he will use to add more stocks of assorted medicines.

He will use the anticipated income to educate his children and provide for his family's basic needs.

loans.use: to add more stocks of assorted medicines.

loans.name: Cathlyn

texts.en:
Cathlyn is 24 years old and single.  

She is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Cathlyn requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Cathlyn has been in pig fattening for three years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business.

In the future, Cathlyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Cora

texts.en:
Cora is 47 years old and married with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Cora has a food vending business in the Philippines. Cora requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients like pasta, spices, meat, etc. for her food production business.

Cora has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like pasta, spices, and meat for her food production business

loans.name: Jubile

texts.en:
Jubile is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Jubile is 42 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Jubile has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients for her food production business.

Jubile has been in this business for eight years. In the future, Jubile would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira works hard to support her family. Elvira is married and has a business selling ready-to-wear clothes in the Philippines.

She has  requested a PHP 16000 loan through NWTF to purchase more ready-to-wear clothes to sell.

Elvira has been in this business for 17 years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Elvira would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more ready-to-wear to clothing to sell.

loans.name: Genara

texts.en:
Genara is a married woman with three children who are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Genara is 48 years old. 

She has a plastic bag making business in the Philippines. Genara requested a PHP 11000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more materials for her business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Genara has been in this business for 21 years. In the future, Genara would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more materials for her business.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia works hard to support her family. Lucia is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Lucia has been in this business for 31 years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Lucia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Maria Gloria

texts.en:
Maria Gloria works hard to support her family.  She is widowed and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell to her customers.

Maria Gloria has been in this business for 46 years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Maria Gloria would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Woroud

texts.en:
Woroud is a 31-year-old single lady with special needs.  She is a Palestinian refugee who has been working in her grocery shop for four years to cover her needs and expenses.

Woroud is an ambitious lady who is working hard to develop her business, thus today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to start an additional business through selling prepaid mobile cards as a second source of income in an attempt to increase her income and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to start an additional business through selling prepaid mobile cards as a second source of income,

loans.name: Saodat

texts.ru: Саодат 37 летняя жительница района Пяндж. Она честная и ответственная женщина. Саодат замужем и ее муж находится на заработках в Российской Федерации. У нее двое детей. Саодат успевает заниматься и домашними делами и воспитанием детей, а также продвигать сразу два бизнеса, чтобы дети не знали не в чем нужду. Саодат дома предоставляет услугу портнихи. Она берет заказы на шитье женской одежды. Второй бизнес является в сфере торговли. Саодат покупает продукты питания и перепродает их на разных рынках. И на данный момент ей нужно купить  больше товара, чтобы увеличить товарооборот и соответственно доход,  для обеспечения новых экономических возможностей для детей.
texts.en: Saodat is a 37-year-old resident of the Pyandj district. She is an honest and responsible woman. Saodat is married, and her husband works in the Russian Federation. She has two children. Saodat is able to do household work and raise her children and also run two businesses at a time, so that her children never know any needs. Saodat provides seamstress services at home. She accepts orders to sew women's clothing. Her second business is in the retail sector. Saodat buys food products and resells them at various markets. At the present time, she needs to buy more products in order to increase product turnover and, thus, her income, to provide new economic opportunities for her children.

loans.use: to buy food products for resale

loans.name: Habibullo

texts.en: Habibullo is a hardworking man. He was born in 1980. He lives in rural area and is married with two children. His wife is housekeeper. . He has a business where he buys and sells livestock. He knows his business very well and has good practical experience. Habibullo is planning to have good conditions for the winter season at his house. He is asking for financial support to buy heater materials.

loans.use: To buy heater materials.

loans.name: Mayra Antonieta

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Nuestra Señora De la Luz se reúne cada 15 días en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Mayra, tiene 32 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión  libre y de esta relación tiene tres hijos de 16, 13 y 4 años  de edad, una de ellos aun viven con ellos. Su esposo es comerciante.
Doña Mayra con la intención de ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto poder salir adelante en el hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, zapatos por catalogo así como también productos Avon, Yanbal  (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas), su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta, ella sale en sus ratos libres y también vende en su casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes más conocidos,  ella deja a crédito y cobra cada quince días. Tiene más de 4 años que se dedica a esta actividad la cual comenzó con el primer crédito que recibió del grupo.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar en ropa, zapatos, cremas y perfumes. Lleva 4 años en el  Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos. Sus sueños es tener un buen local.
texts.en:
The communal bank group, Nuestra Señora de la Luz, meets every 15 days in the city of Manta, known for its beautiful beaches, which are visited all year round, and for being a city with unequaled beauty, attracting many tourists.

This is where Mayra, 32, lives.  She lives with her common-law husband and has three children, ages 16, 13 and 4, one of which lives at home.  Her husband is a merchant.

In an effort to earn her own income and provide for the household, Maya sells all kinds of clothing, shoes by catalogue and also Avon and Yanbal beauty products and women's accessories.  She sells door-to-door and goes out in her free time.  She also sells from home to her better-known customers.  She sells on a credit basis and collects payment every 15 days.  She has been in business for over four years and started out with a loan she received from the group.

This loan will be used to buy clothing, shoes, creams and perfumes.  She has been a member of the group for four years and likes the assistance provided by the loans.  Her dream is to have a nice shop.

loans.use: To buy clothing, shoes, creams and perfumes.

loans.name: Giorgi Guiseppi

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Nuestra Señora De la Luz se reúne cada 15 días en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive don Giorgi, tiene 22 años de edad, está soltero y vive en casa de los padres. El lleva dos años en el grupo de crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le permiten salir adelante.
El señor Giorgi es un joven muy trabajador que se dedica a la venta de teléfonos y accesorios para los mismos, su forma de venta es ambulante, el importa directamente de los Estados Unidos los teléfonos y luego los entrega a sus clientes, vende a crédito y cobra en dos partes. El lleva más de 4 años dedicado a esta actividad con la cual se gana lo suyo que le sirven para salir adelante.
Este crédito es para comprar teléfonos y  accesorios telefónicos. Lleva dos años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos ellos sale adelante. Sus sueños son tener un gran local.
texts.en:
The communal bank group, Nuestra Señora de la Luz, meets every 15 days in the city of Manta, known for its beautiful beaches, which are visited all year round, and for being a city with unequaled beauty, attracting many tourists.

This is where Giorgi, 22, lives.  He is single and lives with his parents.  He has been a member of the loan group for two years and he likes how the loans help him get ahead.

Giorgi is a very hard-working young man who sells telephones and telephone accessories.  He works as a street vendor and imports phones from the United States which he delivers to he customers.  He sells on a credit basis and collects payments in two phases.  For over four years he has been in the business, earning his own income to get ahead.

This loan will be used to buy telephones and telephone accessories.  He has been a member of the loan group for two years and likes the fact that the loans help him prosper.  His dream is to have his own shop.

loans.use: To buy telephones and accessorios.

loans.name: Isaias Gustavo

texts.es:
Isaias es un veterano con mucha experiencia en el campo. 
Es humilde y sencillo, tiene un gran don de gente y energía suficiente para poder cualquier cultivo a producir.
El tiene un cultivo de café el cual trabaja todos los días para vender sus cosechas en la plaza de mercado del municipio de Guatape.
Gracias a sus años de experiencia y enseñanzas que le dio su padre desde niño, tiene plena capacidad para trabajar y para asesorar en estos temas a los demás agricultores de la zona que necesiten ayuda con su producción. 
El solicita el crédito para comprar insumos agrícolas como fertilizantes, semillas de Café y pesticidas, de esta manera inyectara capital a su actividad y mejorara sus cosechas de una manera significativa enfrentando la dificultad más grande que tiene que son el clima tan cambiante que afecta su cosecha.

 Tiene mucha fe en su negocio y grandes esperanzas en las personas solidarias que apoyan a los campesinos trabajadores de Colombia como lo hace la Corporación Interactuar.

Apoya a un humilde agricultor para que pueda sacar adelante sus tierras con un préstamo!
texts.en:
Isaias has a lot of experience working in the country.

He is humble and simple, and has great people skills and plenty of energy for growing any crop.

Isaias has coffee crops that he looks after every day. He sells his crops at the market square in the municipality of Guatape.

Thanks to his experience and everything that his father has been teaching him since he was a child, Isaias is very capable of working and of consulting on farming work with others in the area who need help with their production.

Isaias is applying for a loan in order to buy farming supplies such as coffee seeds and pesticides. This way, Isaias can inject capital into his business and improve significantly his crops. He can also face the biggest adversity of his business which is the changing climate that affects his harvest.

Isaias has a lot of faith in his business, and has high hopes for those who support hard-working peasants of Colombia, such as those at Corporación Interactuar.

Support a humble farmer and help him to get ahead with a loan!

loans.use: to buy farming supplies such as coffee seeds and pesticides.

loans.name: Ivan De Jesus

texts.es:
Ivan, con 40 años de edad, es casado y padre de 3 hijos. Se caracteriza por ser un hombre muy responsable y trabajador, un visionario y buen negociante. 

Siempre ha trabajado como comerciante, vendiendo flores en el municipio de La Ceja y, desde hace 2 años tiene su propio negocio.  
Ha sabido superar tiempos difíciles en el comercio y sueña con comprarse su casa propia y tener un negocio que perdure en el tiempo; es por ello que Ivan acudió a solicitar un préstamo, el cual utilizará para comprar una mesa de trabajo, un asunchadora, compra de surtido de trabajo y realizar mejoras a su negocio.
Ivan es un hombre muy organizado aunque ha tenido que enfrentar la competencia comercial del sector.  
La suma de todos sus esfuerzos le brindan a toda su familia una calidad de vida excelente.  

Anímate a prestar al negocio de Ivan!
texts.en:
Ivan is 40 years old, married, and a father to three children. He is very responsible and hard-working; he is a visionary, and a good businessman.

Ivan has always been a businessman, selling flowers in the municipality of La Ceja. He has had his own business for two years.

Ivan has been able to overcome difficult times in his business. He dreams of buying his own house and of having a business that will last a long time. For this reason, Ivan has come to apply for a loan that will be used to buy a work table and stock, and to make improvements to his business.

Ivan is very organised. At work he has had to face competition from other businesses.

As a result of his hard work, Ivan is able to provide his family with a great quality of life.

Go on a make a loan to Ivan's business!

loans.use: to buy a work table and stock, and to make improvements to his business.

loans.name: Luz Stella

texts.es:
En su Vida, Luz ha intentado siempre encontrar alternativas que le permitan vivir mejor y tener un negocio pleno y prospero, en esta búsqueda insaciable, encontró su gran oportunidad en la venta de helados y mantecados desde su propio hogar.

Estos alimentos los vende a precios muy favorables, por lo que hasta ahora ha podido contar con unas ventas muy estables.

Solicita un préstamo para la compra de un enfriador para almacenar una mayor cantidad de helados y de esta forma mejorar su inventario y capital.

Trabaja todos los días durante 15 horas y con este negocio intenta sacar adelante a sus dos hijos.

Apoya a Luz con un préstamo y haz que su negocio sea mucho mejor.
texts.en:
Throughout her life, Luz has tried to find alternative ways to live a better lifestyle and have a successful, prosperous business.  In her endless search she found a great opportunity to sell ice cream and custards from home.  These types of food can be sold for a very good price so her sales to date have been very stable.  

She is requesting a loan to buy a freezer to store more ice cream to increase her inventory and working capital.

She works 15 hours every day and, through the business, tries to provide for her two children.

Please support Luz with this loan and help improve her business.

loans.use: To buy a freezer.

loans.name: David Enrique

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Nuestra Señora De la Luz se reúne cada 15 días en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive don David, tiene 33 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión  libre y de esta relación tiene dos hijos de 14 y 11 años  de edad, los dos estudian en colegio y escuela. Su mujer trabaja en un local de venta de dulces.
El señor David es un hombre  muy trabajador que hace lo posible para sacar adelante a su familia, el trabaja al igual que su mujer en una dulcería en la ciudad por lo cual recibe un sueldo mensual, el con el paso de los días aprendió como se elaboran los dulces y también en sus ratos libres con la ayuda de su mujer elaboran todo tipo de dulces, ellos reciben contratos de personas particulares ya sea para fiestas o cualquier compromiso sociales, de esta forma ellos salen adelante esperando  algún día tener su propio local, llevan 8 meses dedicado a esta actividad.
Este crédito es para comprar harina, sabores y muchos otros ingredientes para preparar los dulces. Lleva dos ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos ellos salen adelante. Sus sueños son tener un gran local.
texts.en:
The "Nuestra Señora de la Luz" loan group meets every fortnight in the city of Manta, known for its beautiful beaches that receive many visitors throughout the year. Manta is city whose beauty is matched by no other, and it has many tourist attractions.

And it is here that 33-year-old David lives. He has a partner and two children, ages 14 and 11 years old; both are in school. David's partner works at a sweet stall.

David is very hard-working and does everything that he can in order to move forward with his family. Like his wife, David works at a sweet shop in the city, thus earning him a monthly salary. With time, David has learned how sweets are made and, in his spare time, with help from his wife, the couple makes all sorts of sweets at home. The couple receives commissions for sweets for parties and other social events. Through this work, the couple is moving forward and hoping, one day, to have their own premises. The couple has been doing this work for eight months.

This loan will be used to buy flour, flavourings and many other ingredients for producing sweets. David has been with the loan group for two cycles and he likes it because the loans help him to get ahead. David's dream is to own large premises.

loans.use: to buy flour, flavourings and other ingredients.

loans.name: Munavvara

texts.ru: Мунаввара является поваром по профессии. Она работает в столовой уже 10 лет. Мунаввара замужем и имеет 5-летнюю дочь. Ей самой 38 лет. Ее муж работает в частном цехе. Они живут в городе Худжанд. Мунаввара сейчас остро нуждается в заемных средствах. Дело в том что она начала ремонт в доме, однако для его завершения испытвает финансовую нехватку. В связи с этим Мунаввара в надежде на помощь обратилась за кредитом. Она хочет по-быстрее завершить ремонт в доме до наступления суровых холодов. Помогите Мунаввара в эту трудную минуту. В канун Рождества их семья верит в чудо и доброту людей.
texts.en: Munavvara's profession is a cook. She has been working at a cafe for 10 years. Munavvara is married and has a 5-year-old daughter. Munavvara is 38 years old. Her husband works at a private factory. They live in the town of Khujand. Munavvara now urgently needs a loan. The thing is that she started repairs at home, but has run into a financial shortage prior to finishing it. Due to this, Munavvara, with hope for help, requested a loan. She wants to quickly finish the repairs at home prior to the onset of severe colds. Please help Munavvara in this difficult moment. With the coming of Christmas, her family believes in a miracle and kindness of people.

loans.use: to complete repairs at home

loans.name: Primitiva

texts.en:
Primitiva is 48 years old and married with three children.

Primitiva works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

Primitiva has borrowed and paid back 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 4 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Primitiva aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Rowena is 30 years old and has two children who are in school.

Rowena has a business selling ready-to-wear in the Philippines. Rowena requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more stocks of ready-to-wear to sell to her customers.

Rowena has been in this business for 4 years. In the future, Rowena would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of ready-to-wear to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Reida

texts.en:
Reida is 39 years old and married with three children. With two children currently in school, Reida works very hard to provide for them.

Reida runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,500 loan through NWTF to buy additional groceries to sell in her general store.

Reida has been in this business for 4 years and sells a variety of items such as candies, biscuits, fabric conditioners, cooking oil, eggs, canned goods, etc. 

In the future, Reida would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Ma. Solidad

texts.en:
Ma. Solidad is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Ma. Solidad is 34 years old and has three children who are in school.

Ma. Solidad has a food vending business in the Philippines. Ma. Solidad requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Ma. Solidad has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Ma. Solidad would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Em Em

texts.en:
Em Em is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a vegetable-vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell to her customers in her vegetable-vending business.

Em Em has been in this business for 2 years. Em Em earns additional income from a general store.

Em Em has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Encarnacion

texts.en:
Encarnacion is 44 years old and has four children. Encarnacion is married and has two children who are currently in school.

Encarnacion is in the agricultural business, pig-fattening in the Philippines. Encarnacion requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Encarnacion has been in pig-fattening for 6 years now, and has borrowed 8 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Encarnacion would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a vegetable-vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to purchase more vegetables to sell on her vegetable stall in her vegetable-vending business.

Delia has been in this business for 24 years. Delia earns additional income from a general store.

Delia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables to sell on her vegetable stall.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en:
Beatriz is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Beatriz is 48 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Beatriz has a food vending business in the Philippines. Beatriz requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like meat, spices, fish, vegetables, etc. for her food production business.

Beatriz has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Beatriz would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, spices, fish, vegetables, for her food production business.

loans.name: Marcilita

texts.en:
Marcilita works hard to support her family. Marcilita is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Marcilita requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients for her food production business.

Marcilita has been in this business for 12 years now.

Marcilita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Emma works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Emma is borrowing PHP 29,000 through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Emma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

loans.name: Ma. Roselyn

texts.en:
Ma. Roselyn is 40 years old and married with four children. With three children currently in school, Ma. Roselyn works very hard to provide for them.

Ma. Roselyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her general store.

Ma. Roselyn has been in this business for 2 years and sells a variety of items such as detergent soap, canned goods, soft-drinks, noodles, coffee, sugar, etc. 

In the future, Ma. Roselyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Charito

texts.en:
Charito is single and has a business buying and selling ready-to-wear in the Philippines.

Charito requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of ready-to-wear like blouses, shorts, t-shirts, etc. to sell.

Charito has been in this business for 6 years now.

In the future, Charito would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of ready-to-wear like blouses, shorts, t-shirts to sell.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a tailoring business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy additional materials for her tailoring business.

Carmelita has been in this business for 34 years. Carmelita earns more income from selling ready-to-wear.

Carmelita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her business.

loans.name: Hilaria

texts.en:
Hilaria is 36 years old and has two children. Hilaria is married and has two children who are in school.

Hilaria is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. Hilaria requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Hilaria has been farming vegetables for 4 years now, and has borrowed 9 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Hilaria would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Airen

texts.en:
Airen is 34 years old and married with three children. With three children currently in school, Airen works very hard to provide for them.

Airen runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like noodles, eggs, canned goods, snack foods, sanitary pads, vinegar, coffee, etc. to sell.

Airen has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items such as noodles, eggs, canned goods, snack foods, sanitary pads, vinegar, coffee, etc. 

In the future, Airen would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items like noodles, eggs, canned goods, snack foods, sanitary pads, vinegar, coffee to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to carry on improving her home, and therefore also provide her with better sanitary conditions and improve her levels of security.

loans.name: Gloria Gabriela

texts.es: Gloria es una joven de 24 años de edad graduada como perito mercantil y contador público quien también es madre soltera de 2 hijos menores que aún no tienen la edad para estudiar en preescolar. Desde hace 4 años ella se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general pues no tiene más ingresos económicos por otra parte o por otro negocio siendo sus clientes las diferentes personas que trabajan en instituciones privadas o públicas. Su madre se involucra en el cuidado de sus dos hijos mientras ella trabaja siendo ella su apoyo en el cuidado y protección de los mismos. Ella ofrece a sus clientes Billeteras, carteras, cremas para el cuidado de la piel, lociones en general entre otras cosas que son atractivas para dicha clientela. Uno de sus más grandes anhelos es la culminación de sus estudios universitarios, de esa forma tener un importante trabajo que le permita percibir mayores ingresos sin dejar de hacer lo que hace ya que ella considera que sus dos hijos valen el esfuerzo de ambas cosas y se merecen lo mejor. Una de sus metas es el aprovechamiento en esta temporada y quiere mejorar su inventario para ofrecer a sus clientes una mayor variedad de productos en estilos, colores y demás que hagan que su negocio crezca y mejore los ingresos para salir adelante por lo cual solicita apoyo económico por los diferentes inversionistas en KIVA para poder comprar una variedad de productos que ayuden a mejorar mucho su negocio.
texts.en:
Gloria is a youth of 24 years who graduated as a Chartered Public Accountant. She is also a single mother of two young children who are still not old enough to study in preschool. She has earned a living from selling general merchandise for the last 4 years. She has no income from other places or other businesses whether her customers are the different people who work in the public or private instititutions. Her mother is involved in caring for her two children while she works. She is her support in caring for and protecting them.

She offers her customers wallets, purses, skin care creams and general perfumes, among other things which are attractive to aforementioned clientele. One of her greatest desires is to complete her university education and in this way, to have an important job that allows her to earn a higher income without stopping what she does now. She considers her two children to be worth the effort of both things and to deserve the best.

One of her goals is to take advantage of this season and to improve her inventory to offer more variety to her customers in product styles and colors. Also, to grow her business and improve her revenue to get ahead. This is why she is requesting the financial support of the various KIVA investors in order to buy a variety of products that help to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy purses, perfume and creams, amongst others, to sell.

loans.name: Doris

texts.es: Doris de 44 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hija y sus cuatro nietos, se dedica a la elaboración de antojitos como: tostadas de tajaditas de papas, yuca y platanitos su negocio lo tiene ubicado en un lugar muy transitado cerca de su lugar de residencia, por esa razón posee mucha clientela, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de materia prima como: yuca, papa, plátanos, aceite, etc. todo por mayor para la elaboración de estos alimentos y así obtener mejores ganancias para darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Doris is 44 years old. She lives in her own house with her daughter and four grandchildren.

She makes a living making traditional dishes such as fried potato, cassava and plantain chips. Her business is located in a very busy area close to her place of residence. That is why she has a lot of customers.

She requests a loan to buy raw materials in bulk like cassava, potatoes, plantain and oil to make these dishes. This way she will make more profits to provide her family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy raw materials in bulk such as cassava, potato, plantain, oil, etc.

loans.name: Jose Miguel

texts.es:
Miguel, tiene 70 años , la esposa tiene 71 años viven en casa propia no tiene hijos viven los dos solitos en el barrio La Dolorosa que pertenece a Atuntaqui provincia de Imbabura por el sector hay personas que se dedican al comercio y también a la elaboración de artesanías personas que año tras año viene demostrando ser trabajadoras y responsables en todo lo que realizan personas que se identifican por sus tradiciones, costumbres y también ofreciendo hospitalidad en turismo de la zona para atraer a más personas para que disfruten del lugar que es Atuntaqui.

Miguel, tiene su puesto en el mercado donde vende sus granos como frejol, arveja, choclos a todo cliente que hace compras en el mercado esta actividad lo viene realizando 17 años en la cual ha demostrado ser una persona luchadora a pesar de la edad que tiene sigue en mantener el negocio y también la estabilidad de su hogar y tiene responsabilidad en su negocio que ha venido manejando muy bien es una persona de ejemplo en el barrio realiza deporte como el vóley no ha perdido la carisma que tenis y lo sigue teniendo en la calle en el hogar y en todo lugar.

Con el crédito que solicito en el la institución va comprar más mercadería granos por quintales para seguir ofreciendo a todo los clientes que le conoce y también la esposa lo ayuda en la venta en el puesto del mercado, agradece a fundación alternativa por seguirle ayudando en crecer conjuntamente con su negocio.
texts.en:
Miguel is 70 years old and his wife is 71 years old. They have no children and live in their own home. They live in the La Dolorosa neighborhood which belongs to the Atuntaqui province in Imbabura. There are people in this area who earn a living from trade and also by fabricating crafts. People who prove themselves hardworking and responsible year after year in everything they do. People who identify themselves by their traditions, customs and also by offering entertainment for tourism in the area to attract more people to enjoy the site that is Atuntaqui.

Miguel has his stall in the marketplace where he sells grains like beans, peas and corn to all customers who shop in the market. He has been doing this work for 17 years during which he has proven to be a hard working person, in spite of his age. He continues maintaining the business and also the stability of his home. He also runs his business responsibly. He is an exemplary person in the neighborhood and plays sports like volleyball. He has not lost the charisma that he had and continues to have it in the streets, in his home and in all places.

With the loan that he is requesting from the institution, he will buy more wholesale merchandise of grains to continue offering to all the customers who know him. His wife also helps him to sell in the marketplace stall. He thanks the Fundacion Alternativa (Alternative Foundation) for continuing to help him grow together with his business.

loans.use: to buy basic grains in bulk, to restock his business and, with this revenue, to maintain the stability and productivity of his household.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia tiene 68 años de edad, es viuda, vive en casa propia con sus hijos en el distrito de Zaña, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. La población de este distrito se dedica a la crianza de ganado, agricultura y comercio.

Ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de comida como ceviche, papa rellena, tortitas de choclo, etc. (comidas tradicionales de la región). Cuenta con un año de experiencia en el negocio y con clientes fijos quienes brindan muy buenas referencias personales y laborales de ella. Adicionalmente se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como gallinas, patos, pavos, entre otros. El préstamo será utilizado para la compra de una vitrina, sillas y utensilios de cocina para su negocio, con esto Julia espera implementar su negocio y brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes lo que le generará un mayor nivel de ingresos y por ende aumentará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Julia is 68 years old, widowed, and lives in her own house with her children in the Zaña province of Chiclayo, located in the Lambayeque region of northern coastal Peru. The residents of this area work in livestock breeding, farming, and commerce.  

Julia makes a living preparing and selling food like ceviche, stuffed potatoes, sweetcorn pancakes and other traditional food of the region. She has one year of experience in the business and has a regular client base who speak very well of her in both a personal and professional sense. 

She also makes a living breeding small animals like hens, ducks and turkeys etc. 

The loan will be used to buy a display case, chairs and kitchen utensils for her business. Julia hopes to improve her business and offer her clients a better service so she can make a better income and increase her and her family's quality of life.

loans.use: The loan will be used to buy a cabinet, chairs and kitchen utensils for her business.

loans.name: Virgilia

texts.en: Virgilia has joined Paglaum MPC for the chance to obtain loans, which she will use to improve her rice retailing business. She has been doing this type of work for five years and earns 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) per month. Virgilia is now requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP to additionally capitalize her business. She is determined to maintain a good credit standing whatever may happen, so she can always go to the cooperative in the future. While currently she rents her business space, she envisions acquiring it in the future. Virgilia also dreams of renovating her family's little house and is now starting to save for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy four more sacks of rice

loans.name: Geili

texts.es:
Geili tiene 21 años de edad, de estado civil soltero, vive junto a sus padres en el distrito de Cayaltí, ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte del Perú. Sus pobladores se dedican al comercio, agricultura y ganadería.

El se dedica a la crianza y venta de chivos y aves de corral como patos, gallinas, pollos. Adicionalmente brinda servicios agrícolas en su distrito. Cuenta con experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo que se le otorgará será para la compra de una mayor cantidad de animales para aumentar el stock de su negocio, con esto Geili espera aumentar la productividad de su negocio lo que se verá reflejado en su nivel de ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Geili is 21 years old, is single, and lives with his parents in the district of Cayalti, which is located in the Chiclayo province of the Lambayeque region of northern coastal Peru. The residents of the area work in commerce, agriculture and livestock breeding. 

He breeds and sells goats as well as poultry such as ducks, hens and chickens. He also provides farming services for a local company.

He is experienced in the business and has good personal and work references in the area. 

He will use the loan he is being offered to buy a larger variety of animals to increase the stock of his business. By doing this, Geili hopes to increase his business productivity which will reflect his income levels and improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a larger amount of animals to increase his business stock.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa actualmente está separada, tiene sus 70 años no tiene hijos que viva con ella tiene su casa propia en donde vive más de 40 años en un sector donde hay abundante producción agrícola y de ganadería toda familia de la zona se dedica  a la crianza y comercialización de chanchos y de cuyes por la zona hay turismo, platos típicos donde los turistas van al deleite de las papas con cuy.

Rosa se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de chanchos desde hace 6 años en todo ese tiempo a demostrado ser una persona honrada, responsable, luchadora en la tarea que viene realizando en las ventas de chanchos, es una de las primeras personas en el barrio que empezaron con el emprendimiento de crianza de animales es una de las pioneras que ha demostrado que con constancia se puede lograr lo que uno se quiere en esta vida y así viene manejando su propio criadero de chanchos con construcciones de chancheras que son seguras para que los animales estén estables y seguras para las ventas futuras.

Agradece a Fundación Alternativa por el apoyo que le brindaron para incrementar su negocio y seguir creciendo siempre con su actividad demostrando responsabilidad para que su negocio cerca cada día más y también agradece por toda la ayuda de parte de la institución por haber confiado en el negocio que ella ha venido manejando.
texts.en:
Rosa is currently separated from her partner. She is 70 years old and does not have any children that live with her. She has her own house which she has lived in for over 40 years. She lives in an area where there is abundant agricultural and livestock production. All her family that live in the area make a living from raising and selling pigs and guinea pigs. Tourists do visit the area and they really enjoy typical local dishes such as potatoes with guinea pig.   

Rosa has been making a living raising and selling pigs for 6 years. During this period she has proven to be an honourable, responsible and determined person in carrying out her sale of pigs. She is one of the first people in the area to start raising animals and is a one of the pioneers that demonstrated that with perseverance you can achieve whatever you want in this life. For instance, she runs her own pig farm with secure pig pens so that the animals are stable and safe to help with future sales. 

She is grateful for the support that Fundación Alternativa offered her to expand and carry on expanding her business every day. She is also grateful to this institution for all the help they have provided her and for having faith in her business.

loans.use: to purchase piglets and therefore expand her business and use her income to support herself as she lives alone.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana tiene 50 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo e hijos en una zona rural del distrito de Oyotún, ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte del Perú. La vida en el distrito es tranquila, las actividades económicas principales que se desarrollan en el distrito son la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

Ella tiene un restaurante donde se dedica a la venta de comida desde hace 15 años, por lo que tiene una clientela considerable por el exquisito sabor de su comida. Adicionalmente percibe ingresos por la crianza y comercialización de animales como gallos, pollos, gallinas, pavos, patos, cerdos, etc. Cuenta con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. Solicita préstamo para la compra de una mayor cantidad de animales asi como para alimento balanceado para el engorde de estos. Dicha inversión le servirá para tener mayor variedad y productividad en su negocio, con gran influencia en su nivel de ingresos y mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Juana is 50 years old and lives with her husband and children in a rural area in the district of Oyotun, located in the Chiclayo province in the Lambayeque region of northern coastal Peru. Life is quiet in the district and the residents mostly work in agriculture, livestock breeding and commerce. 

Juana has a restaurant where she has sold food for the last 15 years and has built up a solid client base because of the exquisite flavour of her food.
