She also makes an income from breeding and selling animals like roosters, chickens, hens, ducks and pigs etc. 

She has very good personal and work references in the area. 

She is requesting a loan to buy more animals as well as balanced animal feed to fatten her animals. This investment will help her to have a better variety and productivity in her business, greatly influencing her level of income and increasing her and her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a larger variety of animals as well as balanced animal feed to fatten her animals.

loans.name: Diova

texts.en:
Diova is 36 years old and married with three children, two of whom are currently in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur and has a food vending business in Bogo, on the island of Cebu in the Philippines. Diova has requested a 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients like vegetables, meat, spices and rice, for her business.

Diova has been doing this work for ten years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her business

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 42 years old, single and lives in Bogo, on Cebu Island in the Philippines. She fattens pigs for a living and has requested a 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Gemma has been in the pig fattening business for three years now and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is 43 years old and married with two children. She earns a living by fattening pigs in the Philippines. Leonora is borrowing 25,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Leonora has been doing this work for 15 years and also earns additional income from running a bakery. She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria es una mujer de 61 años de edad, casada, tiene 2 hijos de 19 y 16 años, y su negocio es la producción de queso artesanal.
Ella es emprendedora, luchadora, buena madre, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la comunidad ‘alto peñas’ caracterizado por su cercanía al lago sagrado Titicaca, área agrícola dónde se cría ganado; vacuno, ovino y camélido, se vive de la pesca y también de cereales y vegetales del lugar, como la quinua, el chuño, la haba, la papa, etc. caracterizada por el clima seco y frío, con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 1-12 grados centígrados y donde los rayos solares golpean con mucha fuerza la superficie terrestre.
Maria es de tez morena, baja estatura, cabello negro largo trenzado, su vestimenta es tradicional (sombrero, manta y pollera), su lengua materna es el Aymará que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su esposo que se dedica a la agricultura y con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela, viven en una casa construida de adobe con techo de paja que cuenta con electricidad y agua de pozo. Su negocio es la elaboración y venta de queso artesanal; el proceso es con la leche de vaca que obtiene una parte a la mañana y otra a la tarde le agrega  el cuajo que se elabora extrayendo una parte de la ubre de la vaca, ésta comienza a hacerse parecida al yogurt, la mezcla con un cucharón de madera, luego se asienta, formándose la cuajada: la retira y la pone en otro recipiente para la maduración. “vengo produciendo queso constantemente, el trabajo es familiar también colaboran mis hijos…”comenta. Su sueño es producir queso para la venta por mayor. Ella desea realizar la compra de ganado lechero para aumentar su producción. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 20 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Maria solicita un préstamo para la compra de ganado lechero para incrementar su producción de queso.
texts.en:
Maria is a 61-year-old woman, married, with two children, ages 19 and 16, and her business is making traditional cheese. 

She is enterprising, determined, a good mother, responsible, and hard-working. Her business is in the community of "Alto Peñas," characterized by its closeness to the sacred Lake Titicaca, an agricultural area where they raise livestock -- cattle, sheep and camelid, and live on the fish and also the grains and vegetables of the place such as quinoa, freeze-dried potatoes, broad beans, potatoes, etc. It is characterized by a dry and cold climate, with a temperature that varies during the day between 1-12 degrees centigrade, and where the sun's rays hit the earth's surface with great force. 

Maria has tanned skin, is short, has long braided black hair, dresses traditionally (hat, shawl, and pollera [traditional Andean skirt]), her native language is Aymará and she speaks it there, and she speaks Spanish due to the general culture and for the business she does. She shares her life with her husband, who works in agriculture, and with her children, who go to school. They live in an adobe house with a thatched roof that has electricity and well water. Her business is making and selling traditional cheese. The process starts with the cow's milk that she gets part in the morning and part in the afternoon. She adds the curdling agent which she makes by extracting a part of the cow's udder. This begins to look like yogurt, and she mixes it with a wooden ladle, later it sits, curdling. She takes it out and puts it in another container to mature. "I make cheese constantly, the work is done by the family; my children also help..." she says. Her dream is to make cheese to sell in bulk. She wants to purchase dairy cows to increase her production. This is her first loan cycle with the institution in the 20 years she has been doing this work. 

It is for these reasons that Maria asks for a loan to purchase dairy cows to increase her cheese production.

loans.use: to purchase dairy cows to increase her cheese production.

loans.name: Jose Mauricio

texts.es:
José, de 58 años de edad, no estudió, está casado y su pareja trabaja en los oficios domésticos, juntos tienen tres hijos, pero todos tienen sus propios hogares; solamente dos nietos viven con el.

José, trabaja con ganado de repasto, lo ha hecho por siete años y lo aprendió de su padre.- Decidió dedicarse a ésta labor, pues no tenia otra opción.

José, también trabaja como motorista.- Sus nietos le ayudan en los trabajos agricolas, cuando no tienen clase, su horario no se puede medir. 

Con el crédito José, comprará ganado de repasto, con lo cual mejorarán mucho sus ingresos.- José, se sentirá satisfecho, porque con el préstamo suplirá su necesidad de comprar más ganado para seguir trabajando. 

Sus sueños son, seguir trabajando para poder darles un mejor futuro a su familia y así mismo darles estudio a sus nietos, hasta que logren graduarse de la universidad.
texts.en:
José, 58 years old, didn't go to school, he is married and his wife takes care of the household tasks, together they have three children but all have their own home, only two grandchildren live with him. 

José works with cattle, which he has done for seven years, and he learned how from his father. He decided to do this work because he didn't have any other options.

José also works as a driver. His grandchildren help with the agricultural tasks when they don't have school. His schedule isn't able to be measured.

With the loan, José will purchase cattle, which will increase his income a lot. José will feel satisfied because with the loan he will meet his need to purchase more cattle to continue working.

His dreams are to continue working to give his family a better future, and also provide his grandchildren with an education, even managing to graduate from university.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Carlos Eduardo

texts.es:
Carlos, de 18 años de edad, estudió hasta primer año de bachillerato, está soltero, no tiene hijos y solo vive con sus padres. 

Carlos, trabaja con ganado de repasto, éste trabajo lo ha hecho por un año y lo aprendió de su abuelo, decidió hacerlo para obtener un ingreso económico para el sustento de su familia.- Carlos, tambien trabaja como motorista.

La distancia que Carlos, tiene que recorrer para llegar a su lugar de trabajo es de 1 km y viaja a pie o en carro, a veces le apoya su abuelo y un hermano; su horario de trabajo es variado. 

Carlos, necesita el crédito para comprar ganado de repasto, con esto él mejorará mucho sus ingresos económicos y eso le permitirá tener mejor calidad de vida y por lo tanto podrá satisfacer sus necesidades.

Sus sueños son, poder trabajar y adquirir más experiencia en el cuido del ganado y en un futuro tener una ganadería grande.
texts.en:
Carlos, 18 years old, went to school up to the first year of secondary school, is single, doesn't have children, and lives with his parents.

Carlos works with cattle; he has done this work for a year and he learned it from his grandfather. He decided to do it to earn an income to sustain the family. Carlos also works as a driver.

The distance that Carlos has to travel to arrive at his workplace is 1 kilometer and he goes by food or car.  Sometimes his grandfather or a brother help him. His work schedule varies. 

Carlos needs the loan to purchase cattle. With this, he will improve his income a lot and this will allow him to have a better quality of life and therefore will be able to satisfy his needs.

His dreams are to be able to work and acquire more experience in caring for cattle and in the future have a large cattle ranch.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a 45-year-old married woman with five children, four of whom are currently in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur who has a business making accessories and souvenirs in the Philippines. Jocelyn has requested a 15,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy more materials for her business.

Jocelyn has been doing this work for 22 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more materials for her business

loans.name: Archelle

texts.en:
Archelle is 29 years old and married with one child. She works hard to provide for her family, running a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a 13,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her store.

Archelle has taken out and paid back four loans from NWTF before this one. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from selling beauty products and fattening pigs. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Archelle aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Maria Aracely

texts.es:
María, de 64 años de edad, estudió hasta noveno grado de educación básica, es madre soltera, tiene dos hijos, pero no viven en casa porque están casados y tienen sus propios hogares, con María solo vive uno de sus nietos y es quien depende de ella. 

María, trabaja la agricultura, lo ha hecho por 2 años y lo aprendió de su familia, decidió hacerlo para evitar comprar los granos básicos que necesitaba para su alimentación, también recibe remesas de EEUU. 

Anterioemente, trabajaba como empleada en un salón de belleza, como cosmetóloga.- Actualmente, su lugar de trabajo está a 2 cuadras de su casa y viaja a pie y su horario de trabajo es por la mañana de 7:00 a.m. a 11:00 a.m. 

María, necesita el crédito para comprar medicinas para su mamá, con esta dinero mejorara las condiciones de salud de su mamá y eso le dará tranquilidad a María, ya que está muy preocupada por no tener los recursos economicos para comprarle el medicamento a su madre.

Sus sueños son obtener buenas cosechas para poder ayudarle a su mamá, el préstamo le ayudará mucho porque podrá cubrir los gastos de medicamentos de su mamá.
texts.en:
María, 64 years old, went to school up to the ninth grade. She is a single mother, and has two children but they don't live in her home because they are married and have their own homes; only one of her grandchildren lives with her and that is who depends on her. 

María works in agriculture, she has done it for 2 years, and she learned it from her family. She decided to do it to avoid buying basic grains that she needed to eat. She also gets remittances from the US.

Previously, she worked as an employee in a beauty salon as a cosmetologist. Currently the place she works is 2 blocks from her house and she goes by foot and her work schedule is in the morning from 7:00 am to 11:00 am.

María needs the loan to purchase medicine for her mother, with this money, she will improve her mother's health condition and this will also give María peace of mind since she is very worried about not having the economic resources to purchase the medicine for her mother. 

Her dream is to have a good harvest to be able to help her mother. The loan will help her a lot because she will be able to cover the costs of her mother's medicine.

loans.use: to purchase medicines for her mother.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase clothing

loans.name: Dámaso Nelvin

texts.es: Dámaso de oficio albañil, la esposa trabaja en una miscelánea, así juntos unen sus esfuerzos para apoyar los estudios de sus hijos, con la ayuda de crédito le ha realizado mejoras en su vivienda y quiere continuar arreglándola, por eso solicita nuevamente este crédito, ahora para destinarlo a la instalación del entechado, ya tiene paredes levantadas solamente le falta esa parte, de esta manera Dámaso va progresando junto a su familia, con el financiamiento podra comprar los materiales como laminas de zinc, perlines entre otros.
texts.en: Dámaso is a construction worker. His wife works in a general store, and together the combine their efforts to support their children's education. With the help of loans, he has made improvements to his house and he wants to continue fixing it up. For this reason, he asks for another loan, now it will be used to install the roof, since he has raised walls and only lacks this part. In this way, Dámaso will continue progressing with his family. With the loan, he will be able to purchase the material such as metal sheeting, beams, and others.

loans.use: to improve his house, this time installing the roof, and in this way advancing little by little.

loans.name: Onias Eloino

texts.es:
Onias, de 39 años de edad, estudió hasta tercer grado de educación básica, está casado y su pareja trabaja en los oficios domésticos, tiene cuatro hijos que aun viven en casa con el. 

Onias, trabaja con ganado bovino de doble propósito, lo ha hecho por 2 años y lo aprendió de su familia.-Decidió hacerlo para tener un ingreso económico mayor, para cubrir los gastos de la casa. También trabaja con aves de corral y es empleado en una ferretería, antes era empleado jornalero.

Onias, viaja en bus para llegar a su lugar de trabajo, sus hijos le apoyan cuando no tienen clases y su horario no es fijo. 

Onias, comprará ganado bovino de doble propósito, con la adquisición de este nuevo ganado, él mejorará mucho sus ingresos y podrá tener mejor calidad de vida.

Sus sueños son, poder seguir trabajando para tener más ganado y así mismo poder darles estudio a sus hijos y un futuro mejor.
texts.en:
Onias, 39 years old, went to school up to the third grade, is married, and his wife takes care of the household tasks. They have four children who still live at home with him. 

Onias works with cattle with two purposes. He has done this work for 2 years and he learned it from his family. He decided to do it to have more income, to cover the household expenses. He also works with poultry and is an employee at a hardware store. Before, he was a day laborer.

Onias travels by bus to the place where he works. His children help him when they don't have school, and his schedule is not fixed.

Onias will purchase cattle with two purposes. With the acquisition of this new cattle, he will improve his income a lot and will be able to have a better quality of life. His dream is to be able to continue working to have more cattle and also to provide an education and a better future for his children.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Theogen

texts.en:
Theogen is 42 years old. He is married with five children aged between four and 20 years old, all of whom attend school. He is a farmer and has been farming for 14 years. With this loan from Kiva, he would like to buy more fertilizers for his maize crop. The profits from the business will be used to buy food for home consumption.


The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more maize fertilizers.

loans.name: El Exito Group

texts.es:
NILDA Tiene 36 años vive en una población muy vulnerable de la provincia de Esmeraldas  tiene 6 hijos  que se encuentran estudiando en la escuela. Su esposo de dedica a prestar servicios de transporte en una moto taxi que adquirió gracias a sus ahorros.
NILDA desde hace 2 años se dedica a la venta de pollo y plátano verde y produce unos 100 pollos al mes.
Ella con el primer crédito puso una tienda de abarrotes pero no le fue muy bien en ese negocio. Afortunadamente pudo cambiar de actividad y poder pagar el préstamo adquirido.
Estuvo ausente de los préstamos por un año y ahora gestiona un préstamo por $900 dólares con los que fortalecerá la cría de pollos  ampliando la construcción de un galpón.
NILDA se considera una persona muy alegre le gusta trabajar en equipo con sus compañeros de grupo y se siente muy contenta poder crecer en su negocio con préstamos de FODEMI 
Tiene deseos de poder construir un galpón muy grande donde poder criar muchos pollos y poder dar trabajo a la gente de su pueblo. Llegando a distribuir pollos en toda la zona
texts.en:
Nilda is 36 years old and lives in a very vulnerable town in Esmeraldas province. She has 6 children who are students. Her husband works offering transportation services in a motorcycle taxi that he got thanks to his savings.

For the past 2 years, Nilda has worked selling chickens and green plantains and produces some 100 chickens each month.

With the first loan, she opened a grocery store, but this business didn't go well for her. Luckily, she was able to change her work and could pay off the loan she had gotten.

She was absent from the loans for a year and now she is getting a loan for $900, with which she will strengthen her chicken raising, expanding the construction of quarters. 

Nilda considers herself a very cheerful person who likes to work as a team with her group mates and is very happy to be able to grow in her business with the FODEMI loans.

She wants to be able to build very large quarters where she will be able to raise many chickens and provide jobs to the people in her town, being able to distribute chickens in the whole zone.

loans.use: to buy and sell chickens and green plantain and produce some 120 chickens each month.

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
Con 39 años de edad MIRIAN vive con sus 6 hijos en Limones. Es madre soltera y desde hace 2 años se dedica a la administración de su propia tienda de abarrotes en un barrio muy vulnerable de esta pequeña población.
Ella se ayuda económicamente pelando camarón en la orilla salada. Sus hijos están estudiando la escuela y los mayores le ayudan en la tienda en su tiempo libre.
Este es su segundo crédito y recibirá $ 700,00 dólares  con los que invertirá en su tienda llegando a surtir con: aceites, azúcar, carnes de pollo res, pescado,  plátano verde, pan.
Estos créditos son de gran ayuda para la gente que no goza de posibilidades para gestionar préstamos en la banca tradicional.
Gracias a estos préstamos ella apoya a sus hijos en los estudios.
Ella tiene deseos de superar su negocio y poder cubrir las exigencias de los clientes  ofreciendo una extensa gama de productos.
texts.en:
Mirian is 39 years old and lives with her 6 children in Limones. She is a single mother and for the past 2 years, she has worked running her own grocery store in a very vulnerable neighborhood of this small population.

She helps herself economically by shelling shrimp on the seashore. Her children are students and the older ones help in the store in their free time.

This is her second loan and she will get $700.00 which she will invest in her store managing to stock it with oils, sugar, chicken and beef meat, fish, green plantains, and bread.

These loans are a great help for people who don't enjoy the possibilities of getting loans at traditional banks.

Thanks to these loans, she supports her children in their education.

She wants to improve her business and be able to meet her customer's demand, offering them a wide range of products.

loans.use: to invest in her store managing to stock it with oils, sugar, chicken and beef meat, fish, green plantains, and bread.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es: Miguel tiene 24 años de edad y vive con sus abuelos Miguel es un artesano que se especializa en fabricar bustos de mujer y de varón y también gana dinero con la fabricación de  muñecos de carrusel, esta actividad la aprendió de su abuelo, en ese tiempo Miguel tenía 15 años Miguel consigue clientes porque realiza un buen trabajo Miguel quiere un credito para la compra de resina, una materia prima indispensable para su trabajo
texts.en: Miguel is 24 years old and lives with his grandparents. Miguel is a artisan who specializes in making busts of women and men and also earns money by making carousel figures. He learned this work from his grandfather when he was 15 years old. Miguel gets customers because he does good work. Miguel wants a loan to purchase resin, an indispensable raw material for his work.

loans.use: to purchase resin.

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Rodolfo works hard to support his family.

He has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from motorcycle transport. Rodolfo is borrowing PHP 35,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for his food vending business.

Rodolfo has been sustaining his business activities through his past 24 loans from NWTF. He hopes that he hard work will help him attain his dream to save enough money so he could afford to send his children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for his food production business

loans.name: Nerie

texts.en:
Nerie is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Nerie is 44 years old, and has four children who are in school.

Nerie has a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Nerie requested a PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Nerie has been in this business for 10 years. 

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Minerva

texts.en:
Minerva is 57 years old and widowed with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Minerva has a pillow-making business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 29 years. 

Minerva requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more materials for her pillow-making business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Minerva would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more materials for her pillow-making business.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is 47 years old and married with four children.

Analyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, spices, sugar, canned goods, coffee, etc.

Analyn has borrowed and paid 18 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years, and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Analyn aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, spices, sugar, canned goods, coffee, etc

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites works hard to support her family. Marites is married, and has a buy and sell dried coconut meat business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more sacks of dried coconut meat to sell.

Marites has been in this business for 13 years now.

Marites would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of dried coconut meat to sell

loans.name: Acuerdate Que Tienes Que Pagar Group

texts.es:
BACILIA   tiene 39 años de edad- vive con su esposo y sus 9 hijos- 7 de sus hijos estudian y 2 de los mayores aportan con los gastos del hogar trabajan en la pesca y la chica en un restaurante.
El esposo de BACILIA también se dedica a la pesca con su hijo.
BACILIA desde hace varios años también se dedica a la actividad pesquera viendo en esta tarea la forma de subsistir debido a la falta de oportunidad laboral en el medio.
BACILIA realiza varias actividades: pesca- compra venta de pescado y venta de mazamorra en las calles de su pueblo.
Con este nuevo crédito ella implementara la cría de pollos – inversión en la compra de redes para producir más en la recolección del marisco.
Ella desea ser comerciante mayoritaria de mariscos en la zona y ve la acción de FODEMI como una oportunidad para superarse y apoyar en los estudios a sus hijos.
BACILIA forma parte de un grupo de 11 personas organizadas en el trabajo con expectativas en el mejoramiento de su comunidad.
texts.en:
Bacilia is 39 years old and she lives with her husband and their 9 children. Seven of the children got to school, and the older 2 support the household expenses working in fishing and the girl works in a restaurant. 

Bacilia's husband also works in fishing with their son.

Bacilia has, for several years, also worked in fishing, seeing in this work the means to subsist, due to the lack of employment opportunities in the area.

Bacilia does various jobs - fishing, buying and selling fish, and selling mazamorra [milky corn] in the streets of her town. 

With this new loan, she will begin raising chickens. She will invest in the purchase of nets to produce more in the shellfish harvest.

She wants to be a wholesale shellfish vendor in the area, and sees FODEMI's action as an opportunity to better herself and support her children's education.

Bacilia is part of a group of 11 people organized in the work with hope of improving their community.

loans.use: to begin raising chickens, she will purchase water and food dispensers, arrange the coop, and invest in purchase nets to make more in harvesting shellfish.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay the legal fees for her land.

loans.name: Wissam

texts.en:
Wissam is a 30-year-old, married father of two children who works as a distributor to cover the increasing needs and expenses of his beloved family.

Wissam is a hard worker and an ambitious man. Despite his limited salary, he is trying hard to provide his family with better living conditions. 

Today he is acquiring a Youth loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, to start a new business by opening his own bakery and buying the necessary baking tools. This loan is very important to Wissam for it will increase his income and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to start a new business by opening his own bakery and buying the necessary baking tools

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy spare parts and service his motorcycle.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida, 35, is a married woman with three children, all of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Zenaida has a rug-making business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 14 years.

Zenaida requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more materials for her business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Zenaida would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more materials for her business.

loans.name: Inder

texts.en:
Inder is 49 years old. He is married and has five children aged between 7 and 23 years.

He is a farmer and has been farming for 13 years. 

With the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy more fertilizers of maize. The profits from the business will be used to buy food for home consumption.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers of maize.

loans.name: Brigida

texts.es:
Brígida de 59 años de edad,  es muy conocida en su comunidad, es líder y pertenece a la directiva encargada de la organización comunal. Creció con su abuela que fue la encargada de enseñarle buenos principios y la importancia de trabajar. Es comerciante y vende pupusas, tamales y golosinas en la unidad de salud de su comunidad, aprendió de su abuela que siempre se dedicó a vender pupusas, su negocio lo atiende todos los días de la semana.

Solicita el préstamo para comprar una nueva estufa para cocinar los tamales y la comida que prepara, además comprar productos que necesita para su venta. Brígida espera construir instalaciones adecuadas para tener su negocio, ya que piensa vender desayunos, almuerzos y cenas.
texts.en:
Brígida, 59 years old, is very well-known in her community. She is a leader and belongs to the board of a community organization. She grew up with her grandmother who was in charge of teaching her good principles and the importance of working. She is a businesswoman and sells pupusas, tamales, and sweets in the health center in her community. She learned this from her grandmother who always worked selling pupusas. She works at her business every day of the week. 

She asks for the loan to purchase a new stove to cook her tamales and the food the makes. In addition, she will purchase products that she needs for her sales. Brígida hopes to build adequate facilities to have her business, since she plans to sell breakfasts, lunches, and dinners.

loans.use: to purchase a new stove.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Ibrahim would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Ibrahim can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

Like other Babban Gona members, Ibrahim is looking to earn a better income to provide more food and clothing for his family, and he hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: To cover immediate cash needs for food and clothing, thereby eliminating the pressure to sell corn at low prices at harvest time

loans.name: Yehowa No Group

texts.en:
These are the five members of the Yehowa No group. They are very humble, hardworking, and responsible people with good manners and lots of enthusiasm for improving their lives. A few years back, they were all facing poverty, so they decided to join ID Ghana to acquire loans to improve their businesses. They work in the sale of fresh fish, silver products, African fabric, assorted soaps, glass, plates, and drinks.

The featured borrower is Emelia, who is 49 years old, married and has grown children who are taking care of themselves. In the picture, she is standing on the far right. She earns a living by selling fresh fish and silver products to help her husband financially. She has developed a very good relationship with her customers in the community and likes being able to meet their needs. She has a plan to expand and meet all her customers' needs. She wants to buy fish and silver products directly at wholesale prices, and that is why she is requesting this loan.

loans.use: To buy fish and silver products directly at wholesale prices.

loans.name: Nigora

texts.en:
Nigora is a strong woman. She was born in 1986. She lives in a rural area. She is married. She has two children. 

She is a teacher and has been teaching students for about five years. 

Her activity as a teacher does not gain a stable income. In order to endure the cold winter season she is searching for ways of improving her living conditions. She decided to ask for the support of donors. Nigora needs support financially for buying heater materials.

loans.use: To buy heater materials.

loans.name: Antero

texts.es:
Antero tiene 53 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rústico con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en el distrito de Pucará, ubicado en la provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. Las actividades económicas principales que se desarrollan en el distrito son la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

La actividad a la que se dedica Antero es a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de café, con una experiencia en el rubro de 7 años. Cuenta con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo que se le otorgará lo utilizará en la compra de abono y fertilizantes para el mantenimiento de su cultivo de café así como para la contratación de mano de obra para la época de cosecha. Con esto Antero espera mejorar la calidad de su cultivo ofreciendo un mejor producto a sus clientes, lo que le generará un mayor nivel de ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Antero is 53 years old and lives with his spouse and their three children in their own house made of rustic material in the Pucará district in the province of Jaén in the Cajamarca region in the northern Highlands of Peru. The main economic activities in this area are agriculture, ranching, and commerce.

Antero works in agriculture, specifically in the cultivation of coffee. He has approximately 7 years experience in this trade and he has good personal and work references in the area. 

The loan he is asking for will be used to buy manure and fertilizers to maintain his coffee, and also to hire labor for harvest time. By this, Anero hopes to improve the quality of his cofee, and to offer a better product to his customers. This will increase his income and, finally, improve his family's living standard.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizers to maintain his coffee, and also to hire labor for harvest time.

loans.name: Husnoro

texts.en:
Husnoro is a strong woman. She was born in 1993. She lives in rural area and she is married. Husnoro wants to start a business with her husband. She was trained in how to run a successful business. Husnoro had an amazing impression from the ‘To Get Ahead’ course of the women's organization. 

Husnoro decided to start a business in the field of agriculture. She is planning to buy and sell livestock. She has practical experience in this field from her childhood. Husnoro knows well how to do a business in this sphere, but she needs start-up capital for opening a business. So, she is asking for financial support to buy livestock for organizing her new business.

loans.use: To buy livestock for starting a new business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fruit for making good juice.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 42 years old, married, and has seven children, three of whom are currently in school.

Josephine is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Josephine has been in pig fattening for two years now, and she has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. 

Josephine requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

In the future, Josephine would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Lucia works hard to support her family.

She has a furniture-making business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from food vending. 

Lucia is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase more materials like wood, nails, paint, etc. for her furniture-making business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Lucia has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more materials like wood, nails, paint, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Riza

texts.en:
Riza is 57 years old and has seven children. Riza is married, and has one child who is still in school.

Riza is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Riza requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase vaccines, feed, and vitamins for her pigs.

Riza has been in pig fattening for three years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase vaccines, feed, and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Anbin

texts.en:
Anbin is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Anbin is 56 years old, and has two children who are currently in school.

Anbin has a sewing business in the Philippines. Anbin requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more materials for her business like fabric, needles, threads, etc.

She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Anbin has been in this business for five years.  She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more materials for her business like fabric, needles, threads, etc

loans.name: Vestine

texts.en:
Vestine is 52 years old. She is married and has seven children aged between 12 and 28 years, all of whom go to school. Vestine is a farmer and has been farming for 16 years. With the loan requested from Kiva, she would like to buy more fertilizers for maize to sell. The profits from her business will be used to increase her standard of living.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers for maize.

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza is 43 years old and married with four children. With three children currently in school, Liza works very hard to provide for them.

Liza runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Liza has been in this business for three years, and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, eggs, noodles, cooking oil, sanitary pads, etc. 

In the future, Liza would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Nancy works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling bananas.  Nancy is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Nancy has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Idalia Nathaly

texts.es:
Idalia, de 24 años, es bachiller, está soltera, no tiene hijos y solamente vive con su mamá. 

Idalia, trabaja como empleada, pero además los fines de semana trabaja con su mamá, en la venta de pupusas; lo ha hecho por un año y lo aprendieron de una de sus tías y decidió hacerlo para obtener un ingreso económico extra.- También, elabora bandas para madrinas de equipos de fútbol.
 
La venta de pupusas, la tiene en su casa y para ir a trabajar como empleada doméstica viaja en bus.- En el negocio de su casa le apoya su mamá.- Su horario en el empleo es de 7:00 a.m. a 5:00 p.m. y en el negocio es los fines de semana. 

Idalia, necesita el crédtito para invertirlo en su pupuseria, con ésto mejorará mucho sus ingreso económicos y podrán satisfacer las necesidades en su casa. 

Sus sueños son, seguir trabajando como empleada, mientras lográ estabilidad en su negocio.
texts.en:
Idalia, is 24 years old, is a secondary school graduate, is single, has no children, and only lives with her mother. 

Idalia works as an employee, but in addition, on the weekends she works with her mother selling pupusas. She has done it for a year and they learned how from one of her aunts and decided to do it to get additional income. In addition, they make sashes for soccer team sponsors.

She has the pupusa sales in her house and to go to work as a domestic worker, she travels by bus. Her mother helps her in the business in her house. Her work schedule is from 7:00 am to 5:00 pm and the business is on the weekends. 

Idalia needs the small loan to invest in her pupusa business. With this, she will increase her income a lot and will be able to meet the household needs.

Her dream is to continue working as an employee while the business gets established.

loans.use: to invest in her pupusa business.

loans.name: José Manuel

texts.es:
José de 37 años de edad, es casado y tiene 3 hijos estudiando, su esposa es ama de casa solo ella y sus hijos viven con él. José es agricultor sus padres desde muy pequeño le enseñaron la importancia del trabajo y como ganarse la vida honestamente, tiene cerca de 25 años de experiencia y la agricultura es su única fuente de ingresos familiares.

Solicita el préstamo para comprar granos básicos, jabón, detergentes, productos de cocina e higiene personal y demás para iniciar una tienda en su casa, ya que esta ubicada en una zona céntrica de su comunidad con bastante afluencia de personas y quiere tomar ventaja para sacar provecho y poner un negocio. Esperando le resulte la inversión espera después ampliar su tienda una vez adquirido experiencia y luego comprar un vehículo.
texts.en:
José, 37 years old, is married and has 3 children who are students. His wife is a housewife and only she and the children live with him. José is a farmer; since he was very young, his parents taught him the importance of work and how to earn a living honestly. He has nearly 25 years of experience and farming is the family's only source of income. 

He asks for a loan to purchase basic grains, soap, detergent, kitchen and personal hygiene products, and more to open a store in his house, since it is located in a central zone in his community with a sufficient number of people and he wants to take advantage of this to capitalize on it and establish a business, hoping that the investment has results, he hopes to later expand his store once he has experience, and later to purchase a vehicle.

loans.use: to purchase basic grains, soap, detergents, and kitchen and personal hygiene products and more to open a store.

loans.name: Rosel

texts.en:
Rosel is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Rosel is 57 years old, and has one child who is in school.

Rosel has a buy and sell banana business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 22,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more bananas to sell to her customers.

Rosel has been in this business for 12 years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more bananas to sell to her customers

loans.name: Prescila

texts.en:
Prescila is 37 years old and has six children. She is married, and has six children who are in school.

Prescila is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Prescila has been in this business for 10 years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en:
Liezel, a 44-year-old married mother of three, works hard to provide for her family. She has been operating a general store in the Philippines  for five years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Liezel, who has received and repaid five previous loans from NWTF, has requested a new one for PHP 15000 to purchase more items to sell such as shampoo, noodles, canned goods, sugar, etc. She aspires to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell like shampoo, noodles, canned goods, sugar, etc

loans.name: Adriana

texts.es:
Ella es Adriana, una creativa, habilidosa mujer de 36 años de edad, es soltera sin hijos, vive sola y genera sus ingresos gracias a sus manualidades que ella misma confecciona, ejemplo de estas son las que se pueden apreciar en la foto. 
Inicio su negocio gracias a unas capacitaciones que tomo, y ha hecho de esta actividad, su principal fuente de ingresos, Adriana no solo realiza las artesanías, las distribuye en almacenes y llegado al caso sale y las vende.
Adriana solicita un crédito para la compra de tela y accesorios, con las que realiza innovadoras artesanías que de seguro impactaran a sus clientes.
texts.en:
This is Adriana, a creative and skilled 36-year-old. Adriana is single and has no children. She lives alone and earns an income from her handicraft products, an example of which is shown in the photo.

Adriana started her business after taking some training courses and has now made this business her main source of income. Adriana does not just make the handicrafts but sells them at the market.

Adriana is applying for this loan in order to buy material and accessories. With these items, she can make innovating products that her customers will like.

loans.use: to buy material and accessories.

loans.name: Om Group

texts.en:
Madhuri, aged about 34 years, is the leader of a group that hails from Mahadevnagar of Balangir district of Odisha, India. She lives with her husband and one son aged about 9 years and a daughter aged about 7 years. The member standing fifth from left with raised hand is Madhuri. 

Madhuri has been running a dairy business for the last five years. Out of their small income they were maintaining their family in a very pitiable condition. Now she is very much confident in running her business and has developed her business significantly. Her husband is also doing seasonal business. At present her monthly family income is about Rs.7,000. 

Madhuri wants to take a loan to purchase a cow and repair the cattle shed.  This is the first cycle loan.  She has a desire to provide better education to her children.

The other nine members also need loan for vegetable vending, a hotel, a chicken stall, dairy and goatery.

loans.use: to purchase a cow

loans.name: Geraldin

texts.es:
Ella es Geraldin una bella joven de 23 años que con su máquina de confección no solo borda su línea propia de ropa, borda su camino y sus ilusiones, este negocio le ha permitido pagar sus estudios y apoyar en los gastos de su modesto hogar. 
Ella no solo se conforma con lo que tiene ahora, pues sabe que en cualquier momento puede quedar en nada, es muy curiosa e investigativa y está pendiente de las tendencias y modas que están de modas para fabricar su ropa, pues en 5 años se ha propuesto abrir su primer local, generar empleo, ofrecer nuevos productos, y que esto le permita en un futuro comprar vivienda.
Con la ayuda de un crédito Geraldin quiere comprar insumos como lo son telas, Hilos, remaches, y accesorios complementarios para sus prendas. 
Ayuda a este sonriente joven a seguir proyectando su negocio y cumplir con sus metas propuestas, es joven con toda la capacidad para hacer grandes cosas.
texts.en:
Geraldin is a pretty young woman, 23 years old, who with her sewing machine not only embroiders her own line of clothing, but also embroiders her own path and vision. This business has allowed her to pay for her schooling and support the expenses in her modest home.

She not only accepts what she has now, because she knows that in any moment she could be left with nothing, but she is very curious and investigative and is on top of the trends and fashions that are popular to make her clothing. In 5 years, she has proposed opening her first retail space, generate jobs, and offer new products, and this will permit her to purchase her own house in the future. 

With the help of a loan, Geraldin wants to purchase supplies such as fabric, thread, rivets, and complementary accessories for her clothing. 

Help this smiling young woman to continue projecting her business and meet her proposed goals. She is a young woman with all the capacity to do great things.

loans.use: to purchase supplies such as fabric, thread, rivets, and complementary accessories.

loans.name: Ayuba

texts.en: Ayuba is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. He joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Matthew, Barnabas, and Amos. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Ayuba would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to meet his immediate cash needs for food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Ayuba can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% more than the market price at harvest. When asked, Ayuba spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children and eventually to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: To pay for his children's school fees and uniforms, eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest time

loans.name: Yahaya

texts.en: Yahaya is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. He joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Blessing and Meshark.  Before he became a Babban Gona member, Yahaya would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to meet his immediate cash needs for food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, he can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% more than the market price at harvest. When asked, Yahaya spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually ensuring his children are well-educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: To pay for his children's school fees and uniforms, eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest time

loans.name: Muhabbat

texts.en: Muhabbat is a hardworking woman. She was born in 1966, and she lives in rural area. She is married and has three children. Muhabbat is goal oriented woman. She is a nice, responsive, generous person. Muhabbat wants to have a business buying and selling nutrition products. First, she decided to have a place of business. Now, she has found the place for her activity. But for start-up of her business she needs capital. Muhabbat wants to have family business, with all family members part of her business. She is asking for financial support to buy products for her store.

loans.use: To buy nutrition products for organizing new business

loans.name: Vedasto

texts.en:
Vedasto is applying for a 12,000 PHP loan to buy fertilizers, seeds, and other tools for maintain his farm. 

He is thankful for a past of in the same amount, and glad that through his earnings he is able to support his family and meet their daily basic needs.

Vedasto is thanking God and you in advance for a good yield on his farm and the financial assistance that will be given to him.
 
Vedasto dreams to have a bigger farm in the near future. He would like to earn more and save for the future. He prays for a healthy and quiet life. 

He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship members every week to share stories of his work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

 * All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizers, seeds, and tools for maintaim his farm.

loans.name: Farida

texts.en:
Farida is a responsive woman. She was born in 1990. She lives in a rural area. She is married. She has two children. 

For more than six years she has had a business. Her mother-in-law helps her to do the business. She is a sewer. She sews and embroiders. She has good conditions for doing a business. She is a nice, generous and kindhearted person. 

Because of bad conditions of her house in winter season, she is planning to make better conditions for living. She needs financial support for buying heating materials.

loans.use: To buy heating materials.

loans.name: Resse

texts.en:
Resse, 36, is a married woman with two children, both of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Resse has a dried-fish vending business in the Philippines. Resse has been in this business for 11 years. 

Resse requested a PHP 29,500 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of dried fish to sell to her customers. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.
 
Resse would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of dried fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Arlin

texts.en:
Arlin is married and works hard to support her family. 

Arlin has a pig-fattening business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for six years now.

Arlin requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Arlin would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Pascual

texts.es:
Pascual de 69 años de edad, es casado y tiene 3 hijos, es líder de la iglesia y de su comunidad, sus abuelos le inculcaron buenos valores y todo lo que sabe en gran parte se lo debe a ellos. Es agricultor desde que tenía 35 años, esto es su principal fuente de ingresos familiares, su esposa además de estar pendiente de la casa, administra una tienda y juntos solventan los gastos de la casa.

Solicita el préstamo para comprar granos básicos, condimentos, salsas, aderezo y verduras para su tienda ya que es lo que más se vende en esta época de navidad y como el negocio está en una zona muy poblada le da muy buenos resultados. Una de las proyecciones que tiene es poner una pupuseria los fines de semana en la que se involucre su esposa e hija mayor.
texts.en:
Pascual, 69 years old, is married and has 3 children. He is a leader in the church and in his community. His grandparents instilled good values in him and all that he knows, is largely due to them. He has been a farmer since was 35 years old. This is the family's primary source of income. His wife, in addition to caring for the house, runs a store and together they pay the household expenses. 

He asks for the loan to purchase basic grains, seasonings, sauces, dressings and vegetables for his store since those are what sell the most in this Christmas season and, since this business is in a very populated zone, it has good profits. One of his projections is to establish a pupusa business on the weekends, which would involve his wife and older daughter.

loans.use: to purchase basic grains, seasonings, sauces, dressings and vegetables for his store.

loans.name: Bwanda Bakyala Kwetungura Group

texts.en:
Solome is a member of Bwanda Bakyala Kweterana. She is a 50-year-old married lady with five children. She is a resident of Rusheshe-Buhunga-Rukungiri. Solome operates a restaurant at Bwanda Trading center, which she has operated for over 10 years and it has been her main source of income. But she later found out that her capital alone couldn’t sustain her business and she decided to join Bwanda group to access financial assistance from Ugafode.

Solome applied for a loan of 600,000 to buy utensils for her restaurant so as to serve more customers. The whole group applied for a loan of 3,700,000 and is happy with Ugafode’s financial assistance, which has improved their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy utensils for her restaurant

loans.name: Yahaya

texts.en: Yahaya is a maize farmer from Makera village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, he would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Yahaya can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% more than the market price at harvest. Yahaya, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and hopes to make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices at harvest time

loans.name: Ayuba

texts.en:
Ayuba is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. He joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Jenefa and Yusha.  

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Ayuba would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Ayuba can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% more than the market price at harvest. 

When asked, Ayuba  spoke of his  ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to ensure his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: to pay for child school fees and uniforms; eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Abdul-Hamidu

texts.en:
Abdul-Hamidu is a maize farmer from Katselle village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Abdul-Hamidu would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Abdul-Hamidu can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% more than the market price at harvest. 

Abdul-Hamidu, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, and eliminate the pressure to sell corn at low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Wakili

texts.en:
Wakili is a maize farmer from Sabon Layi village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Wakili would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Wakili can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% more than the market price at harvest. 

Wakili, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, and eliminate pressure to sell corn at low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Christopher Afa

texts.en:
Christopha Afa is a maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Christopha Afa would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Christopha Afa can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% more than the market price at harvest. 

Like other Babban Gona members, Christopha Afa is looking  to earn a better income to provide more food and clothing  for his family, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, and eliminate pressure to sell corn at low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Maftuna

texts.en: Maftuna is a strong woman. She was born in 1994. She lives in a rural area. She is married. She is a business woman and sells woman clothes. Sometimes she works as a night nurse. It is her additional income. Her place of business is in a bad condition. She is planning to recondition her place of her business. Maftuna is asking for a loan to buy building materials for renovating her place of business.

loans.use: to buy building materials for renovating her place of business

loans.name: Dina

texts.en:
Dina is thankful that she was granted a 25,000 PHP loan which she used to purchase various grocery items and products needed for her General Store. She is glad that through her earnings, she is able to send her children to school and meet their daily living expenses. 

She would now like to apply for a 25,000 PHP loan which she will use to buy large quantities of grocery items like rice, coffee, pasta, rice noodles, beverages and other grocery goods which she sells at retail prices. She expects a higher demand for grocery items now that Christmas is just around the corner. She is thanking God and you in advance for a good return on her investment and the financial help that will be given to her. She wishes everyone a Blessed Christmas!

Dina dreams of having a grocery store someday. She aims to send her children to school until college and see them become professionals. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies .

 *All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital  and repay Micro-Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel has been involved in motor cycle transporting and also sells cereals, and he earns a monthly income of KES. 20,000 to support his family.  He is 46 years old and married to Sarah and blessed with four school going children.

He has applied for his first loan from Visionfund Kenya and intends to use the entire amount to buy a spare wheel and also purchase cereals to resell.

Samuel will use the anticipated profit to pay school fees for his children and grow his business to become financially stable.

loans.use: to buy a spare wheel and also purchase cereals to resell.

loans.name: Jhon Herney

texts.es:
Yohn junto con su familia han formado un vínculo muy especial tanto afectivo, como laboral y es que junto han logrado sacar adelante su negocio de confección a terceros, adecuando un espacio en su casa, para montar el negocio, es un negocio que nació gracias a las recomendaciones, apoyo y enseñanzas que recibió por parte del esposo de su hermana y que desde el 2002 ejercen formalmente. 
Su negocio es movido en temporadas, y ahora que tiene una temporada baja, quisieren solicitar un crédito para reformar el muro del taller que por requisito de las normas de sanidad deben realizar.
Gracias al apoyo que Yohn puede recibir de ustedes podrá cumplir a cabalidad la norma y seguir trabajo sin la preocupación de que le cierren el negocio.
texts.en:
Yohn, along with his family, has created a very special bond, affective as well as working, and it is that together they have managed to get their business ahead - sewing for third parties - and fixing up a space in their house, to be able to undertake the business. It is a business that was born thanks to the recommendations, support and instruction that he got from the husband of his sister, and since 2002, they have carried it out formally. 

His business moves in seasons, and now that it is in the low season, they would like to ask for a loan to rebuild the wall of the workshop that due to the requirements of the health standards, they should do. 

Thanks to the support that Yohn can get from you, he will be able to perfectly meet the norms and continue working without worry that they could close the business.

loans.use: to rebuild the wall of his workshop.

loans.name: Jose Edgar

texts.es:
Jose Edgar tiene 30 años de edad, vive junto a sus tres hijos en casa propia de material rústico en el distrito de Santo Tomás, provincia de Cutervo, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. Su población se dedica principalmente a la agricultura de frutales, café, crianza de ganado vacuno y comercio.

El se dedica a la agricultura, especialmente al cultivo de café de la variedad catimore, cuenta con experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en su distrito. El presente crédito será utilizado para la compra de abono y fertilizantes para el mantenimiento de su cultivo de café así como para la contratación de mano de obra para la cosecha, con esto Jose Edgar espera ofrecer un café de mejor calidad a sus clientes lo que tendrá un impacto positivo en su nivel de ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Jose Edgar is 30 years old. He lives with his 3 children in his own house, which is made of rustic materials, in the district of Santo Tomás, in the province of Cutervo, and the region of Cajamarca, in the mountains of the north of Peru. The people there work mainly as farmers growing, fruits and coffee and raising cattle or in business. 
He works in agriculture, especially cultivating the Catimore variety of coffee. He has experience in this business and very good personal and work references in his area. The current loan will be used to buy manure and fertilizer to maintain his coffee crop and also to pay laborers for the harvest. With this input, Jose Edgar hopes to offer his customers higher quality coffee that will have a positive impact on his income level and, therefore, will improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizers for his coffee crop and to hire labor for the harvest.

loans.name: Rafeeya

texts.en:
Rafeeya is a 27 year old married woman and mother of three children. In order to help support her family she began selling milk. 

She is known in her town for providing good quality milk. Rafeeya owns buffaloes for milking.  

Rafeeya has requested a loan of 45000 PKR to purchase a buffalo to increase her sales to cover her daily expenses.

loans.use: to purchase a buffalo.

loans.name: Imtiyaz

texts.en:
Imtiyaz is a 43-year-old married woman. She is a mother of five children. She has been doing a business of cattle sales and purchase for the past 15 years with her husband (also shown in the photo). She earns a good amount of income to cover her everyday expenditures.  

For the improvement of her business, Imtiyaz has availed herself of a Murabaha loan of 30,000 PKR to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market for providing a better standard of living for her family members.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market for providing better a standard of living for her family members.

loans.name: Nusrat

texts.en:
Forty-eight-year old Nusrat is a married woman with four children. One of her sons, also shown in the photo, is a rickshaw driver. He has been providing transportation facilities for about three years to contribute to the family income.  

For the improvement of her son’s business, Nusrat has availed herself of a Murabaha loan of 30,000 PKR for replacing the rickshaw's tires and auto body for providing better services to earn good profits.

loans.use: to replace the rickshaw's tires and auto body for providing better services to earn good profits.

loans.name: Mukhtiar

texts.en:
Mukhtiar, age 40, is a married woman. She is keen to provide her family with the basic necessities of life; that is why she started her business of selling animals. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She also sells milk to generate an extra amount of income. 

She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. In order to expand her business, Mukhtiar has availed herself of a Murabaha loan of PKR 30,000 to purchase more animals. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market.

loans.use: to purchase more animals.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina  is 59 years old; she is a married woman.  She buys animals (baby goats & calves) at low prices, brings them up and then sells them in the market at higher prices. 

She makes enough through her business to contribute in the family income. She also sells milk to generate an extra income. 

Amina needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied a loan of PKR 50000 to purchase more animals to inflate her sales. 

Amina  is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase more animals.

loans.name: Suriya

texts.en:
Suriya is 50 years old married, vigorous lady. She has been manufacturing carpets for many years to contribute in the family income. 

She offers various handmade carpets in different colors and designs to the people of her community and makes enough to lead a decent life. 

To improve her business she contacted Kashf foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 45,000 to buy good quality wool, nylon, polyester, and polypropylene fibers to increase her sales. 

She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and dreams to expand her business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy good quality wool, nylon, polyester, and polypropylene fibers.

loans.name: Blanca Nubia

texts.es:
Blanca es una dulce y carismática abuelita de 66 años de edad, que ama trabajar, ser independiente y producir su propio sustento, nunca le ha gustado que le den nada, es madre de un hija ya mayor de edad, sus buenos deseos como generar empleo, apoyar a personas necesitadas remarcar la personalidad de esta bella persona que buscando una sostenibilidad de negocio y buscar mejores ventas solicita un crédito para la compra de telas, hilos, remaches y demás accesorios complementarios para su línea propia.
Apoya a esta dulce abuelita, que busca seguir generando sus recursos para comer.
texts.en:
Blanca is a sweet and charismatic 66-year-old grandmother who loves to work, be independent, and produce her own sustenance. She has never liked anyone to give her anything. She is the mother of an adult daughter. Her good wishes, such as to generate jobs and support people who need it, highlight this lovely person's personality. She is looking for sustainability for her business and seeks improvements in her sales, and asks for a loan to purchase fabric, thread, rivets, and other complementary accessories for her own line. 

Support this sweet grandmother, who seeks to generate the resources to be able to eat.

loans.use: to purchase fabric, thread, rivets and other accessories.

loans.name: Yimmy

texts.es:
Yimmy es un hombre que de verdad necesita mucha ayuda, pues a sus 26 años cuenta con una enorme responsabilidad mantener a tres hijos, uno de ellos ya con 11 años de edad, el otro con 3 años y el menor tan solo 2 días de nacido, la situación se torna muy difícil porque Yimmy no cuenta con un trabajo y por tal razón acude a solicitar un crédito la razón es que a falta de trabajo y con base en cursos que tuvo de barbería quiere montar su propio negocio.
La idea es iniciar una barbería en una parte de su hogar, con el crédito comprara todo para su negocio, como lo es pintura, una silla para motilar, maquina para motilar, y demás herramientas.
texts.en:
Yimmy is a man who truly needs help. At 26 years old, he has the enormous responsibility of raising 3 children, one of whom is already 11 years old, another is 3, and the youngest who is only 2 days old. The situation is very difficult because Yimmy does not have a job and so he decided to request a loan because he's out of work. Because he has taken courses in barbering, he wants to start his own business.
The idea is to start a barber's shop in part of his house. He will use the loan to buy everything for the business, such as paint, a barber's chair, a tool for cutting hair, and other tools.

loans.use: to buy paint, a barber's chair, a haircutting tool, and other tools.

loans.name: Luz Elena

texts.es:
Luz es una persona muy trabajadora que gracias a su esfuerzo diario ha logrado sacar adelante a sus 7 hijos brindándoles una educación de buena calidad.
Luz es casada y desde hace mucho tiempo comenzó a vender productos de uso personal a través de catalogo, con gran esfuerzo a superado muchos problemas que se le han presentado.
Actualmente Luz tiene unos muy buenos pedidos por parte de sus clientes y debido a que no cuenta con un gran capital busca un préstamo para comprar productos de uso personal y responder a los grandes pedidos que tiene de sus clientes.
Su mayor sueño es salir adelante con su negocio y desde este poder ofrecerles a su hijo una buena calidad de vida y una mejor estabilidad económica, sabe que de la mano de Interactuar podrá lograrlo.

El negocio de Luz Necesita tu ayuda para salir adelante y progresar!
texts.en:
Luz is a very hardworking person who, thanks to her daily efforts, has been able to raise 7 children and offer them a high-quality education. 
Luz is married and, a long time ago, began selling personal hygiene products from a catalog. With much effort, she has overcome many problems that she has been presented.
Currently, Luz has some good orders from her customers and, because she doesn't have a lot of business capital, she is looking for a loan to buy personal hygiene products and meet the big orders from her customers. 
Her greatest dream is to run a successful business and, as a result, to be able to offer her son a good quality of life and better economic stability. She knows that she can achieve this with help from Interactuar. 
Luz's business needs your help to be successful and progress!

loans.use: to buy personal hygiene products.

loans.name: Ganesh Group

texts.en:
Sumita is the leader of a 9-member group that hails from Shastrinagar village of Balangir district of Odisha, India. She is a married woman of 26 years of age, having two daughters and one son.  The member standing fourth from right with raised hand is Sumita. 

Sumita is doing a ready-made clothing business in her locality. Her husband is helping her in this business.  Out of their small income they are maintaining their family in a low profile. To improve her living conditions and to earn some extra income, she formed a group with other like-minded members from her locality. At present her family’s monthly income is about Rs.8,000 which is not sufficient to cater for the needs of her family. She has a dream to have established a ready-made clothing shop in future. 

From this loan Sumita wants to purchase ready-made dresses for resale. Other members of the group also want a loan for vegetable vending, dairy, goatery and furniture businesses.

loans.use: to purchase ready-made dresses for resale

loans.name: Linda

texts.en: Lindah is 31 years old. She is married and together with her spouse, they have been blessed with 3 children whom are 14, 6 and 1 years old respectively. Her spouse is the next of kin and produces additional income for the family. Lindah is a retailer and runs her own shop, a business she has done for the last 5 years. Lindah has requested for her 3rd loan with VisionFund Kenya of Kshs. 100,000 which she will use to re-stock her shop. Lindah will buy goods like bar and bathing soap, washing powder, bread and milk, sugar and other household goods. With the anticipated profits, Lindah will be able to improve her family's livelihood. Her hopes and dreams for the future is to see her business growing so that she may be able to take care of her family.

loans.use: to buy stock for her shop

loans.name: Tereso

texts.es:
Tereso de 68 años de edad, es casado y tiene 4 hijos y están estudiando en la escuela de la comunidad, su esposa es ama de casa muy dedicada, solo ella y sus hijos viven con él. Es agricultor y tiene más de 35 años de experiencia trabajando con granos básicos, además es criador de ganado y estas son sus dos únicas actividades económicas y sus principales fuentes de ingresos.

Solicita el préstamo para pagar el alquiler de máquinas desgranadoras y cortadoras de pasto para su ganado, así como mano de obra para cosechar el maíz que será una parte vendida y la otra almacenada en los graneros.
