Tereso se proyecta trabajar en hortalizas y comprar ganado encastado para mejorar su hato.
texts.en:
Tereso is 68 years old, a husband, and the father of four children who study at the local school. His wife is a devoted homemaker who manages the family's household. Tereso is a farmer with over 35 years of experience growing staple grains and raising cattle. He works exclusively raising his crops and his herd, which are his main source of income.   

Tereso is applying for a loan in order to rent machines for husking corn and cutting hay, and to pay laborers for the corn harvest. He will sell part of the corn crop and store the remainder in granaries. Tereso plans to plans to also grow vegetables and purchase specially bred cattle to improve his herd.

loans.use: to rent a corn husking hay cutting machines and to pay laborers for the harvest.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is 27 years old. She is single and supports her siblings by paying their school fees. Mercy has no children yet.

Mercy is a retailer, a business she has done for the last five years, earning a monthly income of 20,000 KES.

Mercy has requested a loan with VisionFund Kenya of 45,000 KES, which she will use to restock her business. With the anticipated profits, Mercy will be able to purchase a piece of land.

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy supplies in bulk

loans.name: Baloon Bay Group

texts.en:
This borrower group consists of five, hardworking and successful entrepreneurs. They have businesses that provide second-hand clothing, plates, porridge, palm oil, gari (cassava flour), and soft drinks.

The featured borrower is Evelyn, who is 40 years old, has a husband, and is the mother of two children. She prepares palm oil and gari, and sells them to her customers. She is asking for a loan to buy more palm oil and gari (cassava flour). She has been making a good profit in this business. Altogether, the group needs a total of 5,100 GHS to be able to serve their customers better. They have been together for many years, and this is their fourth loan cycle with Kiva's Field Partner, ID Ghana. They will hold one another responsible for the repayment of the loan.

loans.use: to buy more palm oil and gari (cassava flour).

loans.name: Rubina

texts.en:
Rubina is 49 years old and married woman. The man shown in the photo is her husband who is a driver by profession.  He provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. 

He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses, but now it needs proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. 

For this reason, Rubina has applied for a loan of 40000 PKR, for her husband.  He wants to buy new tires and do some auto body work on his vehicle.  This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. 

Rubina is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and that it will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires and do some auto body work on his vehicle.

loans.name: Bhagan

texts.en: Bhagan is a 54-years-old married woman. She has 5 children. Bhagan  is very skilled in the art of hand embroidery and has been using this skill for many years to earn a living. She can make beautiful designs and patterns with her hand. Her skill is known throughout the town. She has requested for a loan of 45000 PKR. This loan will enable her to purchase more beads, threads, frames to meet the orders of her customers on time to earn a good amount of profits. This monetary help can take Bhagan closer to her dream of providing quality education for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more beads, threads, frames to meet the orders of her customers on time so that she can earn a good amount of profits.

loans.name: Naimat

texts.en:
Fifty-nine-year old Naimat has been running a school for 18 years. He started his career in education as a government school teacher, which instilled in him a love for teaching. Naimat says he was born a teacher. 

He soon decided to open a school of his own. This brought its own challenges, and more responsibilities, but Naimat enjoyed the learning that was necessary to continually improve his school. Today, there are over 200 children in his school, and it has the reputation of being the best school in the community and always gets the highest exam scores. 

Naimat spends a lot of time training his teachers, and says getting to where he is today has been the result of a lot of hard work. He is prepared to work hard in the future, too. 

He requires a loan of PKR 80,000 to buy desks and chairs for his students, as well as to repair some classrooms.

loans.use: to buy desks and chairs for his students, as well as to repair some classrooms.

loans.name: Vinodh

texts.en: Vinodh is 50 years old and lives with his wife and mother. He is cultivating rice on a plot of land of 3 hectares and also works as a civil servant. Vinodh's rice plots are far from home, that is why he needs a motorcycle to transport himself from home to the fields. He is also a good borrower from Seva MFI and repays all his loans on time.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel tiene 38 años de edad, es casado, vive con su cónyuge y sus cuatro hijos en el distrito de Querocotillo, provincia de Cutervo, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte del Perú. La población de este distrito se dedica principalmente a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

El se dedica a la crianza de ganado vacuno (vacas) desde hace 10 años, cuenta con experiencia en el negocio y con clientes fijos quienes brindan muy buenas referencias personales y laborales de el. El presente préstamo será para la compra de una mayor cantidad de ganado para su negocio así como para la compra de alimento para el engorde de estos. Con esto Manuel espera mejorar la productividad de su negocio y satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes lo que le generará un aumento en su nivel de ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Manuel is 38 years old. He is married and lives with his wife and their four children in the district of Querocotillo, in the province of Cutervo, in the Cajamarca region in the mountains in the north of Peru. The population of this district works primarily in agriculture, commerce and livestock. 

Manuel has worked raising cattle livestock for 10 years. He relies on his experience with this business and on his loyal clients who provide him with very good personal and work references. The current loan will be used to purchase a large quantity of livestock for his business and to purchase the food to fatten them. With this loan Manuel hopes to improve the productivity of this business and to satisfy the needs of his clients which will generate an increase in the quantity of his earnings and consequently improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase a large quantity of livestock for his business and to purchase the food to fatten them.

loans.name: Abel

texts.es:
Abel tiene 53 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en la provincia de Callacyuc, región de Cajamarca, en la sierra norte del Perú. Sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería como actividades económicas principales.

El se dedica a la destilación de aguardiente hace más de 10 años, cuenta con experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en su distrito. El presente crédito será para la compra de materiales que utiliza para la elaboración de aguardiente así como para la reparación de los equipos que utiliza para la destilación. De esta manera Abel espera generar mayores ingresos en su negocio lo que le permitirá mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Abel is 53 years old, has a common-law wife, and lives with his partner and their two children in the province of Callacyuc, region of Cajamarca, in the mountains in the north of Peru. The people there work in agriculture, business, and livestock.
He works distilling aguardiente (a type of brandy) and has been doing this for more than 10 years. He has experience in the business and very good personal and work references in the area. He will use the current loan to buy materials for making aguardiente and to repair the equipment that he uses for the distillation. In this way, Abel hopes to generate more income from his business which will enable him to improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy materials for making the drink "aguardiente" and also for repairs to the equipment used to distill it.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Christine Mary is 20 years old and is fourth of four children in the family. Her mother Marilyn, a member of NWTF, supports the family through her general store business in the Philippines.

Christine Mary is studying for her Bachelor of Science in Elementary Education and is currently in the first year of this 4-year course.

Marilyn is borrowing PHP 10,450 to pay the tuition fees of her daughter Christine Mary for the second semester of the school year 2014-2015.

Christine Mary plans to graduate and be gainfully employed.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is 49 years old and married; she works very hard to provide for her family.

Lilian runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, coffee, soft drinks, soap, etc.

Lilian has been in this business for seven years.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, coffee, soft drinks, soap, etc

loans.name: Jiji

texts.en:
Jiji is 31 years old and married with two children. With one child currently in school, Jiji works very hard to provide for them.

Jiji runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like candies, coffee, sugar, soft drinks, beers, canned goods, etc. to sell.

Jiji has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items. 

Jiji would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like candies, coffee, sugar, soft drinks, beers, canned goods, etc. to sell

loans.name: Florencia

texts.en:
Florencia is a married woman with one child. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Florencia is 37 years old and her child is currently in school.

Florencia has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

Florencia has been in this business for five years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Evzel

texts.en:
Evzel is 38 years old and married with three children. She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. 

Evzel is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Evzel has been in pig fattening for four years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Rosalba De Jesus

texts.es:
Rosalba es una mujer responsable y trabajadora de 64 años de edad que desea reiniciar su negocio de agricultura y cría de animales años atrás por errores de juventud, de presupuesto, no fue viable su negocio, pero ahora que tiene más bagaje y experiencia suficiente para saber en que invertir y no cometer los errores infantiles.
Rosalba solicita un crédito para la compra de un cerdo para criar.

Con la ayuda de este crédito podrá reestableces la actividad económica con la que busca mantener a sus 11 hijos y darles educación, ya que los jóvenes del campo deben estudiar para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Rosabla is a responsible and hardworking woman of 64 years of age who wants to restart her agriculture business raising animals. Years ago, due to the errors of youth and budget, her business wasn't viable. But, now she has the experience necessary to know what to invest in and not to commit childish errors. 
Rosabla is requesting a loan to buy a pig to raise. 
With the help of this loan she will be able to reestablish her economic activity and raise her 11 children and give them an education as rural children need to study to be successful.

loans.use: to buy a pig.

loans.name: Mangala Group

texts.en:
Sanju, aged about 27 years, is the group leader of a 10-member group from Kadampara village of Balangir district, Odisha, India. She is running a tailoring unit. Her family comprises five members: her husband, three daughters and Sanju. The member standing fifth from right is Sanju. She is a very active lady who wants   some extra income out of her own efforts.

Sanju along with another nine members of her village formed a group and applied for a loan from Mahashakti Foundation for development of their existing business.  At present the monthly family income of Sanju is Rs.6,000 which is not sufficient to manage her family and to keep pace with present society. 

To improve her living conditions and to earn some extra income, she wants to access a loan.  From the loan she will add a Pico sewing machine to her unit and so bring efficiency to her stitching. She has a dream to expand her business and wants to have a shop of her own in the town.

The other nine members also want a loan for doing tailoring, to purchase a rickshaw, vegetable vending, fast food stall and a Fancy shop.

loans.use: to purchase a Pico sewing machine

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Charity is a married woman. She has one child. She describes herself to be innovative. She operates a farm where she grows potatoes, carrots and onions. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in an area favorable for farming, and her primary customers are locals. 

She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy farm inputs to enable her to increase farm production. She hopes that in the future, she will have improved living standards. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs to enable her to increase farm production

loans.name: Venera

texts.en:
Venera, who is 67 years old and a married woman, lives in the village of Ateni. She has eight family members and the only source of income for them is a small agricultural activity. In particular, Venera works on family-owned agricultural land, cultivates it and harvests fruits and vegetables for local trading. The family belongs to the subsistence poor category, as they have no source of significant income and live in poverty. 

 According to the above mentioned situation, Venera lacks the access to capital markets and financial institutions to obtain credit for expanding her trading business, as that requires a stable income. The Start Up program created by Kiva and Credo enabled Venera to get a loan of 3800 GEL for repairing the family-owned car and starting trading throughout the region. She will get a chance to generate more income and make her activity more productive. 

Venera and her large family rely on the goodwill of Kiva lenders and will highly appreciate your help.

loans.use: To expand her trading business and generate more income

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, cooking oil, flour and other items

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en: Bushra is a 34-years-old working woman. After her marriage, she felt that she should support her husband to improve their financial condition. So she started a business of selling cloth. She believes she can earn some respect and make a better world for her children and their education. Bushra is famous among her neighbors for her collections and has a good client list. Currently she needs a loan of 35000 PKR to purchase good-quality cloths of different colors to earn substantial profits through this investment. This would lead her to live a decent life and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase good-quality cloth of different colors and to earn substantial profits through this investment.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en: Amina is 38 years old; she is a married woman.  She deals in a business of selling animals. She buys animals (baby goats & calves) at low prices, brings them up and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She also sells milk to generate an extra amount of income. She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 30000 to purchase more animals to improve her sales and profits which will help in bearing her household expenses efficiently.

loans.use: to purchase more animals to improve her sales and profits which will help in bearing her household expenses efficiently.

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en: Shazia  is a 27-year-old married woman. She is the mother of 3 children. She is running a weaving business. She weaves caps, sweaters and bed sheets at home, to sell in the market. Currently, she has requested for a loan amount of 50000 PKR. She wants to use this loan to purchase spools of wool and yarns in different colors in order to earn more income in the future for covering her household expenses efficiently.

loans.use: to purchase spools of wool and yarns in different colors to earn more income in the future for covering her household expenses efficiently.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy chicks.

loans.name: Serendaz

texts.en: Serendaz is 40 years old, a widow and mother of a child. Her son is 19 years old and goes to university, Serendaz’s husband died in the war. Her family is an IDP (İnternally Displaced Persons) from the Fuzuli city, currently living in the Fuzuli region. Serendaz has been in animal breeding business for 7 years now. She sells some cattle, raising them and selling them in a local bazaar to earn money. She loves her job and wants to go forward in this job. Therefore she needs a loan amount of 2300 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat). With this loan she wants to buy more cattle. Serendaz is greatly thankful to Komak company and Kiva organization for their help. In the future she wants to build a new and bigger stall, and then she wants to help her son in his university studies.

loans.use: to buy cattle for increasing her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more olive seedlings for his agricultural land.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a 27-year-old man married to Eunice, who adds additional income to support their family.  They are blessed with one child.  Charles has been operating a motorcycle business for 4 years, earning himself an income of 10,000 KES at the end of every month.

Charles was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a Credit Officer and is now servicing his first loan of 94,160 KES and intends to buy an additional motorcycle to provide transport to his customers efficiently. 

Charles plans to use the anticipated income to pay school fees for his child and hopes to become a successful business man with a bright future.

loans.use: to buy an additional motorcycle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy additional stock of vegetables.

loans.name: Medeia

texts.en:
Medeia is 59 years old and a married woman, from Chiatura district. She lives with her husband, who is temporarily unemployed, and the family earns a living with the help of Medeia's activity. She works at a private organization and generates 400 GEL in fixed salary.

As the existing income is not enough for the family, and her husband can't help her maintain the family's well-being, Medeia decided to start a new activity. It will be a stable and significant source of income for them. All the financial institutions rejected her loan requests, because of her unstable financial condition and lack of experience. After several unsuccessful attempts, Medeia applied for credit to MFO Credo. Her request was approved in the framework of the Start-Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva, permitting poor people to start or re-start businesses.

Medeia plans to purchase all needed merchandise and tools for opening a traditional Georgian bakery. She has already found an appropriate place for her new business. She will get many customers among local people, and passers-by, as well. The family will have a stable income that will enable them to cover everyday costs, as well as expand the business in future. With the support of the Start-Up program, Medeia will get an opportunity to be involved in her own business and tackle the family's financial difficulties.

loans.use: to open a traditional Georgian bakery and generate additional income.

loans.name: Soedesh

texts.en: Soedesh thanks all kiva lenders once again for supporting him with his rice cultivation. He wants to continue rice production and wants again a loan of 7,000 SRD to purchase diesel and fertilizers for his rice production.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pesticides for his rice cultivation

loans.name: Fozia

texts.en: Fozia is a 32-years-old married woman. She is a mother of 6 children.She has been doing a business of animal sales and purchase for many years now. She is working hard to provide her family with the basic necessities of life. Now, she has requested for a loan of 50000 PKR. She wants to use this loan amount to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market to increase her sales and profits alongside. She desires to improve her standard of living through all her efforts.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market to increase her sales and profits alongside.

loans.name: Leoncio Amado

texts.es:
Leoncio Amado tiene 68 años de edad, es casado, vive en casa propia de material rústico con su cónyuge y sus 2 menores hijos en el distrito de Pucará, ubicado en la provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, de la sierra norte del Perú. Las actividades principales que se desarrollan en el distrito son la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

La actividad a la que se dedica es a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de café, con una experiencia en el rubro de 18 años, tiene clientes fijos quienes brindan muy buenas referencias personales y laborales de el. El presente crédito será para la contratación de mano de obra para la época de cosecha así como para la compra de abono y fertilizantes para el mantenimiento de su cultivo de café. Con esto Leoncio Amado espera ofrecer un café de mejor calidad a sus clientes lo que se verá reflejado en su nivel de ventas y le generará mayores ingresos, aumentando por ende su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Leoncio Amado is 68 years old. He is married and lives in his own home of rustic materials with his wife and his two young children in the district of Pucará, located in the Jaén province in the Catamarca region in the northern mountains of Peru. The primary activities that they perform in the district are agriculture, commerce and raising livestock. 

Leoncio Amado dedicates himself to the activity of agriculture, specifically the cultivation of coffee. He has 18 years of experience with this trade and he has loyal clients who provide very good personal and work references for him. The current loan will be used to hire manual labor for the harvest season and for the purchase of compost and fertilizers for the maintenance of his coffee crop. With these items Leoncio Amado hopes to offer a better quality of coffee to his clients which will be reflected in his level of sales and will generate more earnings for him, thereby improving he and his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to hire manual labor for the harvest season and to purchase compost and fertilizers for the maintenance of his coffee crop.

loans.name: Tabitha

texts.en:
Tabitha is 25 years old. She is married to Samuel, and together they have been blessed with four children, aged 11, 9, 7, and 5 years. Tabitha sells second-hand clothes, a business she has done for the past five years. She earns a monthly income of KES 22,500. Samuel provides additional income for his family.

Tabitha has requested her second loan with VisionFund Kenya, in the amount of KES 22,000. She will use the loan to re-stock her business, by buying fresh bales of second-hand clothes. With the anticipated profits, Tabitha will be able to pay school fees for her children.

Tabitha's hopes and dreams for the future are to secure her children's future by ensuring they have school fees available, and to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy bales of second-hand clothes.

loans.name: Kelvin

texts.en:
Kelvin is 25 years old, married to Felistus, and they do not have children yet. He has been running an MPESA shop which is known for its local money transfers for the past two years and earns a monthly income of KES 37,000.
	 		
He has applied for his first loan of 30,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya and intends to use the loan amount to add more float for the money transfers.                                                                                          

Kelvin will use the anticipated profits to provide for the family's basic needs. He hopes to grow his business and open another office.

loans.use: to add more business float

loans.name: Maria Aurora

texts.es:
María de 59 años de edad, es soltera y tiene 2 hijos, creció con su abuela y esta fue la encargada de enseñarle a trabajar y a ganarse la vida. María es una persona muy conocida en su comunidad por la actividad que realiza, además pertenece a la directiva encargada de la organización comunal, es una persona líder. 

María se dedíca a la agricultura y la ganadería también son oficios que aprendió de su abuela que también se dedicaba a esta actividad, también tiene una granja de gallinas ponedoras y solicita el préstamo para comprar concentrado para sus gallinas y sus vacas, también para preparar los pastizales para el ganado.

María espera salir a delante con la inversión y realizar mejoras a las instalaciones donde tiene el ganado, comprar una picadora de pasto y construir instalaciones para criar cerdos.
texts.en:
María is 59 years old, single, and the mother of two children. María is well-known in her community as a hard-working woman, and also as a  leader and member of the community's governing council. María's grandmother raised her. A farmer and rancher, her grandmother was the one who taught María to work and earn a living. 

María makes a living farming and ranching, and also has a herd of hens that lay eggs. She is applying for a loan in order to purchase concentrated feed for her hens and cows. She will also use part of the loan funds to prepare her pasture for the herd. 

María is hopeful that these investments will improve her situation. She also wants to make improvements to her cattle pen, purchase a hay cutter, and build a pen for raising pigs.

loans.use: to purchase concentrated feed for her hens and cows and also to prepare her pasture for the herd.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a married woman with 3 children, and describes herself as honest.  For 6 years she has operated a farm growing coffee and raising cows and poultry.  Her business is located in a fertile area and her primary customers are large scale buyers.  She describes her greatest business challenge to be a lack of finances. 

Grace will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy farm inputs.  She will use the anticipated profits to buy additional farm inputs.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is a married woman. She has 4 children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a farm where she grows tea. She has been involved in this business for 6 years now. Her business is located in a fertile area and her primary customers are large scale buyers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be a lack of finances. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy farm inputs. This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Dora Alicia

texts.es:
Dora, de 47 años de edad, estudió hasta 2° grado, está acompañada y su compañero de vida trabaja como albañil, tiene dos hijos, de los cuales uno trabaja y el otro estudia. 

Dora, trabaja con ganado bovino, ésta labor la ha realizado por más de tres años y lo aprendió de su padre; Decidió hacerlo para obtener un ingreso económico para su familia, pero además, una de sus hermanas que reside en Estados Unidos le ayuda economicamente.

La distancia que Dora, recorre para ir a su lugar de trabajo es de 1 km y viaja a pie, le apoya su compañero de vida y un hijo; El horario no se puede medir. 

Dora, necesita el crédito para comprar ganado bovino, con esto ella mejorará calidad de vida porque podrá tener más ganado y le generará mayores ganancias.

Sus sueños son, seguir trabajando a fin de adquirir más ganado y poder darles un mejor futuro a su familia.
texts.en:
Dora, 47, went to school through second grade. She is married and her life partner works as a construction worker. She has two children, one works and the other is in school.

Dora works with bovine cattle, which is a job she’s done for over three years after learning from her father. She decided to do it to earn income for her family. One of her sisters in the United States also helps her financially.

Dora travels around 1 km on foot to get to her workplace. Her life partner and one son help her. She doesn’t work any set schedule.

Dora needs a loan to buy bovine cattle so she can improve her quality from having more cattle, which will generate better profits.

Her dreams are to keep working so she can get more cattle and for her family to have a better future.

loans.use: to buy bovine cattle.

loans.name: Samina

texts.en: Samina is a 32-years-old married woman doing a business of animals’ purchase-and-sale with the help of her husband for many years now. Her business has provided her family with a decent life. She is a mother of 2 children. She is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with good education, food and clothing. She has requested a loan of 50000 PKR. She intends to utilize this loan amount  to purchase more baby goats and calves for catering to more customers. She is hopeful that her business will generate greater revenue in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats and calves for catering to more customers.

loans.name: Raj

texts.en: Raj wants to thank all the Kiva lenders for doing such great work together. He repaid his previous loan fully and on time, and is requesting for an additional loan so he can continue his rice production.

loans.use: to purchase diesel, fertilizers and pesticides for his rice cultivation.

loans.name: Santos Feliciano

texts.es:
Santos Feliciano tiene 67 años de edad, vive con su cónyuge en el distrito de Querocotillo, ubicado en la provincia de Cutervo, de la región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte del Perú. Su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería como actividades económicas principales.

El se dedica al cultivo de arroz desde hace 15 años, cuenta con experiencia en el negocio y con clientes fijos quienes brindan muy buenas referencias personales y laborales de el. El préstamo solicitado será para la compra de fertilizantes así como productos para prevenir males fitosanitarios en su cultivo, con esto Santos Feliciano espera obtener mayores rendimientos de su cultivo de arroz y ofrecer un producto de mejor calidad a sus clientes, lo que le generará mayores ingresos y mejorará su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Santos Feliciano  is 67 years old. He lives with his wife in the district of Querocotillo located in the Cutervo province in the Cajamarca region in the northern mountains of Peru. The local populace works in agriculture, commerce and livestock as their primary economic activities. 

Santos Feliciano has worked growing rice for 15 years. He counts on his experience with the business and on his loyal clients who provide very good personal and work references for him. He is seeking this loan to purchase fertilizers and products to prevent bad phytosanitary conditions for his crops. With these items Stantos Feliciano hopes to obtain better yields from his rice crop and to offer a higher quality product to his clients which will generate better earnings and improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and products to prevent bad phytosanitary conditions for his crops.

loans.name: Blanca Victoria

texts.es: La señora blanca es una mujer dedicada a protección de su familia, de profesión maestra de educación primaria con 31 año de impartir clases, actualmente se desempeña como subdirectora de un colegio de la localidad donde vive, es casada con un hijo a su cargo al que  apoya como toda madre responsable, esta señora se presento a Ceprodel para solicitar financiamiento el que utilizaría en la Compra de zinc, perlin y mano de obra, para mejorar el techo de su casa el que se encuentra en mal estado, ya que atravez de esta obra de construcción mejoraría las condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Blanca is a woman who is dedicated to the protection of her family. She is an elementary school teacher with 31 years' experience. She is currently working as deputy director of a school in the area where she lives. She is married with one child under her care. She supports her child like all responsible mothers. 
Blanca came to Ceprodel to request a loan which she will use to purchase zinc and perlines, and to pay the labourers to improve her home's roof; it is in bad shape. Through this construction, she will improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy zinc and perlines, and to pay the labourers.

loans.name: Youssef

texts.en:
Youssef is a 40-year-old, married, Syrian father of four children. He has been working in a restaurant since seven years ago, to cover the needs and expenses of his family.

Youssef's salary is not enough at all to satisfy his family's needs. Therefore, he is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua. He will use the loan to pay his children's school tuition, and he wants to buy necessary fuel for the heater, to protect his family from the cold winter season.

Youssef hopes to open his own grocery shop in the future, to stay capable of improving his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to pay his children's school tuition and buy necessary fuel for the heater, to protect his family from the cold winter season.

loans.name: Nyamoki

texts.en: Nyamoki is a married woman. She has 6 children. She describes herself to be humble. She operates a retail shop where she sells sugar, bread, flour, washing soap and other items. She has been involved in this business for 5 years now. Her primary customers are locals. She will use the Kes 80,000 loan to buy more stocks of sugar, rice, flour washing soap and other items. Her business goal is to have a supermarket within 5 years. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of sugar, rice, flour washing soap and other items

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a married woman with 2 children, and describes herself as honest.  For the past 10 years she has operated a farm where she grows maize and other crops.  Her business is located in a strategic location and her primary customers are large scale buyers.  She describes her greatest business challenge to be a lack of finances. 

Beatrice will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy farm inputs to enable her to increase production.  She will use the anticipated profits to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Janey

texts.en:
Janey is a married woman. She has eight children. She describes herself to be faithful. She operates a retail business where she sells fish and vegetables. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her primary customers are locals. 

Janey describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of finances. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of fish and vegetables. She hopes that in the future, she will have a better lifestyle. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fish and vegetables

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a single woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be capable. She operates a retail business where she sells fruits and vegetables. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are of all types. 

Ruth describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables. Her business goal is to expand within five years. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Dorcas is a single woman. She has one child. She describes herself to be humble and hardworking. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a competitive place, and her primary customers are regular ones. 

She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more stock of clothes. She hopes that in the future, she will employ people. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Luís Alonso

texts.es:
Luis de 35 años de edad, estudió hasta 7° grado de educación básica, está acompañado y tiene 4 hijos de 13, 12 y gemelos de 5 años de edad. Su esposa es ama de casa y solo ella y sus hijos viven con él.

Luis es albañil, tiene 8 años de experiencia en este oficio aprendió gracias a un amigo con el que se iba a trabajar, al ver que le daba muy buenos resultado decidió dedicarse a esto. Además desde hace 3 años trabaja comerciando ganado. Trabaja de lunes a sábado como albañil de 7:00 ama 4:00 pm, solo los miércoles se dedica al comercio de ganado.

Solicita el préstamo para comprar una vaca lechera, con la que espera venda la producción de leche y posiblemente el queso que produzca para que su pareja se involucre en actividades económicas. Luis espera comprar un camión para transportar sus animales desde los lugares donde los compra y dar el estudio a sus hijos con los frutos de su trabajo.
texts.en:
Luis, 35, went to school through seventh grade in primary school. He is married and has 4 children ages 13, 12, and 5-year-old twins. His wife works from home and their children live with them.

Luis is a construction worker with 8 years of experience in this work that he learned from a friend who he used to work with. After seeing the good results, he decided to make a living doing this work. In addition, he has been selling cattle for three years. He works Monday through Saturday as a construction worker from 7:00 a.m. to 4:00 p.m. Just on Wednesdays he sells cattle.

He’s requesting a loan to buy a milking cow, and he hopes to sell the milk it produces, possibly cheese as well so his partner also becomes involved in economic activities. Luis hopes to buy a truck to transport his animals from the places where he buys. He also hopes to send his children to school with the fruits of his labor.

loans.use: to buy a milking cow.

loans.name: Rabih

texts.en:
Rabih is a 38-year-old married father of four children and a Palestinian refugee, who has worked as a fisherman since 1996 to cover the needs and expenses of his family.

Due to the low social and financial situations of Palestinians in Lebanon, Rabih is trying hard to develop his business and improve his family's living conditions, which is why today he is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, to buy new fishing nets for his business that will increase his available business merchandise with different kinds of fish.

Rabih hopes to expand his business more in the future by buying a new fishing boat to increase his income and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets for his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a married woman. She has two children, ages 4 years and 12 years. She describes herself to be ambitious. She operates a retail business where she sells handbags and shoes. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in an area with potential and her primary customers are of all types. 

Margaret describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate finances. She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more stock of shoes. Her business goal is to be financially stable within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will excel in business. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of shoes

loans.name: Lindah

texts.en:
Lindah is 22 years old. She is single, but she supports one of her sisters. She has no children yet.

Lindah is a retailer who sells clothes, shoes, and cosmetics. She has conducted this business for the past two years, earning a monthly income of KES 12,000.

She has requested her first loan with VisionFund Kenya, in the amount of KES 20,000. She will use it to re-stock her business with more cosmetics, clothes, and shoes. With the anticipated profits, Lindah will be able to expand her business. Her hope and dream for the future is to be able to do farming, and stabilize as well as cater for her needs.

loans.use: to buy more clothes, shoes, and cosmetics.

loans.name: Victor Antonio

texts.es: víctor de 44 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, el se dedica desde hace varios años a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y frijol, cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la almacena en sacos así como lo muestra la fotografía, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes. abonos, controles de plagas, etc.para poder continuar con su trabajo.
texts.en: Victor is 44 years old and lives in his own home with his wife. He has been farming corn and beans for several years. When his harvest is ready he stores the grains in sacks as demonstrated in the photograph. He is seeking a loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, manure, pesticides, etc. in order to be able to continue with his work.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, manure, pesticides, etc.

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en:
Fredrick is a married man. He has two children, ages 2 years and 10 years. He describes himself to be persistent. He operates a retail business where he sells juices and water. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a busy place and his primary customers are regular ones. 

Fredrick describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate finances. He will use the Kes 35,000 loan to buy more stock of juices and drinking water. His business goal is to be a supplier within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will have better a living standard. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of juices and drinking water

loans.name: Paquita

texts.en:
Paquita is 52 years old and married with four children.  

Paquita is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Paquita requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Paquita has been in pig fattening for seven years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Paquita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Daniel Antonio

texts.es:
Daniel de 26 años de edad, estudió hasta 6° grado de educación básica se retiró de la escuela porque prefirió trabajar, estuvo casado y al no funcionar la relación decidió separase, fruto de esa relación tuvo a su hija de 4 años de edad a la que apoya incondicionalmente, solo ella depende de él.

Daniel trabaja para una panadería, es encargado de vender pan dulce y francés por lo que obtiene el 30% del total de lo que vende, tiene 5 años de experiencia trabajando de esta manera, tomo la decisión de trabajar en esto al ver que era muy importante apoyar su hija. Todos los días recorre cerca de 5 kilómetros en su ruta de venta, lo hace en su bicicleta y cuando va zonas lejanas lo hace en motocicleta; trabaja de 5:00 am 8:00 am por la mañana y en las tardes de 2:00 pm a 6:00 pm.

Solicita el préstamo para comprar una motocicleta, la que tiene en estos momentos le da muchos problemas mecánicos y lejos de ayudar le complica su trabajo. Espera crecer en su trabajo y poder asistir a su hija en lo que necesite.
texts.en:
Daniel, age 26, was in school until grade six. He left school because he preferred to work. He was married, but since the relationship did not function, he decided to get a divorce. From this relationship, he has a four-year-old daughter. He supports her unconditionally. She is the only person who depends on him.
Daniel works for a bakery. He sells French bread and sweetbread and keeps 30% of his total sales. He has had this job for 5 years. He decided to do this work because he saw that it was very important to support his daughter. Every day he travels around 5 kilometres on his sales route. He does this on his bike. When he goes to distant zones, he goes by motorcycle. He works from 5 am to 8 am in the mornings and in the afternoons from 2 to 6 pm.
He is requesting this loan for the purchase of a motorcycle. His current motorcycle has many mechanical problems. Far from helping, it complicates his work. He hopes to grow in his work and to be able to assist his daughter with what she needs.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Rwabigangura Abamwe Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Edith, born in 1974, is a married woman. She joined the Rwabigangura group in January 2011. She currently lives with her husband and her five children in the rural area of Rukungiri.

Her family lives mainly based on cultivation and breeding, and the income is just enough for food and to save a little amount left. But that amount left is not enough to buy fertilizer for the next crop. So, she wants to borrow money through the group to buy fertilizer for her coffee garden and banana plantation.

Edith will work hard to get money to repay the loan on time. She hopes that the loan can help her family invest effectively in her coffee garden, and due to her working hard and with much care for the coffee and banana garden, it will bring her family a successful crop yield in the next season. She is hard-working and resilient.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Ana Isabel

texts.es: Ana de 45 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, es viuda desde hace 12 años, tiene 4 hijos mayores y con hogar aparte, con ella solo vive un nieto y solo él depende de ella. Ana es comerciante de frutas y verduras, pero por el momento no trabaja porque paso la época, por lo que solicita el préstamo para iniciar una granja de pollos de engorde, va a comprar 5 pliegos de láminas, 25 bloques para construir una instalación donde quepan 75 pollos y 2 quintales de concentrado. Espera resulte su inversión y para der el estudio a su nieto, oportunidad que ella no tuvo.
texts.en:
Ana, age 45, did not have the opportunity to study. She has been a widow for 12 years and has four grown children who live independently. Only one grandchild lives with her, and he is the only person who depends on her. Ana sells fruits and vegetables, but at the moment she is not working because the season for it has passed. Because of this, she is requesting a loan to start a chicken farm. She will buy 5 sheets of laminate and 25 blocks to build a space to raise 75 chickens and keep 2 quintals of chicken feed.
She hopes that this investment will happen so that she can give her grandchild an education--an opportunity that she did not have.

loans.use: to buy 5 sheets of laminate and 25 blocks to build space for 75 chickens and chicken feed.

loans.name: Wikaash

texts.en:
Wikaash is feeling so blessed by the help of Kiva lenders, and he wants to thank them. He repaid his loan on time. With the profits of last season, he was able to save some money for his own plot.

But that is not enough. so he will continue rice production. He wants, again, a loan of SRD 10,000. He will use the loan to continue rice production.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pesticide.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, sand, cement blocks, ceramic tiles, paint and labor.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy books for her eldest daughter.

loans.name: In-God Group

texts.en:
These people are part of the group called In-God, and they are three in number. On average, they are 45 years old, and have three children. They all live in the Teshie neighborhood, in Accra, Ghana. They are friends and neighbors, and also know one another through their income-generating activities at Teshie. They are involved in small retail, selling African wax-prints, charcoal, underwear, wine, and pepper.

In order to have enough cash to buy fresh supplies of goods, the members of the group decided to join ID-Ghana. This is their seventh loan cycle with ID-Ghana. Joy, the featured borrower, is a well-known charcoal seller. In the photo, she is standing at far right. She is planning to use her loan to buy charcoal, in bulk, from the market. She will also buy three bags of charcoal to sell to customers. Most of her customers are in Teshie. She is expecting to make a good monthly profit, which will be reinvested in her business and used to take care of her family. She is 54, and her children are all grown up and living on their own.

The group members have good repayment records. They will hold each other responsible for the repayment of this loan.

loans.use: to buy three bags of charcoal to sell to customers, most of them in Teshie.

loans.name: Lela

texts.en:
Lela is a 27-year-old young woman from a small village called Sajijao. She lives with her husband, school-aged son and daughter, and pensioner mother-in-law. Lela is a hard worker who supports her beloved husband in making their precious family's living and covering their increasing needs, especially their children's education. 

They engage in cattle breeding and in cultivating family-owned agricultural land, where they harvest maize for local selling. In the region there is a high unemployment rate, but self-employment helps inhabitants to make a living. So she decided to start a vegetable trading business in order to improve her family's living condition. 

Lela’s credit requests were rejected several times, as the creditors didn't find enough income to be sufficient to approve it. Finally, she received the credit in the framework of the joint initiative of Kiva and Credo - a startup program that gives rural poor people the chance to start or re-start businesses. Lela plans to purchase vegetables at wholesale prices and, with her husband, sell the products in nearby villages door-to-door. 

The job will be hard for them, but this motivated couple will do their best to create financial stability for her children. They await your support and kindness.

loans.use: To start a vegetable trading business

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia thanks all the Kiva lenders for helping her in realizing her dreams.

She repaid the entire loan on time and could save some money for purchasing a piece of land. Further, she could pay for the tuition of her children. 

She wants to continue rice cultivation so she can save more for her future and for a piece of land where she can plant more rice.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Ana Patricia

texts.es:
Ana de 25 años de edad estudió hasta 9° grado de educación básica, es soltera y no tiene hijos, vive con sus padres y les apoya económicamente. Tiene una granja de pollos de engorde y cuenta con 3 años de experiencia en este oficio, aprendió de su madre, es su única fuente de ingresos y la granja la tiene en su casa.

Solicita el préstamo para comprar 50 pollos de engorde y comprar un quintal de concentrado para alimentarlos. Quiere ganar más experiencia y reconocimiento en la comunidad para convertirse en la principal productora de carne de pollo en la zona.
texts.en:
Ana, age 25, was in school until grade 9. She is single and does not have children. She lives with her parents and supports them economically. She has a farm where she raises chickens and has 3 years' experience. She learned this work from her mother. It is her only source of income. The farm is in her home.
She is requesting a loan for the purchase of 50 chickens and a quintal of chicken feed. She wants to gain more experience and recognition in the community in order to become the main producer of chicken meat in the area.

loans.use: to buy 50 chickens and a quintal of chicken feed.

loans.name: Jose Adan

texts.es:
José, de 61 años de edad, estudió hasta 3° grado, está casado, su esposa trabaja en los oficios domésticos, tiene dos hijos, de los cuales uno estudia.

José, tiene un negocio de venta de frutas y verduras, lo ha hecho por más de 3 años y las circunstancias de la vida lo hicieron dedicarse a este negocio.- También, trabaja de mecánico en sus ratos libres, además recibe remesas de EEUU de una hija. 

La distancia que recorre, no se puede medir y viaja en un pick up, que es con el que trabaja, en este negocio le apoya su esposa y su horario es de 4:00 a.m. a 2:00 p.m. 

José, utilizará el préstamo para invertirlo en su negocio, el préstamo le ayudará a ofrecer variedad de productos a sus clientes y por lo tanto le mejorará también su calidad de vida. 

Sus sueños son, seguir trabajando lo mejor que se pueda para poder ofrecer a su familia un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
José, age 61, was in school until grade 3. He is married and his wife does the housework. He has two children, of whom one is in school.
Jose sells fruits and vegetables. He has done this for over three years; his life circumstances caused him to start this business. He also works as a mechanic in his free time, and receives remittances from a daughter in the US.
The distance he travels can't be measured. He travels in a pickup truck. His wife supports him in this business. He works from 4 am to 2 pm.
Jose will use this loan to invest in his business. This loan will help him to offer a variety of products to his clients. This will also improve his quality of life.
His dreams are to keep working as best he can in order to be able to offer his family a better future.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Alaa

texts.en:
Alaa is a 27-year-old single man who works as a security guard and taxi driver to help in covering the needs and expenses of his family that consists of five persons.

Alaa is a hard worker and an ambitious man who is trying his best to develop his business and improve his family's living conditions, thus today he is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy a new taxi car instead of his old unusable one to facilitate his work.

Alaa hopes to expand his business more in the future to increase his income and stay capable of providing his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a new taxi car to replace his old unusable one and facilitate his work

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda has started her small business and became successful in managing her sari-sari store. She has to ensure she has enough inventory to serve her customers well. She rolls up her capital and additional revenue to gain more profit. Everyday she makes good sales even though there are many stores in their barangay [village]. 

Recently she approached Paglaum for much-needed capital to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items. In the future, she hopes to create a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items

loans.name: Menoodj

texts.en: Menoodj thanks all Kiva lenders for the good job they are doing. He has done his rice cultivation very successfully and repaid his loan on time. With the profits he was able to finish building his house and now wants to save for the future and for the tuition of his children.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Jean De Dieu

texts.en:
Jean de Dieu is 30 years old. He is married. He is a farmer and has been farming for 5 years. 

With the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy fertilizers for beans and maize for resale. The profits from the business will be used to buy food for home consumption. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy bean fertilizers and maize for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy airtime cards to sell to his customers, on a daily basis.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 47 years old. She is married with 5 children aged between 9 and 21 years old. She is a farmer and has been farming for 12 years. 

With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy more fertilizers for flowers and maize for resale. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more flower fertilizers and maize for resale.

loans.name: Sherlita

texts.en:
Sherlita is single and has a buy-and-sell mangoes business in the Philippines.

Sherlita requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more mangoes to sell to her customers.

Sherlita has been in this business for four years now.

In the future, Sherlita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more mangoes to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Analee

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Analee works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell mangoes business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Analee is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more stock of mangoes to sell for her business.

Analee has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock of mangoes to sell.

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en:
Esterlita works hard to support her family. Esterlita is married and has a fish-vending business in the Philippines.

Esterlita requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell to her customers.

Esterlita has been in this business for years now.

In the future, Esterlita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Lowella

texts.en:
Lowella is a married woman with nine children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 52 years old, and two of her children are still in school.

Lowella has a business selling mangoes in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 27,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more mangoes to sell in her fruit stand.

Lowella has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more mangoes to sell in her fruit stand

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 53 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living in the Philippines. Lorna is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional feeds and vitamins for her goat.

Lorna has been doing this for 10 years and also earns additional income from farming rice.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional feeds and vitamins for her goat

loans.name: Elne

texts.en:
Elne is 42 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Elne is borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Elne has been farming rice for 13 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Lani

texts.en:
Lani is 47 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Lani is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase feeds, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs.

Lani has been raising pigs for four years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feeds, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs

loans.name: Werlin

texts.en:
Werlin is 43 years old and married with one child.

Werlin works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 40,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her general store.

Werlin has borrowed and paid 21 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from raising livestock.

Werlin aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Sally

texts.en:
Sally works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Sally requested a 14,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for food production, such as meat, flour, sugar, spices, etc.

Sally has been in this business for 12 years now. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for food production like meat, flour, sugar, spices, etc.

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es:
Rosa María tiene su puesto en el mercado de atuntaqui donde ella realiza venta de pollo pelado esto ya viene realizando 12 años en la cual ha demostrado ser una persona honrada y luchadora la actividad aprendió por iniciativa propia porque la necesidad que tenis cuando recién estaba empezando a ejercer esta actividad la llevo a tomar decisiones que para hoy en día han sido las mejores  con el negocio que mantiene hoy día puede tranquilamente solventar todas las necesidad de que vienen al mes y también para dar todo lo mejor a su hija que está estudiando quiere que pueda seguir en los estudios que crezca en la misma situación que ella y por eso ella hace todo lo posible por brindarle un mejor porvenir a su hija,

La inversión del crédito lo va realizaren la compra de más pollos pelados para ofrecer en el mercado ya que en estas temporadas hay mejoramiento e incremento de ventas y quiere aprovechas ofreciendo a más clientes sus productos y así seguir aumentando más clientes para poder seguir ofreciendo día a día.

Gracias a fundación alternativa por apoyar con el capital para seguir incrementando el negocio y que con el futuro sea el negocio que pueda ser familiar que vaya creciendo generación en generación.
texts.en:
Rosa María has a stand in Atuntaqui market where she sells freshly plucked and processed chicken, a business she has had for 12 years. She has been shown to be an honorable and hard-working person in her work. She learned this skill on her own as she had the need to start a business so the decisions she made then have led to a successful business today that meets the needs of her household and she can also give the best to her daughter who is in school and wishes to be able to continue studying as she grows up. So Rosa Maria is doing everything possible in order to provide a better future for her daughter.

The loan will be used to buy more chickens to sell in the market because during this season there is an increase in sales and she wants to take advantage by offering more customers her products and in this way increase her number of customers in order to continue selling day after day.

Thanks to Fundación Alternativa for supporting her with the capital in order to continue growing her hbusiness and so that the future of her business can become a family business that grows from generation to generation.

loans.use: to buy more chickens and make her business grow, and with the income she will provide an education and a better future for her daughter.

loans.name: Mariana Erika

texts.es:
Mariana es una joven mujer de 22 años de edad, soltera, sin hijos, y trabaja y estudia.
Ella es inteligente, luchadora, constante, responsable y trabajadora. Sus estudios los realiza en la universidad pública en la carrera de contaduría pública. Universidad ubicada en la zona central; un área caracterizada por el comercio en todas las áreas, y que alberga a universidades, oficinas públicas y empresas privadas que conviven lado a lado, de clima seco y frío durante todo el año, con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 8-18 grados centígrados
Mariana es de tez morena, baja estatura, cabello negro largo, ojos obscuros, su lengua materna es el español y estudia inglés como requisito para conseguir trabajo. Ella estudia contaduría pública y se prepara para; Manejar las cuentas que intervienen dentro de una entidad, Analizar e interpretar Estados Financieros, Interpretar Movimientos Financieros y Contables de la Entidad, etc., se encuentra cursando el primer semestre. Su necesidad principal es la ayuda de una computadora portátil para realizar tareas e investigaciones en la web. A la par con sus estudios ella trabaja medio tiempo atendiendo una librería de colegio cercana a su domicilio. “me atrasé en entrar a la universidad por falta de dinero, con mi trabajo ayudo con los gastos de mi familia y me alcanza para pagar mis gastos escolares…” comenta. Su sueño es terminar su carrera profesional y trabajar en su rubro. Ella desea realizar la compra de una computadora portátil para continuar con sus estudios. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos en 1 año que viene estudiando en la universidad.
Es por esos motivos que Mariana solicita un préstamo para la compra de una computadora portátil para continuar con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Mariana is a 22-year-old woman. She is single and does not have any children. She works and studies. She is intelligent, determined, consistent, responsible, and hardworking. She studies public accounting at the public university, located in a central area which is characterized by all areas of business. Universities, public offices, and private companies exist side by side. It has a dry, cold climate year-round with temperatures varying between 8 and 18 degrees Celsius during the day.

Mariana is short and has tanned skin, long black hair, and dark eyes. Her first language is Spanish and she studies English as a requirement to find work. She studies public accounting to prepare herself to manage the accounts involved within an entity, analyze and interpret financial statements, interpret financial and accounting movements within the entity, etc. She is in the first semester of her studies. Her main need is for a laptop computer for internet tasks and research. Alongside her studies, she works part-time at a school bookstore close to her home. "I started university late due to a lack of money. With my job, I help with my family's expenses and I also manage to pay my school fees..." she says. Her dream is to finish her professional degree and work in her field. She would like to buy a laptop computer to continue with her studies. This is her first loan in her first year of university. 

For these reasons, Mariana is applying for a loan to buy a laptop computer to continue with her studies.

loans.use: to buy a laptop computer to continue with her studies.

loans.name: Roche

texts.en:
From Plaridel, Philippines, Roche earns a living through her clothing sales. She seeks to have enough inventory to continuously provide for her family, in addition to her husband's income. 

For her capital needs, PMPC has stood by her since the start of her business. She is happy that she is able to survive the fluctuations of business with determination and with her family as her inspiration. To earn more, she applied for a loan to purchase more clothing inventory to sell. 

Roche hopes to live comfortably with her children while they finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing to sell

loans.name: Miguela

texts.en:
Miguela is 35 years old and residing at Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is married and blessed only with 1 child who is still an infant. 

She joined PMPC on June 10, 2010 in order to access the programs and services of the said coop. Recently, she's accessed her 5th loan in the amount of PHP 30,000 for additional working capital for her existing business to buy a variety of commodities which will be sold in the local community.

loans.use: to buy a variety of commodities

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena is a widow; she lives in Kauswagan, Plaridel. 

For the past three decades, Magdalena and her late husband had been farmers. She is continuing to do this type of activity for a living. Magdalena earns 15,000 PHP each cropping by focusing on her rice farm. Magdalena became an active member of PMPC in 2011. She is now requesting a 40,000 PHP loan to purchase fertilizer in order to have a heavier and higher crop yield on her rice farm. 

In the future, she hopes to expand her business to improve the general living conditions of all those in the family and be able to provide for her grandchildren as well.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer to have a greater crop yield on her rice farm

loans.name: Luis Macelo

texts.es:
Marcelo, tiene 40 años, la esposa 47 años tiene 3 hijos con los cuales viven en casa propia en la parroquia de Natabuela que pertenece a Antonio Ante provincia de Imbabura, el sector donde vive es de artesanos donde las personas tienen su taller propio de confecciones, talleres de carpintería y sus platos típicos como las fritadas que son un deleite para los turistas.

Marcelo tiene su camioneta legalizada y que realiza servicio de alquiler de camionetas para todo público esto lo viene realizando desde años atrás en la cual ha demostrado ser una persona responsable en sus tareas que viene realizando día a día el hace viajes dentro y fuera de la provincia ofreciendo su servicio, empezó por iniciativa propia esta actividad y hoy en día se convirtió en el sustento de su hogar y una ayuda en toda necesidad, la esposa también le ayuda en el hogar ella se dedica al comercio de comida rápida por el sector de Natabuela, cada día se esfuerzan para dar todo lo mejor en su hogar.

Con el crédito va comprar llantas para la camioneta que es la herramienta de trabajo y tiene que estar impecable para el trabajo que realiza a diario que es de servir al público con los viajes en la camioneta.
texts.en:
Marcelo is 40 years old, his wife is 47 years old, and they have 3 children. The entire family lives in Natabuela parish in Antonio Ante province in Imbabura. In this area people specialize in artisan crafts and people have their own workshops for crafts, woodworking, etc. and its typical food as fried snacks that delight the tourists.

Marcelo has a registered truck with which he provides a service renting rucks to the public. He has been doing this for several years and is known to be a responsible person in his work that he does day after day making trips within and outside of the province. He began this work through his own initiative and today it has become the means of support for his home and a help in everything they need. His wife also helps with the home by selling fast food in the Natabuela sector. Every day they strict to provide the best for their home. With the loan he is going to buy tires for his truck as it is the primary tool of his work and it has to be in impeccable condition in order to daily serve the public with trips in his truck.

loans.use: to buy tires for his truck and provide safe transportation service and be able to support his home.

loans.name: Virgin

texts.en:
Virgin is 54 years old and has two children. She is married, and one of her children is currently in school.

Virgin is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Virgin has been in this business for five years now, and has borrowed 22 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Alma is 41 years old, and one of her children is currently in school.

Alma has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Alma has been in this business for five years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is 48 years old and married with five children. She works very hard to provide for her family.

Yolanda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell such as shampoo, noodles, spices, canned goods, soft drinks, etc.

Yolanda has been in this business for two years.

She would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell such as shampoo, noodles, spices, canned goods, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Celestina

texts.en:
Celestina works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy-and-sell ready-to-wear business in the Philippines.

Celestina requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of ready-to-wear to sell to her customers.

Celestina has been in this business for three years now.

Celestina would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of ready-to-wear clothes to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Charlene

texts.en:
Charlene works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Charlene requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients such as fish, vegetables, spices, meat, etc. for her food production business.

Charlene has been in this business for one year now.

Charlene would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients such as fish, vegetables, spices, meat, etc. for her food production business.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is a married woman with two children. Corazon is 29 years old and one of her children is currently in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Corazon has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Corazon requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional fish to sell.

Corazon has been in this business for three years. Corazon would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is a married woman with five children. Emma is 32 years old and three of her children are currently in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Emma has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Emma requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

Emma has been in this business for three years. In the future, Emma would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is a married woman with five children. Emma is 48 years old and one of her children is currently in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Emma has a fishing / fish vending business in the Philippines. Emma requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional materials and gears for her business.

Emma has been in this business for six years. In the future, Emma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials and gears for her business

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida is 58 years old and married with two children. Leonida works very hard to provide for her family.

Leonida runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF to buy items like canned goods, shampoo, conditioner, coffee, sugar, milk and other groceries to sell in her general store.

Leonida has been in this business for 20 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, shampoo, conditioner, coffee, sugar, and milk . 

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like canned goods, shampoo, conditioner, coffee, sugar, milk and other groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 46 years old and married with two children. Evelyn works very hard to provide for them.

Evelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional stock like coffee, sugar, canned goods, fabric conditioners, detergent soap, shampoo, etc., to sell.
