Evelyn has been in this business for one year and sells a variety of items such as coffee, sugar, canned goods, fabric conditioners, detergent soap, shampoo, etc. 

Evelyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock like coffee, sugar, canned goods, fabric conditioners, detergent soap, shampoo, etc., to sell

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida is 54 years old, married and has six children.

Adelaida is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. Adelaida requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Adelaida has been in the business for 10 years now, and has borrowed nine times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Glendel

texts.en:
Glendel is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional fish to sell for her fish-vending business.

Glendel has been in this business for five years. Glendel earns additional income from vegetable vending.

Glendel has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Honorata

texts.en:
Honorata is 68 years old and is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Honorata has a food-vending business in the Philippines. Honorata requested a 12,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her business.

Honorata has been in this business for eight years. In the future, Honorata would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her business

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 50 years old and married. She works very hard to provide for her family.

Delia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 22,500 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as canned goods, shampoo, conditioner, coffee, sugar, milk, and other groceries to sell in her general store.

Delia has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, shampoo, conditioner, coffee, sugar, and milk.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as canned goods, shampoo, conditioner, coffee, sugar, milk and other groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 55 years old and married with two children. Delia works very hard to provide for her family.

Delia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as canned goods, shampoo, conditioner, junk foods, biscuits, coffee, sugar, and other groceries to sell in her general store.

Delia has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, shampoo, conditioner, junk foods, biscuits, coffee, and sugar.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as canned goods, shampoo,  conditioner, junk foods, biscuits, coffee, sugar, and other groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Mahina

texts.ru:
23-летняя Махина является продавщицей ювелирных изделий. Она начала заниматься данным бизнесом с 2011 года. Хотя Махина имеет высшее экономическое образование, но по специальности она не работала. 
Махина в данный момент живет в районе Яван в доме мужа со свекровью и с семьей брата мужа. Муж Махины уехал на заработки в чужую страну, чтобы работать и присылать деньги семье. Сама Махина работает в магазине и занимается продажей ювелирных изделий. Этому бизнесу она науичилась у своего брата. Сейчас для развития бизнеса и увеличения товарооборота Махине нехватает немного средств. Она хочет привезти новую коллекцию серебряных изделий для перепродажи их к Новому году. Она надеется на этот кредит и на вашу поддержку. За счет прибыли Махина хочет улучшить условия быта.
texts.en:
Mahina is 23 and a jewellery seller, a business she started in 2011. She has a higher education in economics but hasn't worked in her field. She currently lives in the Yavan region in her husband's house with her mother-in-law and her husband's brother's family. Her husband left to work abroad in order to earn money to send to his family. Mahina herself works in a store selling jewellery, a business she learned from her brother.

Mahina doesn't have enough money to develop her business and increase her working capital. She wants to bring in a new collection of silver jewellery for resale for New Year's gifts. She hopes for this loan and for your support so that she can use her increased income to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase silver jewellery for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in a small business selling shoes and clothing by customer orders, with which she will support her family.

loans.name: Bon Samaritain Group

texts.fr: Marie est commerçante, présidente de la banque communautaire Bon Samaritain, cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée, âgée de 40 ans, mère de 7 enfants et tous vont à l’école. Elle commença son business avec de fonds de reçu de son mari. Elle est vendeuse des souliers usagés dans un marché de la ville depuis 20 ans. Elle va acheter 20 paires de souliers. Son conjoint est un infirmier. Elle souhaite obtenir plus des crédits, acheter une parcelle, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Marie is a small-scale businesswoman and president of the community "banque Bon Samaritain". A client of MFI Hekima, she is married, aged 40, and the mother of seven children. All of them go to school. She began her business with funds received from her husband who is a nurse. She has been selling used shoes in a town market for 20 years. 

Marie is going to buy 20 pairs of shoes. She would like to get more loans, buy a plot of land, and send her children to school and nourish them. In closing, she thanks Hekima for the support it brings to entrepreneurs who cannot otherwise access banking services.

loans.use: to buy 20 pairs of shoes.

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.en:
Trinidad, a responsible mother, requests a loan from Paglaum MPC, which she will use to increase her inventory. 

She wants to buy more kilos of banana to make more "banana cue" to sell. This way, she will be able to sell more products which will allow her to earn more money and provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase more kilos of bananas for her "banana cue" business

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Emely

texts.en:
Emely signed up for her membership with PMPC and obtained the needed capital to start up a sari-sari store business. She is thankful for the capital that was extended to a small-time borrower like her. Emely was able to turn the tide in her favor and is making good sales these days. 

She wants to take advantage of the good fortune. Recently, she took out a loan to restock her store with basic commodities like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce. In the future, she hopes to build a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock her store with items like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce.

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Utulivu B Group

texts.fr: Adidja commerçante, membre d’un groupe de crédits «Utulivu B», âgée de 57 ans, veuve, mère de 5 enfants dont 3 étudient et 2 ont fini leurs études. La cliente est vendeuse des denrées alimentaires. Elle étale sa marchandise dans un dépôt de la ville. Elle commença ses business avec de fonds reçu de son mari lors de son vivant. Il y a 10 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Elle va s’approvisionner en 10 sacs maïs, 5 sacs de soja et 5 sacs d’haricots. Ainsi, elle souhaite acheter une parcelle et la construire, scolariser, vêtir et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneuses non bancables.
texts.en:
Adidja is a small-scale businesswoman and a member of the loan group called «Utulivu B». Aged 57, she is a widow and mother of five children. Three of them are enrolled in school and two have finished their studies. This Hekima client sells foodstuffs. She displays her merchandise in a depot in the town. She began her business with funds she received from her husband when he was still alive. She has been running the business for 10 years. 

Adidja is going to buy 10 sacks of maize, 5 sacks of soybeans, and 5 sacks of dried beans. She hopes to buy a plot of land, build on it, and send her children to school and nourish them.  In closing, she thanks Hekima sincerely for helping women entrepreneurs who cannot access banking services to become independent.

loans.use: to purchase 10 sacks of maize, 5 sacks of soy beans, and 5 sacks of dried beans.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia works hard to support her family. Letecia is married and has a tailoring business in the Philippines.

Letecia requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional materials to use in her business like thread, scissors, etc.

Letecia has been in this business for 15 years now, and also earns additional income from fish vending.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional materials to use in her business like thread, scissors etc

loans.name: St Mary Immaculate Women Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photograph is Beatrice. She is a member of the St Mary Immaculate Women Group. Beatrice is sixty-eight years old, married and a mother of four children.

Beatrice farms maize, beans and practices dairy farming. She is happy for the Hand in Hand Eastern Africa enterprise management training that she received and which equipped her with skills to manage her business. 

Beatrice is borrowing from Kiva to further expand her dairy farming business. This is by buying dairy feed to help improve her cow's productivity hence an increase in her income. This will enable her to improve the living standards of her family, which includes quality education and modern housing.

Beatrice is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: To buy dairy feed that will help improve productivity.

loans.name: Kisa Self Help Group

texts.en:
Mary, age 60, pictured raising her hand, is a member of the Kisa Self Help Group. Mary joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2013. She and her husband are blessed with seven children.

After undergoing Hand in Hand Eastern Africa’s training on enterprise development and financial management, Mary diversified to poultry farming. She is requesting a loan from Kiva in order to buy more chickens for her poultry project. This will allow her to increase her income from the sale of meat and eggs to her customers. She hopes that this extra income will enable her to better cater to her family’s needs, providing essentials such as food, shelter and school fees for her children.

She is grateful to her Kiva lenders and promises to repay her loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy chickens

loans.name: Kisa Self Help Group

texts.en:
Musa, age 46, pictured raising his hand, is a maize and poultry farmer. He is a member of the Kisa Self Help Group. He joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2013. He and his wife have four children.

Musa appreciates Hand in Hand Eastern Africa for the training he received on record keeping and enterprise development that helped him commercialize his farming. He is requesting a loan from Kiva in order to buy fertilizer and seeds so as to boost his farm production. This will increase his income so that he will be better able to pay school fees for his three primary school children, as well as to cater to the family’s food and shelter needs. 

Musa is so grateful to Kiva and to his Kiva lenders, and he promises to repay his loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy maize seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Jose Adrian

texts.es: Don José tiene muchos años de laborar en enderezado y pintura, también hace trabajos de soldadura con esta actividad mantiene sus gastos y los de la familia, es un señor que ha mejorado las condiciones de su hogar con el apoyo de créditos, ahora con este crédito que solicita comprara materiales de construcción para embaldosar el piso de su taller porque cada vez que realiza trabajos de pintura el viento viene a estropear su labor teniendo que volver a hacerlo, ya con esta mejora podrá trabajar con más comodidad y tranquilidad.
texts.en: José has been working doing bodywork and painting for many years. He also does welding work and with this business covers his costs and those of his family. He is a man who has improved the condition of his home with the help of loans. Now with this loan he is requesting he will buy construction materials to tile over the floor of his workshop. Every time he does a paint job the wind damages it and he has to do it again. With this improvement he can work more comfortably and peacefully.

loans.use: to renovate his workshop to work more comfortably and offer his clients better conditions.

loans.name: San Lorenzo Group

texts.es:
El comité está conformado por 18 mujeres inspiradas en una mejor y buena calidad de vida, no solo para ellas, sino también para sus familias. Son luchadoras, trabajadoras y muy sacrificadas.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Claudelina, quien se encuentra contenta por formar parte del comité así ella y sus compañeras cuentan con una oportunidad de poder trabajar y generar sus propios ingresos. Claudelina se dedica a hacer comidas que ella misma se encarga de hacer y después sale a vender de forma ambulante.
Esta señora pide el préstamo para poder comprar verduras, carne, condimentos y demás, de manera a poder seguir con la venta de sus comidas, y seguir generando ingresos para ayudar a su familia.
texts.en: The committee consists of 18 women inspired by a better and good quality of life, not only for them, but also for their families. They are fighters, hard-working, and very self-sacrificing. One of the members if Claudelina, who is happy to be part of the committee as she and her colleagues count on the opportunity to be able to work and generate their own income.  Claudlina makes food that she herself makes and then sells as a street vendor. This woman seeks a loan to buy vegetables, meat, condiments, and other items and in this way be able to continue selling her food and continue generating income to help her family.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, condiments, and other items.

loans.name: Caacupe Poty Group

texts.es:
Las 17  integrantes cuentan con actividades variadas, cada una de ellas están poniendo su mejor esfuerzo para poder crecer y salir adelante en las actividades que hacen.
La señora Virginia es miembro del comité, ella es una mujer muy trabajadora, que está luchando y esforzándose para poder crecer y ayudar a su familia por medio de su trabajo. El préstamo lo pide para poder invertirlo en la compra de telas para la confección, de manera a poder seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo.
Todas agradecen por la oportunidad que reciben de poder crecer y salir adelante.
texts.en:
The 17 members have a variety of businesses. Each one of them puts in their best effort to be able to grow and get ahead in the businesses that they do.

Virginia is a member of the committee. She is a hard-working woman and she is struggling and making an effort to grow and help her family through her work. The loan she is requesting is to be able to invest in buying fabric for sewing. In this way she can continue working as she has been doing. All the members are grateful for the opportunity to grow and get ahead that they are receiving.

loans.use: to buy fabric to sew.

loans.name: Phors's Group

texts.en: Phors’ group lives in a rural village in the Prey Veng province of Cambodia. Phors makes a living cultivating rice and planting lotus. He does extra work as a factory laborer to support his family. In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help them to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Genevere

texts.en:
Genevere works hard to support her family. She is married and has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines.

Genevere requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional vegetables to sell such as papayas, cabbages, potatoes, spices, etc.

Genevere has been in this business for six years now.

In the future, Genevere would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional vegetables to sell such as papayas, cabbages, potatoes, spices, etc.

loans.name: Imani Mutiume Women Group

texts.en:
Ruth, age 32, farms potatoes to earn her living. She also operates a beauty parlor. She is a member of Imani Mutiume Women Group. She has one child.

Ruth is very grateful for the Hand in Hand Eastern Africa training that has enabled her to better manage her business through their enterprise development module. 
 
She is requesting a loan from Kiva to boost her farming business by buying farm inputs such as fertilizer and pesticide. She believes this will improve her production and increase her income. She will therefore be better able to support her family.

Ruth is grateful to Kiva and to her Kiva lenders, and she promises to repay her loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides that will help boost her farming

loans.name: Yat's Group

texts.en: Yat’s group lives in a rural village in the Prey Veng province of Cambodia. Yat makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as a farmer to support his family. In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help them to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Chanthourn's Group

texts.en: Chanthourn’s group lives in a rural village in the Prey Veng province of Cambodia. Chanthourn makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses.  It will also help them save time collecting fuel and boiling water to sanitize it.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
Las 17  integrantes de este grupo se unieron con la esperanza de poder crecer y salir adelante, son de la ciudad de Caacupé, y cada una pone su mejor esfuerzo para poder ayudar a sus familias.
Digna es parte de este grupo, ella tiene una despensa bien surtida en la que trabaja todos los días desde muy tempranas horas de día, es una mujer muy trabajadora, que poco a poco, y a través de su esfuerzo ha ido creciendo y ayuda a sus seres queridos.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder surtir su despensa con todo tipo de productos, como ser bebidas, verduras, frutas, carne y demás, de manera a poder seguir con su trabajo. Ella esta agradecida por esta oportunidad que recibe de poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
The 17 members of this group got together with the hope of being able to grow and get ahead. They are from the city of Caacupé, and each one puts in their best effort to help their families.

Digna is part of this group. She has a well-stocked store where she works every day from the early hours. She is a hard-working woman who little by little through her efforts has been growing and helping her loved ones. She is requesting this loan to be able to stock her store with all kinds of products like drinks, vegetables, fruit, meat and others so she can continue with her work. She is grateful for this opportunity that she is receiving to be able to improve her living conditions and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy drinks, vegetables, fruit, meat and others.

loans.name: Las Artesanas Group

texts.es:
El comité está conformado por 25 Señoras muy trabajadoras y luchadoras, que se unieron para poder salir adelante, e ir creciendo no solo en lo económico, sino también como persona. La fundación paraguaya les ha dado capacitaciones para poder ir mejorando y creciendo.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Mirtha, esposa del Señor Felipe, quien además es madre muy luchadora,  ella es artesana, tejedora y vendedora ambulante, cabe resaltar que la Sra. Mirtha es muy activa en su comité. Cuenta siempre con el  apoyo incondicional de su familia y agradece por la oportunidad de crecimiento que está recibiendo.
Solicitó este préstamo para la compra de sus  productos  para la venta de  forma ambulante, como ser prendas y calzados. Ella es una persona muy sacrificada y luchadora que se esfuerza por su familia y seres queridos.
texts.en:
This communal bank is made up of 25 very hard-working and determined women, who came together so that they could get ahead and continue to grow, not only economically, but also as people. The Paraguaya Foundation has given them training so that they can keep improving and growing. 

One of the members is Mirtha, wife of Felipe, who is also a very determined mother. She is an artisan, weaver and mobile vendor. It should be noted that Mirtha is very active in the communal bank. She always has the unconditional support of her family, and she expresses gratitude for the opportunity for growth she is receiving. 

She requested this loan to buy products to sell as a mobile vendor, such as clothing and shoes. She is a very self-sacrificing and hard-working person who makes great efforts for her family and loved ones.

loans.use: to buy clothing and shoes to sell as a mobile vendor.

loans.name: Joyeuse Y Group

texts.fr: Feliciane est commerçante, membre de la banque communautaire Joyeuse Y, cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée, âgée de 38 ans, mère de 6 enfants tous vont à l’école. Elle commença son business après avoir vendu des récoltes de son champ. Elle est vendeuse des souliers usagés au marché central de la ville depuis 14 ans. Elle va acheter 60 paires de souliers. Son conjoint est un vendeur d’eau. Elle souhaite obtenir plus des crédits, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en: Feliciane is a businesswoman and a member of the Joyeuse Y community bank. She is a customer of IMF Hekima, and is 38 years old, married and mother to six children, all of whom attend school. She began her business with income from the harvested produce from her field, and she has been selling used shoes at the town's central market for the past 14 years. She is going to buy 60 pairs of shoes. Her husband sells water. She would like to get more loans and be able to educate and feed her children. Finally, she is grateful to Hekima for the support it provides to entrepreneurs who do not have access to banks.

loans.use: to buy 60 pairs of shoes.

loans.name: Fortaleza 27 Group

texts.es:
Victoria es una mujer de 56 años de edad, viuda, tiene 4 hijos varones de 36, 30, 24 y 21 y una hija mujer de 22 años, y su negocio es la venta de ropa de segunda mano.
Su negocio lo desarrolla en la zona de ‘Pacajes’ un lugar estratégico caracterizado por conectar a varias zonas de la ciudad mediante todo tipo de transporte, donde la gente se aglomera para conseguir movilidad a su hogar, de clima frío y seco a una altura promedio de 3800 metros sobre el nivel del mar.
Victoria es de tez morena, cabello negro corto crespo, baja estatura, su lengua materna es el Aymará y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza (sentada en la fila de atrás, al lado de la ventana, usa suéter color lila). Su vida la comparte con sus 2 hijos menores porque el resto ya es independiente, viven en una casa alquilada construida de ladrillo que cuenta con agua potable, electricidad, gas domiciliario y alcantarillado. Sus deseos de superación la llevaron a liderar una banca de personas con negocios como; venta de materiales de construcción tejido de ropa de bebe, venta de papas fritas, venta de ropa deportiva, tienda de barrio, carnicería y venta de sándwiches, para solicitar un préstamo y ampliar sus actividades comerciales. Su negocio es la venta de ropa de segunda mano; inicio su negocio vendiendo juguetes, más adelante incursionó vendiendo ropa de segunda mano; “los juguetes se venden por temporada, la ropa se vende constantemente por el precio y la necesidad…” comenta. Su sueño es construir su casa propia, ella desea invertir en su negocio mediante la compra de ropa de segunda mano por mayor para satisfacer la demanda de temporada y complacer a sus clientes. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 10 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Victoria solicita un préstamo para la compra de ropa de segunda mano por mayor para satisfacer la demanda  de temporada.
texts.en:
Victoria is a 56-year-old woman. She is a widow who has 4 sons, ages 36, 30, 24 and 21, and one 22-year-old daughter. Victoria sells second-hand clothing.

Victoria developed her business in the ‘Pacajes’ area, a strategic place characterized by its connection to various zones of the city through every type of transportation, a place where people agglomerate to find mobility to their homes. It has a cold, dry climate at an average height of 3800 meters above sea level.

Victoria has a dark complexion, short curly black hair, and a short stature. Her native language is Aymará, and she speaks Spanish because of the general culture and the business she does (she is seated in the back line, next to the window, in a purple sweater). Victoria shares her life with her 2 youngest children because the rest are already independent. They live in a rented brick house that has potable water, electricity, natural gas, and sewer. Her dreams of improvement led her to lead a group of people with businesses such as: selling construction materials, weaving baby clothing, selling french fries, selling athletic clothing, running neighborhood stores, butchers, and selling sandwiches. She leads them in requesting loans and expanding their business activities. Victoria’s business is selling second-hand clothing. She started her business selling toys, and later branched into selling second-hand clothing. “The toys sell for a season; clothing sells constantly because of the price and its necessity…” she says. Victoria’s dream is to build her own house. She wants to invest in her business by buying second-hand clothes wholesale to satisfy the seasonal demand and please her clients. This is her first series of loans with the institution in the 10 years she has been working in this business. 

For these reasons, Victoria is applying for a loan to buy second-hand clothing wholesale to satisfy the seasonal demand.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothing wholesale to satisfy the seasonal demand.

loans.name: Jaime Alberto

texts.es:
Jaime se ha dedicado a la carpintería gran parte de su vida, pues desde muy temprana edad inició trabajando como empleado en algunas carpinterías y ebanisterías donde aprendió a realizar la actividad. 

Jaime al ver que su negocio estaba muy mal remunerado decidió independizarse y montar su propio taller de carpintería donde gracias a la buena calidad de sus trabajos ha podido tener una gran cantidad de clientes. 

Jaime se encuentra soltero y es muy emprendedor. Debido a que tiene dificultades de capital, Jaime ha tenido que rechazar algunos pedidos de sus clientes por la poca capacidad para conseguir las materias primas necesarias. 

Con el ánimo de mejorar esta condición, Jaime aspira a que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de materias primas como madera, pegante, clavos, entre otros, para la fabricación de grandes pedidos de sus clientes. 

Jaime aspira que el préstamo le permita elaborar estos pedidos sin que se afecten sus ingresos mensuales. 

Además, Jaime espera que el negocio le genere ingresos con los cuales pueda ofrecerles a sus padres una mejor calidad de vida y mayores oportunidades de salir adelante.
texts.en:
Jaime has worked in carpentry for most of his life. At a very young age, he started working as an employee in some carpentry and cabinetry businesses where he learned the activity. Upon seeing that this did not pay well, Jaime decided to become independent and open his own carpentry shop, where thanks to the high quality of his work he has been able to have a large number of clients.

Jaime is single and is very enterprising. Because he has money difficulties, Jaime had to reject orders from some of his clients because he could not get the raw materials he needed. In hopes of improving this condition, Jaime aims to get a loan that will offer him the possibility of being able to buy raw materials, such as wood, glue, and nails, among others, to build his clients’ large orders.

Jaime hopes that the loan will allow him to make these orders without affecting his monthly income. In addition, Jaime hopes the business will generate income with which he can offer his parents a better quality of life and greater opportunities to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as wood, glue, and nails, among others.

loans.name: San Agustin Group

texts.es:
El grupo San Agustin está en su ciclo número 2 del programa de comité de mujeres, son 19 mujeres que se están esforzando y luchando para poder crecer. Ellas están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, luchando cada día.
La Sra. Elsa es una de las integrantes, está haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza para poder conocer su situación de vida e ir mejorando su situación de pobreza. Ella se dedica a la venta de comidas varias que ella misma hace y que después sale a vender. Solicita de este préstamo para la compra de variedad y más cantidad de productos, lo que le ayudará  a concretar su plan de negocio de venta de comestibles, ya que quiere comprar verduras, condimentos, carne y demás. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder ir creciendo.
texts.en:
The San Agustin group is in its second loan cycle of the Women Committee program.  They are 19 women who are putting a lot of effort and struggling to get ahead. They are under the Eliminate Poverty Program struggling day by day.

Elsa is one of the members and she is participating in the Eliminate Poverty Survey to learn more about her living conditions and how to improve her poverty situation.  She works selling various types of foods that she prepares and then goes out to sell. She is asking for this loan to buy a variety and a larger quantity of products. This will help her finalize her business plan by buying vegetables, condiments, meat and other foods to sell.  She is thankful for this opportunity she receives which allows her to grow.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, condiments, meat and other products to prepare meals.

loans.name: Nuestra Señora De La Asuncion Group

texts.es:
El grupo Nuestra Señora de la Asunción está en su ciclo número 6 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde también forman parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, para poder lograr que cada una de ellas vayan superando su situación de pobreza.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Liz quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel tres, lo que quiere decir que ha ido mejorando su situación de pobreza a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y por medio de la venta de reciclados, que ella recolecta y que hace de manera ambulante. Es una señora muy humilde y trabajadora.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder comprar cartones, plásticos y demás para poder revender, de manera a tener un mejor ingreso para poder ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
Nuestra Señora de la Asunción Group is in its sixth loan cycle with the women's bank program.  They're also part of the poverty-elimination program so each one can manage to overcome her level of poverty.

One of the members is Liz, who earned a poverty level of three in her last survey.  This means she has improved her poverty level through her effort and continuous work selling the recycled materials she collects on foot.  She's a very modest and hardworking woman.

Liz is requesting this loan to buy cardboard, plastics, and other items for re-sale so she can earn more income to help her family.

loans.use: to buy cardboard, plastics, and other items for re-sale

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres Emprendedoras está en su ciclo número 1 Del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, como un medio de poder conocer la situación de vida de cada una e ir mejorándola.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Francisca, quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel dos, es decir, está en un nivel medio de pobreza, luchando por mejorar a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo. Ella tiene una despensa bien surtida, donde trabaja todos los días desde muy tempranas horas, hasta muy noche, es una persona muy sacrificada y trabajadora.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de verduras, frutas, enlatados, lácteos, panificados y demás, de manera a poder seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo. Ella está contenta por esta oportunidad que recibe y que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
The group called "Mujeres Emprendedoras" is in their 1st loan cycle with the Woman's Committees where everyone works and helps each other to get ahead, They are participating in the Poverty Stoplight survey as a way to understand the life situation of each member and improve.

One of the members is Francisca who in the last survey had a poverty level of two. That is to say medium poverty and she is struggling to improve through her efforts and constant work. She has a well-stocked store where she works from the early hours until late at night. She is a very selfless and hard-working person.

She is requesting this loan to be able to invest in the purchase of vegetables, fruit, canned goods, dairy products, bread and others. In this manner she can continue to work as she has been doing. She is grateful for this opportunity that she is receiving and it will be of great help.

loans.use: to buy fruit, vegetables, canned goods, dairy products, bread and others.

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
El comité “Mujeres Luchadoras” está integrado con 17 señoras, ellas tienen diversas actividades en las que trabajan arduamente para poder crecer y ayudar a sus familias.
Berta, es integrante de este grupo, ella es peluquera y una mujer muy trabajadora y luchadora, que se está esforzando por poder dar a su familia todo lo que ella no pudo tener y que no tengan que pasar por ningún tipo de necesidades. Comenta que su negocio es el sostén de su familia, y la forma en la que les ayuda.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de shampoo, enjuagues, tintes, cremas y demás, de manera a poder seguir con un buen servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The "Mujeres Luchadores" [Fighting Women] committee is made up of 17 women. They have diverse activities in which they arduously work to be able to grow and help their families.

Berta is a member of this group. She is a hairdresser and a very hardworking and fighting woman, who is striving to be able to give her family everything that she couldn't have and so that they don't have to pass on any kind of necessities. She comments that her business is the sustenance of the family, and the manner in which she helps them.

She is applying for this loan to be able to invest it in the purchase of shampoo, rinses, dyes, creams and more to be able to continue with a good service to her clients.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, rinses, dyes, creams and more.

loans.name: Utulivu A Group

texts.fr: Mapendo est commerçante, membre d’une banque villageoise «Utulivu A», âgée de 49 ans, femme vivant seule et  mère de 7 enfants qui tous étudient. La cliente est vendeuse des denrées alimentaires. Elle étale sa marchandise dans un dépôt du centre commercial de la ville. Elle commença ses business avec de fonds reçu d’un bienfaiteur. Il y a 16 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter 10 sacs maïs, 6 sacs d’haricots et soja. Ainsi, elle souhaite scolariser, vêtir et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneuses non bancables.
texts.en:
Mapendo, age 49, is a merchant and member of the “Utulivu A” village bank. She is raising seven children alone; all of them go to school.  
Mapendo sells foodstuffs. She conducts her sales from a store in a local shopping center. She launched her business with capital received from a 
benefactor, and she has been practicing this activity for 16 years.    

This new loan will help her to buy 10 sacks of maize, and 6 sacks of beans and soy.   

Her goals are to keep her children fed, clothed, and educated. 

Mapendo wishes to thank Hekima for supporting women entrepreneurs who want to become self-sufficient but cannot use the traditional banking system.

loans.use: to buy 10 sacks of maize, and 6 sacks of beans and soy.

loans.name: La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado La Esperanza está en su ciclo número 5 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, que les permitirá poder superar la situación de pobreza de cada una.
 Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Ramona, quien entre el trabajo que ella hace, cuenta que tiene un kiosco, en el cual vende todo tipo de productos, y que ha crecido poco a poco por medio de su esfuerzo y sacrificio. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora y sacrificada, que empezó con muy poco y que hoy se ha hecho ya de muy buena clientela.
La Sra. Ramona pide de este préstamo para la compra de sus productos para su venta como empanadas, gaseosas, yogurt, entre otras cosas  lo que le ayudará a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The group called "La Esperanza" ["Hope"] is in its fifth loan cycle within the women's committee program. All of its members are working and helping each other to get ahead. They are participating in the poverty elimination survey, which will help each of them escape from their situation of poverty. 

One of the members is Ramona, who reports that she operates a kiosk among the other work that she does. She sells all types of products in her kiosk, and it has grown little by little due to her effort and sacrifice. She is a very hard-working and self-sacrificing woman, who began with very little and today has already built up a very good customer base. 

Ramona is requesting this loan to buy products to sell, such as empanadas, soft drinks, and yogurt, among other items, which will help her fulfill her plan for her business and help her improve her income.

loans.use: to buy empanadas, soft drinks, yogurt, and other items to stock her kiosk.

loans.name: Ujamaa Group

texts.fr: Ernestine est commerçante, membre d’un collectif de crédits «Ujamaa», âgée de 47 ans, mariée à un commissionnaire, mère de 5 enfants dont 3 étudient et 2 sont mariés. La cliente est vendeuse des denrées alimentaires. Elle étale sa marchandise à son domicile dans une avenue animée de la ville. Elle commença ses business avec de fonds reçu  de son mari. Il y a 20 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter 1 sac de mil et 2 sacs farines de manioc. Ainsi, elle souhaite scolariser, vêtir et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en: Ernestine is a businesswoman and a member of the Ujamaa loan collective. She is 47 years old, married to a broker and mother to five children, three of whom are studying and two who are married. She sells food products and lays out her goods at home in a lively avenue in the town. She began her business with funds from her husband.and has been running it for the past 20 years. This new loan will be used to buy a sack of millet and two sacks of cassava flour. She would thus like to be able to educate, clothe and feed her children. Finally, she is extremely grateful to Hekima for giving autonomy to female entrepreneurs who do not have access to banks.

loans.use: to buy a sack of millet and two sacks of cassava flour.

loans.name: Heshima Group

texts.fr: La cliente Furaha est une commerçante et membre de l’association d’affaires «Heshima», entrepreneuse, âgée de 47 ans, mariée a un maçon et mère de 6 enfants qui  tous  étudient.  La cliente est vendeuse des planches de constructions. Elle stocke sa marchandise dans un dépôt du marché de la place. Elle commença ses affaires avec un crédit reçu d’une coopérative. Plus tard, elle bénéficia le prêt de l’IMF Hekima. Il y a 12 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter 150 planches. Ainsi, elle souhaite scolariser, vêtir, et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneuses non bancables.
texts.en: The customer, Furaha, is a businesswoman and a member of the Heshima business association. She is a 47-year old entrepreneur, who is married to a builder and mother to six children, all of whom are studying. The customer sells planks for construction purposes. She stocks her goods in a store in the local market. She began her business with a loan from a cooperative and later on, she benefited from a loan from IMF Hekima. She has been exercising this activity for the past 12 years. This new loan will be used to buy 150 planks. She would thereby like to be able to educate, clothe and feed her children. Finally, she is grateful to Hekima for the autonomy it gives to female entrepreneurs who do not have access to banks.

loans.use: to buy 150 planks.

loans.name: Fidélité Group

texts.fr: Muteba est commerçante, présidente de la banque communautaire Fidélité, cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée, âgée de 38 ans, mère de 8 enfants tous vont à l’école. Elle commença son busines avec de fonds reçu de son mari. Elle est vendeuse des souliers usagés au marché central de la ville depuis 5 ans. Elle va acheter 50 paires de souliers. Son conjoint est un militaire. Elle souhaite obtenir plus des crédits, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en: Muteba is a businesswoman and president of the Fidélité community bank. She is a customer of IMF Hekima, and is 38 years old, married and mother to eight children, all of whom attend school. She began her business with funds from her husband, and she has been selling used shoes at the town's central market for the past five years. She is going to buy 50 pairs of shoes. Her husband is a soldier. She would like to get more loans and be able to educate and feed her children. Finally, she is grateful to Hekima for the support it provides to entrepreneurs who do not have access to banks.

loans.use: to buy 50 pairs of shoes.

loans.name: Ishara Group

texts.fr: Amunazo est commerçante, membre d’une banque villageoise «Ishara», âgée de 43 ans, veuve, mère de 5 enfants dont 1 seul étudie et 4 manquent une prise en charge. La cliente est vendeuse des beignets et cannes à sucre. Elle étale sa marchandise à son domicile dans une avenue animée du bidonville. Elle commença avec des marchandises qu’elle prenait à crédit au grossiste et après elle devina cliente de l’IMF Hekima. Il y a 5 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter 2 sacs de farine, huile végétale, sucre, braises, etc. Ainsi, elle souhaite scolariser, vêtir et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Amunazo, age 43, is a merchant and member of the Ishara village bank. She is a widowed mother to five children, one of whom goes to school while the other four lack direction.   

Amunazo sells beignets and sugarcane. She conducts her sales from her home in a busy street of a shanty town. She started her business with supplies 
purchased on credit from wholesalers, and later became a member of Hekima. She has been practicing this activity for 5 years.    

This new loan will help her to buy 2 sacks of flour, some vegetable oil, sugar, charcoal, etc.    

Her goals are to keep her children fed, clothed, and educated. 

Amunazo wishes to thank Hekima for supporting women entrepreneurs who try to become self-sufficient but cannot use the traditional banking system.

loans.use: to buy 2 sacks of flour, some vegetable oil, sugar, charcoal, etc.

loans.name: Baby Group

texts.en:
Dampui is a widow whose husband left her after fighting for his life for a very long time. She said, “I still miss him every day, and he still lives in my heart.” 

Dampui, the profiled borrower of the group, is pictured with her hand raised among the group members. She runs a medical store in her locality which remains as the only source of income for the household. She feels wonderful to serve the sick people through her medical store and is very satisfied with her business. 

She manages to send her children to school from the income she gets from the medical store and also manages the household needs. Her never-ending support to her family and enthusiasm is a symbol for the neighbours to encourage one another. Being the only one working in the family, she has her ups and downs when it comes to financial matters. 

She aspires to innovate her medical store by keeping different stock of medicines that will be easily available for many customers most of the time. The loan will be used to buy more stock of varieties of medicine for selling purposes. The income derived from the medical store will be used to provide for her family sufficiently. She also hopes to save some amount regularly for security purposes. She is very happy and says thank you to all the lenders. 

The rest of the group members are engaged in similar businesses. They all have a common goal to help themselves through the Kiva loan and strive to achieve financial freedom in the future.

loans.use: to buy stock of medicines to sell in her medical store.

loans.name: Sumo Lom Group

texts.en:
“Five years ago I started selling dry fish as the only business option, and now I'm addicted to it because without doing this, my family would have been nowhere,” says Lawmting, a 29-year-old woman. 

The profiled borrower of the group, Lawmting is a very hardworking mother, and she is pictured with her hand raised. She lives with her family in a small village where most people are engaged in shifting cultivation for their livelihood. 

Lawmting buys dried fish from suppliers and resells them in the hometown market at a higher rate. The small profit she gets from selling dried fish is used to provide for the household expenses and educational fees for her children. Sometimes, she cannot save up because she has to spend out of pocket when unexpected events occur in the family and neighbourhood. 

When she lacks capital, she weaves traditional shawls and wraparound skirts for income-generation purposes, so that she could save up some amount for the dried fish business. She aspires to sell more dried fish with a sufficient amount of capital and to develop a more stable business. 

She feels excited to get a loan. With the Kiva loan, she will buy stock of dried fish for selling purposes. She feels enlightened now that she is able to fulfill her dreams and wishes to be successful in her business endeavour. She sends her thanks to all the lenders who make her dreams come true. 

The rest of the group members share their joy with Kiva. They have a common interest to strive toward self-reliance through the Kiva loan.

loans.use: to buy dried fish from suppliers to resell in her hometown market.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is 65 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for her family.

Lourdes runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items like coffee, sugar, toothpaste, shampoo, conditioner and other groceries to sell in her general store.

Lourdes has been in this business for 12 years and sells a variety of items. With this loan, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like coffee, sugar, toothpaste, shampoo, conditioner and other groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Bethsy Lom Group

texts.en:
Hoinu, the profiled borrower of the group, is an honest and a faithful single woman of 42 years. She lives with her elder brother, his wife and his children at Lingsiphai village. Hoinu is pictured with her hand raised. 

She was supported by her elder brother before she learned the skills of weaving. As time passed by, her brother could no longer support her needs with the addition of new members in the family, including his two children. It became a turning point for Hoinu to start earning her income, as she had been dependent on her brother for a very long time. She decided to learn weaving skills from her friends in the neighbourhood, and finally, she could start weaving on her own at her place and start earning. 

After she started earning, she also helped her brother’s family by providing basic requirements for the children at home. She weaves traditional shawls, which are very much in demand. She could not meet the demand on time since she lacks capital to buy the materials required for her weaving. She aspires to weave as much as the demand made by the customers. 

The Kiva loan will be used to buy wool and other materials required for weaving. She will be able to save some amount of her earnings for emergency purposes. She also aspires to buy household furniture and a set of dishes in the future. 

All the group members thank the lenders for their generosity. They will make the maximum utilization of the loan in their businesses.

loans.use: to buy wool for weaving.

loans.name: Sarun's Group

texts.en: Sarun’s group lives in a rural village in the Prey Veng province of Cambodia. Sarun makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a tailor to support her family. In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Hceun's Group

texts.en: Hceun’s group lives in a rural village in the Prey Veng province of Cambodia. Hceun makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In her village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Fenix Group

texts.es:
El grupo Fenix se formo en la ciudad de Mariano Roque Alonso, lo integran 19 mujeres muy trabajadoras y luchadoras, todas forman parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, que les permitirá poder conocer la vida de cada una y conforme a ello poder ir mejorando.
Una persona que se destaca es Rocio, quien se dedica a la costura y también a la producción de hamacas, ella comenta que se ha abierto camino con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio, y que es el sostén de su familia, que ella los mantiene y saca adelante. Ella quiere ir creciendo y seguir mejorando sus condiciones de vida.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar telas, hilos, gomas y demás, de manera a poder seguir con su trabajo de costura, y continuar luchando por mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
The "Fenix" ["Phoenix"] group was formed in the city of Mariano Roque Alonso. It is made up of 19 very hard-working and determined women. All of them are participating in the poverty elimination program, which will allow them to understand the living conditions of each one and work on improving them. 

One person who stands out is Rocio, who dedicates herself to making clothing and also producing hammocks. She comments that she has found ways to get ahead with great effort and sacrifice. She also reports that she is the sustenance of her family, supporting them and helping them get ahead. She would like to keep growing and improving her living conditions. 

She is requesting this loan to buy fabric, thread, elastic and other supplies, so that she can continue with her work making clothing and keep working hard to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, elastic and other supplies to make clothing.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
El grupo Mujeres Emprendedoras, es de la ciudad de San Ignacio, ellas son unidas y solidarias las unas con las otras, trabajan juntas en actividades para poder fomentar su unión.
La Sra. Carmen es la presidenta del grupo, ella es Peluquera,  ella vive con sus hijos, donde todos en la casa colaboran en el bienestar de la familia para poder salir adelante. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora y luchadora que cada día se esfuerza por poder progresar.
La Sra. Carmen solicita  este préstamo para mejorar la infraestructura de su casa para que sus clientas se sientan confortables cuando van a su salón de belleza. Agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
The group Mujeres Emprendedoras [Enterprising Women] is in the city of San Ignacio. They are unified and in solidarity; they work with the others, they work together in activities to foster their union.

Carmen is the president of the group. She is a hairdresser. She lives with her children, where everyone in the house collaborates in the wellbeing of the family to be able to get ahead. She is a very hardworking and tenacious who pushes herself every day to be able to progress.

Carmen is applying for this loan to improve the infrastructure of her house so that her clients feel comfortable when they go to her beauty salon. She is thankful for the opportunity that she is receiving which will be of much help.

loans.use: to improve the infrastructure of a home that is utilized as a beauty salon.

loans.name: Santa Catalina Group

texts.es:
El grupo Santa Catalina  está en su 2do ciclo del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas se comprometieron a trabajar y a ayudarse entre todas para salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 4 de las 18 señoras se encuentran en un nivel de pobreza extrema.
Integra este grupo la Sra. Eydie, quien en su  encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza extrema, ella a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y por medio de la venta de frutas y verduras se encuentra mejorando su situación de pobreza.
La señora Eydie pide este préstamo para poder comprar frutas y verduras, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas, ofreciendo algo fresco a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Santa Catalina Group is in its second loan cycle in the women's communal bank, in which all the women promised to work and support each other mutually to get ahead.  They're completing the "Poverty Spotlight" survey, in which 4 of the 18 women are at a level of extreme poverty.

Eydie, a member of this group, showed a level of extreme poverty in her survey.  She's improving her poverty level through her effort and continuous work selling fruits and vegetables.

Eydie's requesting this loan to buy fruits and vegetables so she can keep on selling her customers something fresh.

loans.use: to buy fresh fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Maximo

texts.es:
El señor Máximo es de la ciudad de Concepción, está casado y tiene 3 hijos, por quienes se esfuerza para poder sacarlos adelante y que tengan una mejor vida.
El se dedica a realizar fletes ya que el mismo tiene un camión de cargas. Tiene varios clientes comerciantes a quienes presta sus servicios de flete llevando productos varios. 
El señor Máximo pide este préstamo para poder hacer un mantenimiento a su camión, el cual es su elemento de trabajo.
texts.en:
Máximo is from the city of Concepción. He is married and has 3 children, for whom he strives to be able to get them ahead and so that they have a better life.

He works carrying freight since he has a cargo truck. He has various commercial clients to whom he offers his freight services, carrying various products.

Máximo is applying for this loan to be able to do maintenance to his truck, which is his element of work.

loans.use: to do maintenance to his truck.

loans.name: Joyeuse J Group

texts.fr: Mbavumoja est commerçante, présidente du groupe de crédits «Joyeuse J», client de l’IMF Hekima, mariée à un chômeur, âgée de 45 ans, mère 8 enfants qui tous étudient. Elle commença son business avec de fonds de reçu de son mari. Elle est vendeuse des pagnes au marché de la ville depuis 15 ans. Elle va acheter 15 pagnes. Elle  souhaite construire une maison, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en: Mbavumja is a businesswoman and president of the Joyeuse J loan group. She is a customer of IMF Hekima, and is 45 years old, married to an unemployed man and mother to eight children, all of whom are studying. She began her business with funds from her husband. and she has been selling "pagnes" (pieces of brightly-colored West African fabric) for the past 15 years. She is going to buy 15 pagnes. She would like to be able to build a house, educate and feed her children. Finally, she is grateful to Hekima for the support it provides to entrepreneurs who do not have access to banks.

loans.use: to buy 15 "pagnes".

loans.name: Salvadora

texts.es:
La Sra. Salvadora tiene 40 años, vive  en la Ciudad de Coronel Oviedo, proviene de una familia  de comerciantes,  se independizo en el año 2012, montando su propio negocio de despensa, fabricación de hielo en barra, embutido y cárnicos en general. 
Comenta que tiene una buena cantidad de clientela  formada,  además con la ayuda de su familia y la Fundación Paraguaya ya logro muchas cosas a su corta edad y cada día crece su negocio.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de verduras, frutas, lácteos, panificados y demás, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Salvadora is 40 years old. She lives in the city of Coronel Oviedo, and she comes from a family of merchants. She started working independently in 2012, setting up her own business consisting of a neighborhood store, as well as block ice production, sausages and meats in general. 

She comments that she has an excellent number of loyal customers, and also has help from her family and the Paraguaya Foundation. She has already achieved a lot at her young age, and her business is growing every day. 

She is requesting this loan so that she can invest the funds in buying vegetables, fruits, dairy products, breads and other items, so that she can continue with her sales as she has been doing.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, fruits, dairy products, breads and other items to stock her store.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.es:
Wilson es un hombre de 24 años de edad, casado, tiene 1 hijo varón de 5 años y 2 hijas mujeres de 7 y 10 años, y su negocio es el lavado de autos.
El es emprendedor, constante, independiente, responsable y trabajador. Su negocio lo desarrolla en el centro de la ciudad; un área caracterizada por el comercio en todas las áreas, y que alberga a universidades, oficinas públicas y empresas privadas que conviven lado a lado, de clima templado durante todo el año, con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 18-28 grados centígrados.
Wilson es de tez morena, cabello negro corto, baja estatura, su lengua materna es el Quechua y habla español por cultura general y por el servicio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su esposa que se dedica a la venta de papa y con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela, viven en una casa propiedad de su padre que cuenta con electricidad y agua de pozo. Su negocio es el servicio de lavado de autos, negocio que viene realizando desde que tenía 4 años de edad junto a su padre. “inicie mi trabajo por la necesidad de ayudar a mis padres, cuando era muy niño, actualmente continuo con esta labor…” comenta. Su sueño es tener otra actividad para generar mejores ingresos y construir una casa para sus hijos. Él desea realizar una inversión en su negocio mediante la compra de una compresora de aire y ceras pulidoras de carrocerías por mayor. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 20 años que viene realizando esta actividad de forma independiente.
Es por esos motivos que Wilson solicita un préstamo para la compra de una compresora de aire y ceras pulidoras por mayor para ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Wilson is a 24-year-old man who is married and has one son, age 5, and two daughters, ages 7 and 10. He is in the car washing business.

Wilson is enterprising, constant, independent, responsible, and hard-working. His business has developed in the center of the city, an area characterized by commerce in all areas. It also houses universities, public offices and private enterprises, side by side. The climate is mild year 'round, varying in temperature between 18 and 28 degrees centigrade in the daytime.

Wilson is dark in appearance with short black hair, and he is of short stature. His mother tongue is Quechua but he speaks Spanish generally and for the services he performs. Wilson lives his life with his wife who sells potatoes, and with his children who study at school. They reside in a house belonging to his father, and it has electricity and well water.

His business is a car-washing service that he has been involved in since he was four years old with his father. “I started my business when I was very small,” Wilson says, “because I needed to help my parents, and up to the present I have continued in this work...."

Wilson's dream is to have a second activity to generate better income and, also, to construct a house for his children. He wants to make an investment in his business by purchasing an air compressor and polishing waxes for car washes at wholesale. This is his first loan cycle with this institution in his 20 years in business independently.

This is why Wilson is requesting a loan: to purchase an air compressor and polishing waxes at wholesale, in order to expand his business.

loans.use: buy an air compressor and polishing waxes at wholesale to expand his business.

loans.name: Yohana

texts.es:
Yohana estudia la carrera de contabilidad y está en su cuarto año, comenta que su meta es poder convertirse en una excelente profesional.
Quiere seguir la carrera de derecho al terminar su carrera de contabilidad, y de esa forma poder seguir creciendo como profesional. Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de sus cuotas, de manera a poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Yohana is studying for a degree in accounting, and she is in her fourth year. She reports that her goal is to become a successful professional. 

She would like to continue with a law degree after finishing her accounting studies, and in this way she will be able to continue growing as a professional. She is requesting this loan so that she can invest in paying her university tuition, so that she can continue with her studies,

loans.use: to pay her university tuition.

loans.name: Bon Berger Group

texts.fr: Safari est commerçante, membre de la banque communautaire Bon Berger, cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée, âgée de 30 ans, mère de 6 enfants dont 4 vont à l’école et 2 sont gosses. Elle commença son business avec de fonds reçu d’une institution de la place. Elle est vendeuse de la braise dans un dépôt de la ville depuis 2 ans et demi. Elle va acheter 20 sacs de braises. Son conjoint est un commerçant. Elle souhaite construire une maison, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Safari, age 30, is a merchant, a member of the Bon Berger community bank, and a client of Hekima. She is married with six children, four of whom go to school while the other two are still too small. Her spouse is also a merchant.   

Safari has been selling charcoal from a local store for the past two and a half years. She started her business with capital obtained from a local institution. 
She plans to buy 20 sacks of charcoal.    

Her goals are to build a house and to keep her children fed and clothed. 

Safari wishes to thank Hekima for supporting entrepreneurs who want to become self-sufficient but cannot use the traditional banking system.

loans.use: to buy 20 sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for his tricycle maintenance.

loans.name: Janie Lee

texts.en:
Janie Lee is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 25 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Janie Lee has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell to her customers.

She been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Janie Lee would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Lorena is 42 years old and has three children who are still in school.

Lorena has a buy-and-sell ready-to-wear business in the Philippines. Lorena requested a 12,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy additional shorts, pants, shirts etc. to sell in her business.

Lorena has been in this business for 5 years. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional shorts, pants, shirts etc. to sell in her business.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 41 years old and widowed with one child. She works very hard to provide for her family.

Lorna runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, conditioner, soap, coffee, sugar, milk and other groceries to sell in her general store.

Lorna has been in this business for 4 years and sells a variety of items. With this loan, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo, conditioner, soap, coffee, sugar, milk and other groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Soet Women Group

texts.en:
Catherine, the person raising her hand in the photo, is 54 years old. She is married and has five children. Catherine is a member of Soet Women Group, and she is a maize, beans and potatoes farmer. She works from 9 A.M. until 5 P.M. every day except for Sundays. She has 8 years of experience in this business. The training she got from Hand in Hand Eastern Africa has enabled her to run her enterprise effectively.
Catherine has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to expand her farming business by renting two acres of land to expand her potatoes farming since the demand is high. She plans to use the anticipated income to support her children's education.
Catherine is grateful to Kiva and its lenders and promises to pay promptly.

loans.use: to rent farming land in order to expand her farming yield and improve her income.

loans.name: Chhorn's Group

texts.en: Chhorn’s group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Chhorn makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help this woman and man to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Eam's Group

texts.en:
Eam’s group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Eam cultivates rice to earn a living and support her family. 

In the group's village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter in each of their homes will help these women safeguard the health of their families. It will also save them money on medical expenses and time spent on collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Sophy's Group

texts.en:
Sophy’s group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. To make a living and support her family, Sophy cultivates rice and does extra work as a tailor and seller. 

In the group's village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at each of their homes will help these members safeguard the health of their families. It will also save them money on medical expenses and on time spent collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for the family.

loans.name: Car Group

texts.en:
Luanngaihmuang hails from a small village in the hills. She lives with her husband and two children, whom she loves dearly. Luanngaihmuang is the featured borrower of the group and is pictured with her hand raised. As a person, she is very devoted to her family and finds happiness in small things. 

She is engaged in weaving traditional shawls to draw income and supplement her husband’s income. She learned her weaving skills from her mother at a young age, and she considers herself very lucky to be the daughter of a skillful weaver. Weaving became her only earning activity, since she does not have expertise in other professions. This makes her business very special as a love story between her and her mother as both are engrossed in it. 

She aspires to expand her weaving business by weaving more items for selling. To attract more customers, she needs a better quality of threads and yarn. The Kiva loan will be used to buy the required materials for weaving purposes. She aspires to weave beautiful traditional shawls that will be admired by many people. She wishes to make breathtaking traditional shawls that will be irresistible for any customer. Her earnings will be used to provide for the family's daily requirements and other fees. She is very glad to get the loan, which enlightened her financial instability. 

The rest of the group members are all committed businesswoman and engaged in weaving and other businesses. They are all excited to get the loan from Kiva and send their gratitude for the kindness showered upon them.

loans.use: to buy more threads and yarn of different textures for weaving purposes.

loans.name: Aquila Lom Group

texts.en:
Doiting says, “I find pleasure in servicing and giving fresh vegetables to my customers.” Everyone wants to buy fresh leafy vegetables that are very nutritious and good for health. 

Doiting is a mother of four and lives with her husband, whose occupation is a woodcutter. They live in Lingsiphai and are situated at the outskirts of town. She goes daily to the main market in town to sell her produce to earn her income. “It has been five years now [that] I have been selling vegetables to supplement my household income,” she said. 

Other than this, she is also engaged in weaving and knitting during her free time at home for income generation. She provides the educational fees for her children from her income, while her husband’s income is used to meet their household's daily requirements. 

Sales are high but according to the taste of customers, so sometimes she has a loss. Due to fluctuation of her income from the business, she is unable to save money and that limits her from selling more items. She hopes to sell more items so that she could attract more customers and earn more income. She wishes to save some amount for their future so that her family could have better living conditions. 

With the Kiva loan, she will buy more varieties of vegetables to sell in the market. She strives for better living conditions for her family. 

All the group members are very happy to get a loan from Kiva. The loan will be used to promote their businesses.

loans.use: to buy stock of vegetables like mustard leaves, ginger and roots to sell in the market.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma has stopped her work being a laundrywoman to her neighbor where she has only received a daily wage of PHP 100. As a good mother and responsible wife, she never gets tired of supporting her husband in raising their family. Alma has four kids.

In order to earn a living, she engaged in a snack-vending business. Her business is doing well when she doubles her time perfecting her own food snacks recipe. She has maximized her profits and keeps pursuing her goals for the good of her family.

The reason why she requested another loan from PMPC is to buy additional raw ingredients for her food snacks; to cater to more customers and be able to accept orders as well for additional earnings. She hopes and prays that her business will grow. She will make other snack recipes to increase sales.

In the future, Alma wishes to build a decent house for the family.

loans.use: to buy additional raw ingredients for her food snacks; to cater to more customers and be able to accept orders as well for additional earnings.

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es:
Ricardo es de la ciudad de Encarnación, estudia y trabaja ya hace más de 4 años, está cursando la carrera de agronomía, está en el cuarto año.
Su principal objetivo es terminar su carrera y desempeñarse en forma independiente, y poder abrirse camino en el mundo laboral.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus cuotas de la carrera, y así seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Ricardo is from the city of Encarnación. He has already been studying and working for more than 4 years. He is studying the degree of agronomy, he's in the fourth year. His main goal is to finish his degree and work in an independent manner, and be able to open his path in the working world.

He applies for this loan to be able to pay for his school tuition and therefore continue with his studies.

loans.use: to pay for tuition.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan, a widow, is 62 years old and lives in Luzaran, Lopez Jaena. In order to survive, she sells rice cakes. Aside from selling rice cakes, she operates a sari-sari store.

Susan recently became an active member of Paglaum MPC. She wants to obtain financial assistance in the amount of PHP 3,000 to purchase more goods for her sari-sari store because selling rice cakes is not sufficient for her daily needs.

She plans to repair their house for a decent and comfortable living.

loans.use: to purchase more goods for her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Mujeres Al Frente Group

texts.es:
El comité Mujeres al frente está en su ciclo 1 del programa de comité de mujeres emprendedoras, donde todas mantienen una actividad propia emprendida por ellas mismas, trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante y otras que son amas de casa a poder emprender alguna actividad y generar ingresos para ayudar a sus familias.
 La señora Liz es costurera, una persona muy trabajadora y luchadora, que se esfuerza por poder seguir con su trabajo y continuar ayudando a su familia. Es una señora muy luchadora y por sobre todo sacrificada.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de telas, hilos, gomas y demás, de manera a poder seguir con su trabajo, luchando por crecer y seguir ayudando a su familia. Agradece por la oportunidad que esta recibiendo que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
The "Mujeres al Frente" communal bank is in the first cycle of the female entrepreneurs' committee program, in which all members run their own business activities. They work and help each other to succeed, and help others who are housewives to start a business activity and generate an income to help their families.

Liz is a seamstress. She is very hardworking and determined. She works hard to continue with her business and to continue helping her family. She is a persevering woman, and above all she is selfless.

She is applying for a loan to invest in the purchase of fabric, thread, elastic, and more to continue with her work and fight to grow and continue helping her family. She is grateful for this opportunity, which will be of great help to her.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, elastic, and other sewing materials.

loans.name: La Clémence Group

texts.fr: Lutala est commerçante, conseillère de la banque villageoise La Clémence, cliente de l’IMF Hekima, veuve, âgée de 53 ans, mère de 3 enfants qui ont tous fini les études. Elle commença son business avec de fonds reçu de sa famille. Elle est vendeuse des friperies à domicile sur l’avenue animée de la ville depuis 5 ans. Elle va acheter des sacs à main, robes, culottes, etc. Elle souhaite obtenir plus des crédits, initier de micro projets pour l’auto prise en charge de ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Lutala, age 53, is a merchant, an advisor to the village bank “La Clémence”, and a client of Hékima. She is a widowed mother to three children who have all completed their studies.    

For the past 5 years, Lutala has been selling second-hand clothing from her home on a busy street of the city. She started her business with capital received from her family. She plans to buy handbags, dresses, trousers, etc.  

Lutala hopes to get more loans, and she wants to launch micro-projects for her children to become self-sufficient.    

Lutala wishes to thank Hekima for supporting entrepreneurs who cannot use the traditional banking system.

loans.use: to buy handbags, dresses, trousers, etc.

loans.name: Odelia

texts.en:
Odelia, 36 years old, lives in Upper Puntod, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental with her husband and five children. Her husband is a construction worker. Unable to sustain the needs of the family with only her husband’s income, she has found ways to attain income through snack vending. It began with selling a small amount of snacks to their neighbors.

She joined Paglaum Cooperative, which helped her in the capitalization of her sari-sari (small grocery) store in January of 2012. She became a MIGS (member in good standing) member, which is why she has received loans several times already.
