Now, she is applying for 30,000 PHP to buy merchandise for her sari-sari store and to pay for additional raw ingredients for her snack vending business. She hopes that her business will continue, so that she can give her family a better life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her sari-sari store and to pay for additional raw ingredients for her snack vending business.

location.town: Plaridel-Upper Puntod, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occide

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna, 52 years old, is separated and has one child. She presently lives in Magcamiguing, Calamba, Philippines. Myrna bravely supports her only child through her farm income. She has also been engaged in buying and selling charcoal for five years. Myrna was very happy when she joined Paglaum Cooperative because of its programs and services that members enjoy and use. 

Myrna is borrowing a loan of 7,000 PHP, half of which will be used to pay for labor in cultivation and half to buy seedlings and compost. Myrna prays and hopes that her farm will yield more income for emergency and savings.

loans.use: to pay for labor and to buy seedlings and compost

loans.name: Batlkhagva

texts.en:
Batlkhagva, 70, lives with his wife in Darkhan, one of the largest cities of Mongolia. He has been rendering taxi services locally since 2007, after his retirement. His wife also has retired from her work and receives a state pension. 

The house they live in has been deteriorating over the years. So Batlkhagva is requesting a loan of $1,450 (USD) to buy building materials, such as bricks, cement, fiberglass and foam, for a house renovation. After the renovation, he and his wife will live in a warm and comfortable place, where less coal is burned, thus releasing less pollutant into the atmosphere.

loans.use: to renovate his house to burn less coal

loans.name: Tsogtbayar

texts.en:
Tsogtbayar, 28, lives with his wife and child in Darkhan, one of the largest cities of Mongolia. He has been working as an operator at a steel factory since 2010. His wife stays at home to look after their child. 

The small house his family lives in has been deteriorating over the years. So Tsogtbayar is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 Mongolian Tugrik to buy building materials, such as bricks, cement, fiberglass and foam for a house renovation. 

After the renovation, his family will live in a warm and comfortable place where less coal is burned, releasing less pollutant into the atmosphere. Burning coal is considered the main source of air pollution in Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia's capital city.

loans.use: to renovate his house to burn less coal

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita is 41 years old and married with two children. She earns a living with her pig fattening business in the Philippines. She has been pig fattening for 10 years and also earns additional income from food vending.

Juanita is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs. She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Lagrimas

texts.en:
Lagrimas is 39 years old and married with five children. With five children currently in school, Lagrimas works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell, like canned goods, shampoo, coffee, detergent soap, sugar, vinegar, etc. Lagrimas has been in this business for 20 years.

In the future, Lagrimas would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell, like canned goods, shampoo, coffee, detergent soap, sugar, vinegar, etc.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Letecia has been in this business for 2 years now.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell to her customers. Letecia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Lucia is 42 years old and has two children who are currently in school. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines and has been in this business for 3 years.

Lucia requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Medina

texts.en:
Medina works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Medina has been in this business for 5 years now.

Medina requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell in her fish stall. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell in her fish stall.

loans.name: Melodina

texts.en:
Melodina is 45 years old and married with six children. With two children currently in school, Melodina works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

She has been in this business for 2 years and sells a variety of items such as candies, biscuits, sanitary pads, shampoo, cereals, etc. 

In the future, Melodina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Merlinda is 44 years old and has two children who are currently in school. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines and has been in this business for 5 years.

Merlinda requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional fish to sell. In the future, Merlinda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi is 52 years old and is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Naomi has a fish vending business in the Philippines and has been in this business for 10 years. 

Naomi requested a PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell to her customers.

In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Norma is 53 years old and has one child who is still in school.

She has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines and she has been in this business for 10 years. 

She requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase materials for the maintenance of her fishing boat.

Norma would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase materials for the maintenance of her fishing boat.

loans.name: Rochelle

texts.en:
Rochelle is 37 years old and has five children. Three of them are currently in school.
 
Rochelle is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. She has been raising livestock for 2 years now, and has borrowed 11 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.
 
She requested a PHP 26,000 loan through NWTF to buy vitamins and other supplies for her livestock. 

In the future, Rochelle would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy vitamins and other supplies for her livestock.

loans.name: Alba Miriam

texts.es:
Alba es una mujer de experiencia, sabiduría y mucha paciencia.
Es madre de 2 hijos y ha trabajado prácticamente toda su vida para sacarlos adelante.
Ella tiene una pequeña chaza en la que vende frituras, golosinas y refrescos, adicional a esto trabaja en producción y venta de comidas que ella misma prepara en su casa. 
Trabaja todos los días de 5:00 Am  a 3:00 Pm para tener su producto listo y fresco para sus clientes que en su mayoría son los vecinos del sector donde vive.
Ella desea capitalizar su negocio y tener un gran avance de insumos e inventario de productos, por eso acude a un préstamo para comprar surtido de bebidas y frituras, además desea comprar insumos para su producción de alimentos.
Una de sus principales dificultades es la falta de dinero para invertir en su negocio pero confía en la ayuda de la Corporación Interactuar y el buen corazón de los prestamistas de Kiva para sacar su actividad adelante.

Con un préstamo que hagas hoy podrás mejorar la vida y el negocio de Alba¡
texts.en:
Alba is a woman with experience, wisdom and a lot of patience.

She is the mother of two children and has worked practically her whole life to get them ahead.

Alba has a small food stall from which she sells fried foods, sweets and sodas. In addition to this job, she makes and sells food that she prepares in her home. Alba works everyday from 5:00 am to 3:00 pm to have fresh products ready for her customers. Most of her customers are neighbors from the area where she lives.

Alba wants to capitalize her business and have progress in her supplies and product inventory. That is why turning to a loan- so she can purchase a variety of beverages and fried food. In addition, she wants to purchase supplies for making the food she also sells.

One of Alba's main difficulties is not having enough money to invest in her business. But she trusts in help from Corporación Interactuar and the good hearts of the Kiva lenders to get her business ahead. By making a loan today, you can help Alba improve her business and her life!

loans.use: to purchase a variety of beverages and fried foods and also to purchase supplies for her food production.

loans.name: Soeun's Group

texts.en: Soeun’s group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng Province in Cambodia. Soeun makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as a seller to support his family. In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and men to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for his family.

loans.name: Thavy's Group

texts.en: Thavy’s group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng Province in Cambodia. Thavy makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a seller and farmer to support her family. In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help this woman and man to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Renacer Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Renacer está en su ciclo número 3 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde dos señoras se encuentran en un nivel de pobreza extrema.
La Sra. Elva, es una de las integrantes, ella tiene una mercería donde vende todo tipo de productos, como ser calzados, prendas y demás. Comenta que por medio de su trabajo ella puede ayudar a su familia y darles todo lo que ella no pudo tener.
Solicita este préstamo para la compra de variedad y más cantidad de materiales  para la venta como calzados y prendas varias. Cabe destacar que las integrantes de este grupo han trabajado y logrado unirse más entre ellas.
texts.en: The Renacer Group is in its third cycle of the women's committee program, whereby everybody works and helps each other to get ahead. They are doing a survey to eliminate poverty, and found that two ladies in their group live at an extreme poverty level. Mrs. Elva is one of their members.  She owns a notions store where she sells all kinds of products, like footwear, clothing and others. She stated that through her work she is able to help her family and give them everything she could not have. She is asking for this loan to buy a larger and more assorted quantity of products to sell, such as footwear and diverse clothing. We should point out that the members of this group have worked and succeeded in uniting more among themselves.

loans.use: To purchase footwear and clothing for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase chickens, vitamins and feed to raise and sell chickens.

loans.name: Vedaste

texts.en:
Vedaste, 35 years old, is married and has 2 children aged 5 and 10 years, both attending school. He is a farmer who has been farming for 9 years. Vedaste would like to use the loan from Kiva to buy more fertilizers to grow maize to sell. The profits from the business will be used to buy food for home consumption.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers to grow maize to sell

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma, 43 years old, is best described as a hardworking mother. She resides in the Poblacion Municipality of Sibutad, Zamboanga Del Norte, Philippines. Emma has 3 children and is married to a laborer. Her husband's wages aren’t enough to sustain the family's daily needs, so Emma started a business, a food stand or “carenderia”. Emma has been in the business for more than a year now. 

Emma wants to expand her food stand business. She wants to gain more profit and to have enough to sustain her family, especially her children and to be able to send her son to college. In order for Emma to make her wish possible, she needs PHP 7,000 additional capital. She intends to use the loan to buy meat, rice toppings, other ingredients, utensils and items needed in the food stand. Emma hopes to live a comfortable life someday with her family.

loans.use: to buy meat, rice toppings and ingredients for her carenderia

loans.name: Erlyn

texts.en:
Erlyn, 50 years old, is a widow with three children. She is a resident of Sinaad, Sapang Dalaga, Philippines. Erlyn has been farming for more than a decade and cassava vending is her primary source of livelihood. She became a member of Paglaum MPC in November 2013. 

Erlyn decided to apply for a loan to buy fertilizer for cassava and root crops and to buy vegetables as an additional business. She hopes to increase her income with more inventory to sell. In the future, Erlyn hopes to save more for emergencies and house renovations.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for cassava and root crops

loans.name: Daniel Steeven

texts.es:
Daniel es un joven muy emprendedor y tenaz, con grandes deseos que ha estado cultivando y tratando de cumplir.

Tiene un pequeño negocio de preparación y venta de comidas rapidas y alitas de pollo.

Con esta actividad intenta día a día  salir adelante y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia compuesta por sus padres y un hermano quienes son el motor de su vida y su motivación para luchar diariamente.

Su mayor dificultad es la competencia del sector, pero con su gran capacidad de trabajo es capaz de sostenerse y progresar.

Daniel solicita un préstamo para realizar la compra de una parrilla y surtido de ingredientes para sus preparaciones y así atender a sus clientes de una mejor manera y con mayor variedad.

Con tu ayuda Daniel Podrá pagar su universidad que es uno de sus más grandes sueños!
texts.en:
Daniel is an enterprising and tenacious young man who has great wishes that he has been developing and trying to fulfill. He has a small business in which he prepares and sells fast food and chicken wings. With this business, he intends to move forward each day and improve his family’s living conditions. His parents and his brother are his motivation in life and give him the encouragement to push forward each day.

His greatest challenge is dealing with competition in the area, but his great work ability will help him to sustain himself and make progress. Daniel is requesting a loan in order to buy a grill and a stock of ingredients for preparing his food. As a result, he can better serve his customers by offering them a wider variety.

With your help, Daniel will be able to pay for university and fulfill one of his biggest dreams!

loans.use: to buy a grill and a stock of ingredients for preparing food.

loans.name: Lenie

texts.en:
Lenie, age 48, is happy tending her little store. She is married and has two children; her husband is a carpenter. The store is Lenie's means of earning a living to support her family. Fortunately, her store is located in a populous neighborhood, resulting in promising daily sales. Lenie keeps on running the store well even though there is increased competition from other stores. Lenie believes that, with PMPC's support, as one family they will sustain and beat the competition.  

Lenie has reached her 4th year as a member of Paglaum MPC. She has applied for a loan of PHP 14,900 to expand her store inventory to gain additional income. She has confidence that she can maintain the label of member in good standing, as "it's already tested," she said. Lenie is a hardworking mother who wishes to sustain the store and, from there, afford to provide a good education for her children.

loans.use: to buy stock for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Irma

texts.en:
Irma, a resident of Tanza, Cavite, Philippines, is married to Benedict, an office employee. As the mother of two children, she works hard to give her family the best that she can provide.

Irma sells liquefied petroleum gas, a necessity at home used in cooking. Aside from that, she retails pre-paid cards to mobile subscribers who want to send money to their loved ones. She earns a total 8,000 Philippine pesos per month. 

To help continue operating her businesses and increase sales, she is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP. She will use the loan to buy tanks of LPG and to purchase pre-paid cards for mobile devices. These investments will help her meet her family's everyday needs and pay for the education of her children. 

Irma faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from her studies in the the Word of God. 

Irma is very thankful for the help she will receive.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To buy tanks of liquefied petroleum gas and pre-paid cards for mobile phones.

loans.name: Rodelyn

texts.en:
Rodelyn is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Rodelyn is 24 years old and has one child who is currently in school.

She has a buy and sell scrap materials business in the Philippines and has been in this business for 4 years. 

Rodelyn requested a PHP 16,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more scrap materials to sell.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more scrap materials to sell.

loans.name: Negresita

texts.en: Negresita works hard to support her family. Negresita is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines. Negresita has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional fishing net for her business. Negresita has been in this business for eight years now. Negresita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing net for her business

loans.name: Roselita

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Roselita works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fish vending. Roselita is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Roselita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is 48 years old, married, and has six children who are currently in school.

She is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She has been into pig fattening for 1 year now and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Susana requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 59 years old and married with seven children. Virginia works very hard to provide for them.

Virginia runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 23,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Virginia has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items, such as canned goods, cereals, milk, juice, snack foods, soft drinks, coffee, bath soap, etc. 

In the future, Virginia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Julieth Paola

texts.es:
Julieth es una mujer muy responsable y cooperativa que desde joven decidió irse a vivir con el amor de su vida, una pareja joven pero con ganas de progreso, para ellos su unión familiar es mas importantes que los percances y dificultades económicas que en este momento afronta, pro preocupación, necesidad y espíritu emprendedor, desde principios del año 2014 Julieth inicio con su venta de ropa y accesorios para hombre y dama, esta actividad le ha ayudado mucho a su pareja a pagar todas las deudas, y mejorar la calidad de vida y lo más importante seguir juntos pues una vez por falta de capital estuvieron a punto de volver a su hogar.
Julieth ama a su pareja y quiere establecer un vínculo y con gusto sigue trabajando para el bien de su familia, solicita un crédito para la compra de surtido de ropa para hombre y dama, también de accesorios para ambos sexos, pues quiere seguir sirviendo de apoyo para su marido y que juntos levanten un hogar prospero en el que esperan hijos.
texts.en:
Julieth is a very responsible and cooperative woman, who from a young age decided to go and live with the love of her life. They are a young couple that wishes to get ahead. For them their family union is more important than the setbacks and economic difficulties that they are currently facing. Because of her worries, needs and entrepreneurial spirit, Julieth started selling clothes and accessories for men and women in early 2014. This activity has helped her partner to settle all debts, to increase their quality of life, and most importantly to remain together, as once due to a lack of capital they were about to return home.

Julieth loves her partner and wishes to establish a link with him. She gladly keeps working for the good of her family. She is requesting a loan to buy varied clothes for men and women, as well as accessories for both sexes. This is because she wishes to keep being a support for her husband and that they can establish a prosperous home together, in which they expect children.

loans.use: to buy varied clothes for men and women

loans.name: Ma. Gracia

texts.en:
Ma. Gracia is a 49-year-old married woman with nine children, two of whom are currently in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

Ma. Gracia has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en: Liezel, 30 years old, lives in Mitimos, Rizal, Zamboanga del Norte, Philippines. She is single and helps to support her parents. Liezel has operated a sari-sari (variety store) business for 3 years. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy three sacks of feed for her pigs, which is her other source of income. Liezel has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Liezel hopes to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy three sacks of feed

loans.name: Fabian

texts.es:
Fabian proviene de una familia de clase media, su meta es culminar sus estudios para obtener más ingresos y ocupar un mejor cargo en su lugar de trabajo así mejorar la calidad de vida.
Está estudiando la carrera de contabilidad, y por medio de sus estudios quiere ir abriéndose camino.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de sus cuotas, de manera a poder continuar estudiando y luchando por sus metas.
texts.en:
Fabian comes from a middle-class family. His goal is to finish his studies so that he can earn more income and obtain a better job at his place of work. This will help to improve his quality of life.

Fabian is studying for a degree in Accounting. Through his studies, he hopes that doors will open for him. He is requesting this loan so that in can invest in the payment of his fees. As a result, he can continue studying and striving for his goals.

loans.use: to pay his university fees.

loans.name: Marina

texts.es: Marina de 35 años de edad es una mujer emprendedora que se gana la vida con su tienda de productos básicos negocio que posee desde hace 12 años, pero además cuenta con un molino de nixtamal con el que logra obtener mejores ingresos económicos. Ella habita en vivienda propia junto a su esposo y sus 2 hijos desde hace 12 años. Marina desea invertir en su tienda ya que cada día son más los clientes que buscan sus productos por lo que ella no logra dar abasto con la demanda de productos por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, café, leche en polvo, jabón, detergente, cloro, papel higiénico, etc.
texts.en: Marina is 35 years old. She is an entrepreneur who earns a living with her store of basic commodity products. She has owned this business for the past 12 years, and she also owns a corn flour mill which has helped her obtain better economic income. She has lived in her own home along with her husband and two children for the past 12 years. Marina wants to invest in her store, given that everyday there are more customers looking for her products and she is not able to meet the demand for these products.  Thus,  Marina is asking for a loan from FUSAI to invest in rice, beans, sugar, coffee, powdered milk, soap, detergent, bleach, toilet paper, etc.

loans.use: To invest in: rice, beans, sugar, coffee, powdered milk, soap, detergent, bleach, toilet paper, etc.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia, 53 years old, is married and has two children. She lives in Solinog, Calamba. Lydia has been a farmer for 15 years, growing vegetable crops to earn a living. She has requested a loan of 3,500 PHP to purchase three sacks of fertilizers and chemicals. Lydia has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Lydia hopes to harvest more vegetable crops to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and chemicals for vegetables

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in: chickens, concentrated food and vitamins.

loans.name: Hector

texts.es:
Hector se encuentra estudiando la carrera de Administración de Empresas, y a la vez se encuentra trabajando en una entidad financiera. Sus aspiraciones son la de crecer como profesional y así poder darle un futuro mejor a su familia.
El pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo. El es una persona que se está esforzando por poder ser alguien en la vida.
texts.en:
Hector is studying for a degree in Business Administration. At the same time, he is working at a financial institution. His aspirations are to grow as a professional and to provide a better future for his family.

He is requesting this loan so that he can pay his degree fees. This will enable him to continue his studies just as before. Hector is a person who strives to make something out of his life.

loans.use: to pay his university fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy grains, groceries, snack foods, beverages, and other products for her store.

loans.name: Ben

texts.en:
Ben is married and has two children. He is a permanent resident of Nansana-Wakiso. Ben is a first-time borrower with UGAFODE Microfinance and has requested a loan of UGX 2,000,000. He is taking this loan to add stock to boost his bar business as he prepares for Christmas. Ben hopes that this loan will enable him to make more sales and thus increase profit.

Ben is grateful to Kiva lenders, through UGAFODE, beacuse the loan obtained will help him add stock to his business. He is also thankful for the low interest rates and the long repayment period. Ben is hardworking and thanks Kiva lenders and UGAFODE for being there for him and providing financial assistance.

loans.use: to add stock

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 20 years and works hard to support her family.

She has requested a loan of 15,000 Philippine pesos through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation. She will use the loan to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

Concepcion would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth, 48, is married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for one year and sells a variety of items, such as snack foods, cooking oil, noodles, candies, biscuits, coffee and salt. 

Elizabeth has requested a loan of 15,000 Philippine pesos through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation. She will use the loan to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Elizabeth would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Eva Mae

texts.en:
Eva Mae, 27, is married with two children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines and has been in this business for two years. 

Eva Mae has successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 Philippine pesos through the Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation. She will use the loan to buy more fish to sell.

Eva Mae would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Maricris

texts.en:

Maricris is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. Maricris has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional sacks of feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Maricris has been in this business for four years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en:
Marieta is 26 years old and married with five children. Two children are currently in school. Marieta works very hard to provide for her family.

Marieta runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items like junk food, biscuits, coffee, sugar and other groceries to sell in her general store.

Marieta has been in this business for ten years and sells a variety of items, such as biscuits, coffee and sugar. 

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like junk food, biscuits, coffee, sugar and other groceries to sell in her general store.

Melie Fe has been in business for 12 years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Carlita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

Lourdes has been in this business for 20 years now. Her goal is to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

Robelen is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional piglets, feeds, vitamins and other supplies for her business.

Robelen has been in the pig fattening business for 5 years now, and has borrowed from NWTF one time in the past to sustain her enterprise. Her goal is to save enough money to be able to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional piglets, feeds, vitamins and other supplies for her business

In the future, Editha would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

Trinidad would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional containers of coconut wine to sell

loans.name: Mary Jane

loans.name: Jorgie

texts.en:
Jorgie is a married woman with five children. She is 33 years old and three of her children are currently in school. Jorgie is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Jorgie has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Jorgie has been in this business for three years. In the future, Jorgie would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Liberata

texts.en:
Liberata works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Liberata requested a PHP 11,500 loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients for her food production business. She has been in this business for 20 years now.

Liberata would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Ebenezer Group

texts.en:
Mary C. is the profile borrower of Ebenezer group and is pictured with her hand raised. She is 29 years of age and lives with her husband and three sons. They live in Churachandpur town.

Her husband is an ice cream vendor and earns his income from the fraction of money he gets by selling ice cream by the roadside. The amount of income her husband earns was not enough to meet the daily needs of the whole family; this became the turning point for Mary to start her own business. There was nothing much she could do to provide enough for the family. So, she started running a small tea stall in their locality, which was the only option for her to start earning.

After she started running the tea stall, her financial condition was slightly better than the days before. With her meager income, she could not extend her business the way she hoped for. She wishes to expand her business by attracting more customers, and for that she needs to buy more stock of sugar, milk powder, wheat flour, edible oil, and other ingredients. She has been waiting for a long time to expand her tea stall, but due to the shortage in finances, she had to bear with it until she came across WSDS, which became the sole hope of Mary to achieve her long-awaited dream of expanding her tea stall.

Hopefully, she will now be able to expand her tea stall with the help of a Kiva loan. She also hopes to have sufficient household finances in the near future. She is very happy with the help she received from the lenders; this will change her life for the better. She is indebted towards the help she received, without whose support her life would have been the same with many hardships.

The rest of the group members are engaged in similar activities to achieve their own financial freedom. They are all very happy and eagerly waiting for the Kiva loan.

loans.use: to buy stock of sugar, milk powder, wheat flour, and edible oil to use in her tea stall.

loans.name: Victor Hugo

texts.es:
Lo que se puede observar en la foto, es la actividad económica del amigo Víctor quien se dedica al comercio de canela, color, y condimentos para cocina en general, una actividad que inicio en el año 2002 y que significa el sustento de su humilde hogar conformado por su pareja y tres hijos ya mayores de edad. 
un impulso económico significa una gran ayuda para Víctor quien no recibió el apoyo de otras entidades pues no confiaron en él y ahora que sabe lo maravillosa ayuda que recibe de interactuar quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de materia prima como el clavo, la canela, y cominos para seguir desarrollando al actividad y buscar mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y lo hará con la ayuda de posibles alianzas con tiendas y mini mercados ofertándoles el servicio y con la salvedad que ya tendrá la materia prima para cubrir los pedidos que era su principal impedimento para seguir progresando su actividad, por tal razón apóyalo no le cortes las alas del progreso al amigo Víctor.
texts.en:
What can be seen in the photograph is Victor's business. He makes a living selling cinnamon, color, and condiments for cooking. He started this business in 2002, and it provides the sustenance for his humble home, which includes his partner and three children, who are all adults. 

A loan would be of great help to Victor, who did not receive support from other institutions because they did not trust him. Now that he knows of the wonderful support that he can receive from Interactuar, he is requesting a loan to buy raw materials such as cloves, cinnamon, and cumin in order to continue developing his business and to improve his family's quality of life. He will do this with the help of possible alliances with stores and mini markets. He will offer them his services, since he will have the raw material to fill orders, which previously was his main obstacle to continue moving forward with his business. For this reason, support Victor and do not hinder his progress.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as cloves, cinnamon, and cumin.

loans.name: Freedom 2 Group

texts.en: These three women, who come from the same neighborhood, are part of the Freedom 2 Group. They are bound by good social, economic, and business relationships. They are selling cooked beans and ripe plantain, diapers, corn, cassava dough, kenkey (cooked corn), and fish. Beatrice, who is 63, is the group's representative. She's standing in the right side of the photograph. She's married and the mother of one dependent child. Beatrice is a merchant. Her new loan request will enable her to buy beans and plantain, prepare fried plantain, and cook beans to sell to customers. The generated profits will enable her to cover her child's food and health needs, but will also help strengthen her savings.

loans.use: To buy beans and plantain, prepare fried plantain, and cook beans to sell to customers.

loans.name: Martina

texts.es: La señora Martina vive en la población de Entre Rios en el trópico de Cochabamba, junto a su esposo y sus tres hijos, trabaja en el área agrícola produciendo el cultivo de piña, lo comercializa a intermediarios que compran en su actividad económica, ella es una persona trabajadora y dedicada a su actividad cada día se esfuerza por el bienestar de sus hijos. Quiere seguir mejorando sus ingresos y así continuar contribuyendo al estudio de sus hijos que ya están en el nivel primario y secundario, actualmente requiere un crédito para poder realizar la ampliación de la superficie de su parcela de piña y con esto mejorar sus ingresos y poder seguir apoyando a sus hijos en sus estudios.
texts.en:
Sra. Martina lives with her husband and three children in the town of Entre Rios, which is in the tropics of Cochabamba. She works in agriculture by producing pineapples. Martina sells her products to brokers who buy them for their businesses. She is a hardworking individual who is devoted to her business each day so that she can provide for the welfare of her children.

Martina wants to keep improving her earnings so that she can continue to contribute to her children’s education. They are studying at the primary and secondary level. She is currently requesting a loan because she wants to expand her plot of land for growing pineapple. By improving her earnings, she can continue to support her children’s studies.

loans.use: to acquire more land for growing pineapples, which would help her to continue supporting her children's education.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita, 54 years old  is single and a resident of Poblacion, Sibutad, Philippines. She supports her three orphaned nephews, two of whom are in school. Starting with capital of 3,000 PHP, Carmelita opened a sari-sari (general store) and was able to expand it with the help of Paglaum Cooperative. She was also able to generate savings and enjoy the benefits provided by the co-op. Carmelita became a member in April 2013 and has taken out three loans. 

Carmelita is now applying for a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy additional stocks for her sari-sari store, particularly basic commodities. In the future, she wants to own a mini-mart and will be fully satisfied if she sees her nephews finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy stocks of basic commodities for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy wholesale clothing and shoes.

loans.name: Vilma Estela

texts.es:
Vilma, de 71 años, no estudió, está casada, su esposo trabaja de motorista, tiene cuatro hijos, los cuales no viven con ella porque están casados y tienen sus propios hogares.

Vilma, no tiene negocio, solamente es pensionada por los EEUU, pero tiene vacas lecheras.- Antes, trabajaba como empleada.- Las vacas las tiene a 4 cuadras de su casa y viaja a pie para ir a darles de comer y beber; su esposo le ayuda para hacer estas labores y su horario es de 7:00 a.m. a 4:00 p.m. 

Vilma, ocupará el crédito para gastos médicos, el préstamo le mejorará su condición de salud y por lo tanto tendrá mejor calidad de vida.

Sus sueños son, poder tener más vacas lecheras y aves de corral.
texts.en: Vilma is 71 years old and she didn't attend school. She is married and her husband works as a driver. She has four children, none of whom live with her as they are married and have their own homes. Vilma doesn't have a business, she is retired from the US, but has milking cows. Previously she worked as an employee. Her cows are located 4 blocks from her home and she travels by foot to give them food and drink. Her husband helps her with this work and she works from 7 AM until 4 PM. Vilma will use the loan to pay medical expenses. The loan will improve her health condition and she will have a better quality of life. Her dreams are to be able to have more milk cows and poultry.

loans.use: to pay medical expenses.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia es de la ciudad de Villarrica, está casada, tiene 3 hijos, por quienes está luchando y esforzándose.
Está estudiando la carrera de nutrición, a través de la cual quiere ir abriéndose camino para poder ser una profesional exitosa.
Pide este préstamo para poder cubrir sus gastos de titulación.
texts.en:
Julia is from the city of Villarrica. She is married and has three children, so she strives and works hard on their behalf.

Julia is studying for a degree in Nutrition. She hopes that this will open doors so that she can become a successful professional. Julia is requesting this loan so that she can cover her degree expenses.

loans.use: to pay her degree expenses.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for one year. She earns additional income from food vending.

Gina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation. She has successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. 

She is borrowing 10,000 Philipinne pesos through NWTF. She will use the loan for her fish vending business to purchase more fish to sell to her customers.

She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell to her customers

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Milagros has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Honorata

texts.en:

Honorata has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of loans from Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation. She is now borrowing 12,000 Philippine pesos through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy additional raw materials for her roofing-making business.

She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional raw materials for her roofing-making business

loans.name: Esterlita

Esterlita has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a 15,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish stall.

Esterlita has been in this business for ten years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.name: Panfila

texts.en:
Panfila is a married woman, 51 years old, with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Panfila has a personal products sales business in the Philippines. She requested a 21,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional beauty products,  like lipstick, make-up, etc., to sell at her business.

Panfila has been in this business for six years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional beauty products, like lipstick, make-up, etc., to sell at her business.

loans.name: Mae

texts.en:
Mae is 48 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for her family.

Mae runs a business selling soft drinks in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more drinks like Coke, Sprite, etc. to sell in her business.

Mae has been in this business for eight years. Her goal is to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more drinks like Coke, Sprite, etc. to sell in her business

loans.name: Daniel Group

texts.en:
Nemneineng, the profiled borrower of the group, is a 20-year-old businesswoman. Even though she got married at a young age, she never feels discouraged to have a child and build her own family. She is now blessed with a baby boy and works hard to provide the necessary requirements of her child. She is pictured with her hand raised with the rest of the group members.

Her main activity for income generation is selling of used clothes at the roadside. Used clothes are very common in the area, due to their low cost. Many people who cannot afford costly brand new clothes opted for used clothes to meet their needs, and it can be easily afforded.

The income she derives from selling used clothes is used for the household expenditures, and she has been the main source of income for the family. She takes her child with her every day to her business place, since she does not have anyone to look after the baby at home. She is energetic and works very hard to meet their daily requirements. Her baby boy has been the source of inspiration for her unending devotion to her family.

With the Kiva loan, she will buy stock of used clothes for selling. She will be able to sell more items to attract more customers. She hopes to sell more items, which will help her family to achieve their financial goals. She says, “Thank you.”

The other group members are also engaged in similar businesses and strive towards financial efficiency through the Kiva loan. They are very happy to access a loan, which will help them to promote their business endeavours.

loans.use: to buy stock of used clothes and to sell them for income generation.

loans.name: Sunshine Group

texts.en:
A multi-skilled woman of 37 years, Chinneineu engages in weaving and tailoring to earn her income. She is the featured borrower of the group and is pictured with her hand raised.

Hailing from a small village in the hills, she has been bestowed with eagerness to learn new things from her young age onwards. She is a strong woman who never fails in her duty as a mother and a wife. She works hard to provide for her family.

She is engaged in weaving traditional shawls as her primary occupation. The income derived from her weaving is used to provide for the household expenses. In order to attract customers, she designs the shawls with unique combinations of colours and makes fine patterns with minimum flaws. Sadly, she cannot make as many shawls as she desires due to lack of weaving materials, including yarn of her choice. She also does tailoring works for her family and limits tailoring works for outsiders.

She now aspires to buy stock of yarn according to her liking and sell many traditional shawls to draw maximum profit, which will provide sufficient income for her family. The Kiva loan will be used to buy the desirable stock of yarn that will be used in her weaving.

She is delighted to be sailing towards making her dreams come true. She says, “Thank you, Kiva.”

The other group members are all very hardworking and strive towards financial independence. They are very cooperative and aspire to save some amount regularly from their earnings.

loans.use: to buy stock of yarn with different textures and colours for weaving traditional shawls.

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn is a 28-year-old married woman, with two children who are currently in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Roselyn has a egg vending business in the Philippines. She requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more trays of eggs to sell.

Roselyn has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more trays of eggs to sell.

texts.en:
Analita is 41 years old and has eight children. She is married and seven of her children are currently in school.

Analita is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines. She requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Analita has been in this business for four years now, and has borrowed 19 times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business.

In the future, Analita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza, 44, is a married woman with three children who are currently in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Analiza has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a 28,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish stall.

Analiza has been in this business for 21 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish stall.

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
Jovelyn is 33 years old and single.  

Jovelyn is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines. She requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Jovelyn has been in this business for three years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Jovelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Byron Jose

texts.es: Byron nació en un lugar llamado el sardinal en el municipio de Jinotega en el año de 1978. Byron desde pequeño se dedico  trabajar en agricultura en las fincas cercanas él ya que su familia es de escasos recursos económicos. Comenta que el vivió con sus padres hasta la edad de 15 años. Byron está casado con Melania y tiene 4 hijos los tres mayores ya están estudiando en la escuela de la comunidad. El ha trabajado toda su vida y con mucho esfuerzo pudo comprar unas tierritas en la que tiene sembrado café, en estas tierras trabaja con sus hijos, también ha podido hacer su casa el dice que es una casita humilde, donde viven él y su familia. En esta comunidad del sardinal no hay luz eléctrica, el se tiene que alumbrar con foco, y un panel pequeño que pudo conseguir pero está fallando junto con la batería, es por eso que el solicita un préstamo para la compra de un panel solar con su batería y controlador, de esta manera y poder alumbrarse por las noches y que sus hijos puedan hacer las tareas por las noches y su señora pueda hacer el desayuno por las madrugadas ya que Byron se tiene que levantar bien de mañana para trasladarse a la finca donde trabaja. Byron estaría muy agradecido si le brindan la oportunidad de este préstamo.
texts.en:
Byron was born in 1978 in the community of El Sardinal, part of the municipality of Jinotega. He has worked in neighboring farms from a very young age, since he comes from a low-income family. He lived with his parents until he was fifteen.

Byron is married to Melania and they have four children, the three older now attending the local school. He has been working all his life, and with a lot effort he was able to buy a little land where he plants coffee, he works the field with his children, and here he also built his home. It is a small, humble house, he comments, where he lives with his family.

In the Sardinal community there is no electricity, so he has to use flashlights and a small panel that he got ahold of, but it is failing together with the battery. This is why he is asking for a loan to buy a solar panel with its battery and controller. This way they will have light in the evenings, his children will be able to do their homework from school, and his wife will be able to prepare breakfast at dawn since Byron has to leave the house pretty early in the morning to get to the farm where he works.

Byron is very grateful for the opportunity to get this loan.

loans.use: to buy a solar energy system

loans.name: Juan Edgar

texts.es: Edgar es un señor bastante dinámico, se dedica desde hace 15 años a hornear maní  procesarlo y empacarlo en diferentes modalidades para su comercialización, como medio de ingresos, es casado, con un hijo a su cargo al que apoya en su desarrollo académico, este señor se presento a Ceprodel para solicitar financiamiento el que utilizaría en la Compra de Mani en Cascara, para posterior procesarlo y de esa manera mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Edgar is quite a dynamic man. He has been making a living roasting peanuts that he processes and packages in different ways for their sale. He is married and has one daughter that he looks after and finances her education. Recently he came to Ceprodel to ask for a loan that he will use to purchase peanuts still in their shells to later process them and in this way improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase peanuts still in their shells.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 46 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Teresa has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional materials and gear for her fishing business.

Teresa has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials and gear for her fishing business.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en:
Beatriz works hard to support her family. She is married, lives in the Philippines, and has a general store that she has been running for 10 years now.

Beatriz has requested a 45,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to purchase additional items to sell such as canned goods, noodles, fabric conditioners, cooking oil, coffee, biscuits, etc. 

In the future, Beatriz would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell such as canned goods, noodles, fabric conditioners, cooking oil, coffee, biscuits, etc.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 66 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Cecilia has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

Cecilia has been in this business for 20 years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Christina works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Christina requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store. She has been in this business for six years now.

Christina would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 48 years old, married, and has one child. She works very hard to provide for her family.

Marilou runs a general store in the Philippines where she sells a variety of items such as canned goods, candies, and snack foods.

Marilou has been in this business for 5 years, and now she has requested a 19,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy more items to sell like candies, snack foods, soft drinks, canned goods, etc. 

Marilou would like to save enough money to be able to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as candies, snack foods, soft drinks, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Hala

texts.en:
Hala is a 57-year-old Lebanese married woman with three kids. Her husband works in repairing cars and is the main income source for the family. Six years ago, she started producing homemade food within the confines of her home in order to help her husband with the household expenses. 

Hala states that she is happy to receive the loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to purchase raw materials for her project, which will increase productivity and profits.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for her project

loans.name: Garba

texts.en:
Garba is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Garba joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Hadrate, Tsafania and Friday. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Garba would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Garba can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked, Garba spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to ensure his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: To pay for children's school fees and uniforms, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Christo Nti Group

texts.en:
The Christo Nti Group consists of two members who live in Teshie, Accra, Ghana. They have applied for a loan of GHS 1,800 from ID Ghana to invest in trousers, shirt and vegetables. 

Gladys is a 49-year-old, married woman who lives in Teshie, Accra, Ghana, with her family. She is the featured borrower. She has been selling vegetables (garden eggs, tomatoes, peppers, and onions), for 26 years. Currently, she wants to buy garden eggs, tomatoes, peppers and onion, but she doesn't have enough capital. She decided to apply for a loan of GHS 1,000 from ID Ghana in order to purchase more garden eggs, tomatoes, peppers and onions, and then sell them to customers. Gladys looks forward to improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase more garden eggs, tomatoes, pepper and onion, and then sell them to customers.
